scoringSystem: Once the story is completed, rate it on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity, organization, and how well it incorporates the initial text inspiration. Alternatively, if the other person in the room is available, they can provide subjective feedback and scoring based on the same criteria.
name: few_human17_0.0

taskDescription: Rearrange the items in the room to create an aesthetically pleasing art display setup around the sofa and rug area.
detailedSetting: Begin by repositioning the paintings and the poster above or around the sofa. Place the potted plant either beside or on the rug in proximity to the sofa. Ensure that the clock can be easily seen as part of the display. Arrange these elements to complement each other and create a visually appealing space.
goalSetting: The goal is to create a harmonious and visually appealing living area using the available items for aesthetic pleasure.
scoringSystem: Evaluate the arrangement on a 1-10 scale based on creativity, balance, and overall aesthetic. If the other person is available, they can provide feedback and a score as well, allowing for a combined average score to determine the effectiveness of the arrangement.
name: few_human17_0.0

taskDescription: Participants compete to stack a tower of books on a tray while balancing it on the sofa's armrest.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on one armrest of the sofa. The participant sits comfortably on the sofa and uses four books to construct a tower on the tray. Ensure the tray is steady and that the participant has easy reach of all items.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest tower with four books on the tray without it toppling over.
scoringSystem: Each successfully stacked book earns 1 point. If all four books are stacked without falling, the player earns a bonus of 2 additional points, making the maximum score for a perfect stack 6 points. If the tower falls, only the points for books successfully stacked before the crash are counted.
name: few_human18_0.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns attempting to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from a distance, simulating a basketball game in a confined space.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can in one corner of the room. Set the chair at a designated distance (approximately 5 feet) away from the trash can. One participant sits on the chair and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can. The other participant can act as a referee and retrieve the ball.
goalSetting: The objective is to score as many baskets (successful throws) as possible within five attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket scores 2 points. The participant with the highest total after five attempts is the winner. In case of a tie, participants continue with one throw each until one scores higher.
name: few_human19_0.0

taskDescription: Players create riddles based on visual clues or themes from the poster to challenge each other.
detailedSetting: Hang the poster on a wall that's easily visible. Each player takes turns examining the poster for inspiration and then writes a riddle in the notebook using the pen. The other person guesses the answer.
goalSetting: The aim is to successfully guess as many riddles as possible.
scoringSystem: Each correct guess earns 1 point. The player with the most points at the end of four rounds wins. Bonus point awarded for most creative riddle as judged by the other player (this point can resolve ties).
name: few_human19_0.0

taskDescription: A fun balancing act where participants try to walk across a designated area with books balanced on their head without dropping them.
detailedSetting: Set a starting point on the sofa and a finishing line on the other side of the room (approximately 10 feet apart). Place the pillow near the endpoint as a marker. Each player balances three books on their head and attempts to walk from the sofa to the pillow without letting any book fall.
goalSetting: The goal is to walk the full distance without dropping any books.
scoringSystem: Players score 5 points each for completing the walk with all books. Lose 1 point for each book dropped. If a player drops a book but retrieves it without touching the floor, they lose no points for that instance. The player with the highest score after three attempts wins.
name: few_human19_0.0

taskDescription: Players take turns tossing a waste paper ball at a pillow target set up on a sofa from a designated distance.
detailedSetting: Place a pillow vertically on one end of the sofa, which acts as the target. The players stand at the opposite end of the room, a few paces away from the sofa. Each player takes turns tossing the waste paper ball, trying to land it on or against the pillow.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully hit the pillow target with the waste paper ball as many times as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful hit on the pillow scores 1 point. Each player has 10 tosses per game. The player with the highest score after their respective tosses wins.
name: few_human20_0.0

taskDescription: Two players compete to see who can prepare a cup of tea the fastest and accurately record the process with creative writing.
detailedSetting: Set up the kettle and cups on the desk. Each player must boil water using the kettle and pour it into a cup. While the water is heating, they must read a passage from a selected book aloud to add complexity to the challenge.
goalSetting: The objective is to prepare a cup of tea and simultaneously perform a creative reading task as quickly and accurately as possible.
scoringSystem: Time taken to complete the task is recorded. Penalties (5 seconds added) for each mistake in reading from the book aloud (mispronunciations, skipped words). The winner is the player with the lowest adjusted time.
name: few_human20_0.0

taskDescription: Players design an indoor garden layout using a rug as a base, sketching their plant placement ideas in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Spread the rug out in the center of the room. Place the potted plant on one side of it. The players use the notebook and pen to sketch a floor plan layout of how they would use additional plants to create an aesthetically pleasing indoor garden.
goalSetting: To design a creative and well-thought-out indoor garden floor plan that maximizes space and considers plant aesthetics.
scoringSystem: Each design is judged on creativity, use of space, and practicality on a scale from 1 to 10. Scores from any other people present are averaged to determine the winner.
name: few_human20_0.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns tossing a waste paper ball towards a trash can placed at a distance. The objective is to score by getting the ball into the trash can from a specified distance while seated on a chair.
detailedSetting: Set up the chair on one side of the room, ensuring there's enough space in front. Place the trash can at a challenging but feasible distance (e.g., about two meters away from the chair). Participants sit on the chair and take turns tossing the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible from the seated position.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can scores 1 point. Each player gets ten throws per round. The participant with the highest score after three rounds is the winner.
name: many_dummy1_0.0

taskDescription: Participants use building blocks to create the tallest stable tower on a desk without it toppling over. The challenge is to build the tallest structure with the limited blocks available.
detailedSetting: Place all five building blocks on the desk, ready for use. Participants stand or sit next to the desk and stack the blocks vertically, trying to create a stable tower.
goalSetting: Construct the tallest stable tower using all five building blocks.
scoringSystem: The tower is measured in terms of the number of whole blocks stacked vertically before collapsing. Each block successfully placed on the stable tower earns 1 point. The highest number of blocks reached without a collapse wins.
name: many_dummy1_0.0

taskDescription: Participants compose a short melody on the kalimba and record their composition in the notebook. They have a limited time to create and memorize a catchy tune.
detailedSetting: Seat the participant with easy access to the kalimba, notebook, and pen. Place the clock nearby to keep track of time. The participant experiments with different sequences and writes down their melody in the notebook.
goalSetting: Create a memorable 30-second melody on the kalimba and play it consistently without looking at the notes.
scoringSystem: The participant has 10 minutes to create and practice the melody. After the time expires, they perform it from memory. Points are given based on creativity (1-5), complexity (1-5), and the ability to perform without errors (1-5), for a total out of 15 points.
name: many_dummy1_0.0

taskDescription: A race against time to clean and organize the space using available items.
detailedSetting: Spread the waste paper ball and two clothes hangers randomly around the room. Place the dummy in a random corner and set the trash can on the opposite side. The player's task is to pick up the waste paper ball, hang the clothes on the dummy using the hangers, and sweep any imaginary dust on the floor to a corner closest to the door.
goalSetting: Organize and tidy the room by completing the listed tasks as quickly as possible.
scoringSystem: Time taken to complete the task is recorded. Each second counts for 1 point deduction. Starting with a score of 100, points are deducted per second taken to complete all tasks. Completing everything under 60 seconds retains maximum points.
name: many_dummy2_0.0

taskDescription: A game that combines music and quick thinking, requiring the participant to find hidden objects while a kalimba soundtrack plays.
detailedSetting: Hide the notebook and pen somewhere in the room but in sight. Set the clock on top of a desk as the timer device. The participant plays a short tune on the kalimba—using any melody they prefer—while another person controls the TV to create background music.
goalSetting: Find the hidden notebook and pen before the tune ends.
scoringSystem: The success is measured in how quickly the task is completed. Completing within the kalimba tune (approx. 2 minutes) gives 10 points. If it takes longer, each additional 10 seconds results in 1 point deduction.
name: many_dummy2_0.0

taskDescription: Participants build a structure with building blocks and attempt to knock it down by tossing it into a trash can from a chair.
detailedSetting: Position the chair approximately 6 feet away from the trash can. Stack the five building blocks to form a tall structure inside the trash can. Participants take turns sitting on the chair and tossing a block or any item they choose from the chair to dismantle the structure.
goalSetting: The goal is to dismantle the building block structure by knocking it over. The objective is to use accuracy and aim to successfully topple the blocks within as few throws as possible.
scoringSystem: Each participant starts with 50 points. For every successful topple of the building blocks, they retain all 50 points. If unsuccessful, 10 points are deducted per additional attempt required. The participant with the highest remaining points is the winner.
name: many_dummy3_0.0

taskDescription: Participants perform a mini-concert using the Kalimba while setting a relaxed ambience.
detailedSetting: Set the poster on the wall in plain view from the sofa, creating a focal point. Sit or recline comfortably on the sofa holding the Kalimba. The poster acts as a backdrop for a musical journey, with viewers reminiscing or visualizing different themes it might inspire.
goalSetting: The objective is to perform a soothing or entertaining piece of music on the Kalimba inspired by the images or text on the poster.
scoringSystem: After the performance, self-assess using a scale from 1 to 10 based on creativity, mood setting, and enjoyment. Add additional points (up to 20) if the piece resonates with the themes of the poster for theme alignment. A total score out of 30 is possible.
name: many_dummy3_0.0

taskDescription: Use the newspaper to find and document a series of puzzle solutions or trivia within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Place the desk in a well-lit area of the room. Sit at the desk with the newspaper, notebook, and pen in front of you. The newspaper entries, such as crosswords, Sudoku, or trivia snippets, will serve as the puzzle medium.
goalSetting: Solve as many puzzles or trivia pieces as possible from the newspaper article to complete a page in the notebook within a specified time limit, such as 15 minutes.
scoringSystem: Each completed puzzle or trivia item scores 5 points. Bonus points of 10 are given for completing an entire newspaper section. The participant with the highest total score wins.
name: many_dummy3_0.0

taskDescription: A fun game of tossing a paper ball into a basket to see how many points can be scored from varying distances.
detailedSetting: Place the basket (or trash can) at one end of the room. Set up two chairs at different distances from the basket, one closer and one farther away, marking the distances clearly. The waste paper ball will be used as the object to toss.
goalSetting: The goal is to score as many points as possible by successfully tossing the waste paper ball into the basket from different distances.
scoringSystem: Successfully tossing the ball into the basket from the closer chair earns 1 point, while from the farther chair earns 3 points. Count how many points are scored in ten tosses. The player with the most points wins. If alone, challenge your past scores or set a target to beat.
name: many_dummy4_0.0

taskDescription: Construct the tallest possible tower using books and building blocks, and balance them on a tray.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on a stable surface in the room. Use books as the base and build the tower upwards by alternating between blocks and book layers. Test different configurations to maximize height without toppling the tower.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest possible tower without it falling over.
scoringSystem: Each successful layer (consisting of at least one book and one block) added without the tower collapsing scores 2 points. Add up all points when the tower can no longer stand. Compete against previous attempts or set a height goal as a milestone to beat.
name: many_dummy4_0.0

taskDescription: Create a series of music rhythms using a kalimba, writing down the sequences and timing them to achieve longer playing time.
detailedSetting: Sit on the chair with the kalimba in hand and the notebook on your lap. Set the clock to time how long you can continuously play music with different rhythms. Use the pen to jot down notes/melodies in the notebook as you invent them.
goalSetting: The aim is to play music for the longest duration without stopping and to develop creatively engaging rhythm sequences.
scoringSystem: The score is determined by the number of unique sequences created (1 point per sequence) plus a point for each full minute of continuous play. Bonus points can be granted for creativity on a scale of 1-5. Aim for improving scores with practice or see how many new sequences you can develop in a session.
name: many_dummy4_0.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest possible tower using the building blocks on the seat of a chair.
detailedSetting: Place a chair in the middle of the room. Use the set of 5 building blocks to construct a tower on the chair's seat. The goal is to create a tower as tall and stable as possible without it toppling over. The participant should stand while assembling the tower and can only use one hand.
goalSetting: Construct the tallest and most stable tower of building blocks on the chair using only one hand.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in block units. Each complete block height earns 1 point. An additional 2 points are awarded if the tower remains standing for 30 seconds after completion. Total score is the sum of points for height and stability. Maximum potential score: 7 points.
name: many_dummy5_0.0

taskDescription: Test and improve your tossing accuracy by attempting to throw a waste paper ball and a basketball into a trash can from different distances.
detailedSetting: Place the waste paper ball and the basketball at a starting distance of 5 feet from the trash can. Use the chair or designated spots on the rug to mark specific distances from 5 to 10 feet. The participant starts from the closest mark and progresses further as they successfully toss the items into the trash can. The participant alternates between throwing the waste paper ball and the basketball.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully toss both the waste paper ball and the basketball into the trash can from each marked distance.
scoringSystem: - Each successful toss of the waste paper ball into the trash can scores 1 point. - Each successful toss of the basketball into the trash can scores 2 points. The player totals their score after attempting all distances, with a perfect score being 9 points if all waste paper balls and basketball tosses are successful from each distance.
name: many_dummy6_0.0

taskDescription: Create a short melody using the kalimba and express your mood through music. Complement your creation by writing a brief description or poem about how the melody reflects your current mood.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa with the kalimba, notebook, and pen within reach. Spend time playing the kalimba to discover melodies, then settle on a short tune that best matches your mood. Write a short description or poem in the notebook explaining your melody and mood.
goalSetting: The objective is to create a melody that reflects your current mood and pair it with a written description or poem that offers additional context or emotion.
scoringSystem: Rate your creative satisfaction on a scale from 1 to 5: - 5: Very satisfied with both the melody and written expression - 4: Satisfied, with room for improvement - 3: Neutral, met the basics but could do better - 2: Slightly dissatisfied, felt disconnected from the task - 1: Very dissatisfied, unable to connect or express mood.
name: many_dummy6_0.0

taskDescription: Create the tallest stable structure by stacking books and building blocks in alternating layers on a desk. Test your engineering skill and steady hand by achieving maximum height without toppling.
detailedSetting: Use one of the desks as the base for your construction. Stack a book followed by a building block and alternate until all items are used. Arrange the books in a stable manner and attempt to balance the building blocks on top of them.
goalSetting: The objective is to build the tallest possible structure that remains standing for at least 10 seconds without collapsing or needing support.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the structure in inches or centimeters from the desk surface, using any available measurement tool (e.g., a piece of string with known length or estimation by hand-span). Award 1 point for each inch or equivalent, bonus 2 points if the full stacked tower remains stable for an additional 30 seconds. Total points reflect your structural prowess.
name: many_dummy6_0.0

taskDescription: Participants compete to build the tallest tower using building blocks within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on the table to serve as a building surface. Distribute the building blocks evenly among participants or use them collectively if alone. Other items in the room serve as the audience or decor to enhance the gaming atmosphere.
goalSetting: Construct the tallest possible tower using the blocks on the tray in under 5 minutes.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in inches or centimeters after 5 minutes. Each inch or centimeter earns 1 point. If the tower collapses before time's up, zero points are awarded. The objective is to have the most points from a standing structure at the end of the time.
name: many_dummy7_0.0

taskDescription: Time yourself or a friend playing a sequence of notes on the kalimba as accurately and quickly as possible.
detailedSetting: Use the clock to track time intervals. Sit on the sofa or chair with the kalimba. The player begins at the top of the hour or a specifically designated time.
goalSetting: Play a set sequence of notes on the kalimba as perfectly and swiftly as possible, aiming to match or beat a personal time record.
scoringSystem: Base score on the correct notes played in sequence, with each correct note earning 1 point. Deduct 1 point for each mistake. Add a bonus point for finishing the sequence under a minute. The total points determine the score, aiming for accuracy and speed.
name: many_dummy7_0.0

taskDescription: Toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from increasing distances seated in a chair.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can in a fixed position. Set up the chair at varying distances: 2 feet, 4 feet, and 6 feet from the trash can. Use the waste paper ball for tossing.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from each designated distance.
scoringSystem: Earn 2 points for a successful toss from 2 feet, 4 points from 4 feet, and 6 points from 6 feet. Record the total score after three attempts from each distance. The highest possible score is 12 points.
name: many_dummy7_0.0

taskDescription: Participants create a unique and imaginative illustration of a chess scenario inspired by the paintings in the room.
detailedSetting: Place the chessboard on a desk, with the notebook and pen beside it. Set the paintings up in view of the participant. The participant examines the paintings for thematic inspiration, then arranges the chess pieces in a creative formation that tells a story or theme observed from the paintings. They then sketch this scenario in the notebook.
goalSetting: The objective is to create a story or theme depicted using the chess pieces, inspired by the paintings.
scoringSystem: The chess scenario is judged on creativity, coherence with the painting inspiration, and thematic storytelling. A subjective score can be awarded from 1-10, with 10 being highly creative and well-told, and 1 being less coherent or lacking in theme representation.
name: many_dummy8_0.0

taskDescription: The participant tries to balance a tennis ball while walking on a treadmill without it dropping off the chair.
detailedSetting: Set up two chairs on either side of the treadmill. Place the tennis ball on one chair. The participant walks on the treadmill, attempting to balance the ball on the chair without it falling off. The objective is to keep the tennis ball steady, simulating a coordination challenge.
goalSetting: The task is aimed at honing focus and balance, keeping the tennis ball from falling as long as possible.
scoringSystem: The participant earns 1 point for every minute the tennis ball remains balanced. A bonus of 5 points is awarded if the ball remains on the chair for more than 10 minutes. The game can be played multiple rounds with scores tallied.
name: many_dummy8_0.0

taskDescription: Utilize building blocks to create a scene or structure that reflects a story derived from the book, with the dummy acting as a central character.
detailedSetting: Set the dummy on the sofa, in a reading position with an open book. Use the building blocks to create a mini-scene or backdrop that portrays a part of the story found in the book. You may lay out blocks on the floor next to the dummy to construct the scene.
goalSetting: Construct a scene that visually narrates a part of the book's story, with the dummy adding context.
scoringSystem: A score of 1-10 is given based on how well the scene visually represents the book's storyline, creativity, and integration of the dummy as a character. Higher scores reflect clear storytelling and innovative block usage.
name: many_dummy8_0.0

taskDescription: Construct the tallest stable tower using building blocks on a tray, and use rolled dice to determine additional building conditions.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on the desk, and place the building blocks next to it. The dice should be used to roll to determine building conditions before each block placement. The participant sits in the chair at the desk and begins constructing the tower by stacking blocks on the tray. The number rolled on the dice determines how each block must be placed (e.g., upright, sideways, diagonally).
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest tower possible while following the placement rules indicated by the dice rolls, maximizing height without causing the tower to collapse.
scoringSystem: Each successfully placed block earns 2 points. If the dice condition is met (e.g., upright placement on a roll of 6), an additional 1 point is awarded. The tower collapses or exceeds the tray's boundary ends the task. The final score is the total of all points achieved before the tower collapses.
name: many_dummy9_0.0

taskDescription: Compose a simple and original melody using the kalimba, which is then recorded in the notebook.
detailedSetting: The participant sits on the chair with the kalimba in hand. The notebook and pen are kept on their lap or a nearby surface. The player experiments with different notes on the kalimba to create a melody of at least 8 measures long, writing it down in the notebook as they go along.
goalSetting: The goal is to creatively compose an 8-measure melody on the kalimba and accurately record it in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Creativity and completeness are graded out of 10 points by self-assessment or another participant in the scenario (if present). Creativity is worth up to 5 points based on the uniqueness of the melody, and accuracy in notation is worth up to 5 points. The total possible score is 10 points.
name: many_dummy9_0.0

taskDescription: Light a friendly competition to see who can accurately toss a waste paper ball into a trash can over increasing distances.
detailedSetting: Set the trash can a few feet in front of the sofa. The starting line is marked with a rolled-up newspaper on the floor. The participant assumes a seating position on the sofa and uses the waste paper ball for tossing. After each successful toss, the newspaper mark is moved further away from the trash can to increase difficulty.
goalSetting: The objective is to successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from varying distances.
scoringSystem: Start with 1 point for each successful toss. As the distance increases (by moving the newspaper mark in 1-foot increments), each subsequent successful toss earns an additional point. For example, a successful toss from 2 feet earns 2 points, from 3 feet earns 3 points, and so on. The game lasts until a pre-set distance or until the participant deems the challenge complete.
name: many_dummy9_0.0

taskDescription: Players take turns trying to make a successful shot of the waste paper ball into the potted plant acting as a basket.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on the floor as the shooting area. Position the potted plant at a reasonable distance from the tray. The player stands on the tray and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the potted plant. The basketball is not used for throwing but can be used for inspiration and as a distance marker.
goalSetting: Successfully land the waste paper ball into the potted plant from the tray for points.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the potted plant is worth 1 point. Players take turns, and after 10 shots each, the player with the most points wins.
name: many_dummy10_0.0

taskDescription: Players build a structure with the blocks and test its stability by gently nudging the treadmill while the structure is on the tray.
detailedSetting: Place the rug on the floor near the treadmill and put the tray on it to minimize movement. Participants build a structure using all five building blocks on the tray. Once the structure is complete, they will gently push the treadmill to see if the structure remains standing. Use the dice to determine how many times the treadmill is nudged.
goalSetting: Construct a stable structure that can withstand the nudges determined by the dice roll without toppling.
scoringSystem: Each nudge the structure withstands adds 1 point. Roll the dice once to determine the number of nudges—between 1 to 6. If the structure stands after all nudges, the player scores the full points shown on the dice.
name: many_dummy10_0.0

taskDescription: Compose a short musical piece using the kalimba influenced by a random stimulus from the TV.
detailedSetting: Turn on the TV to a random channel and watch for two minutes to gather inspiration. Using the notebook and pen, jot down a few keywords or themes that come to mind. Create a short piece on the kalimba based on the notes you took.
goalSetting: Compose and perform a brief musical piece (30 to 60 seconds) using the stimulus gathered from the TV as inspiration.
scoringSystem: Participants or an observer rate the performance on a scale of 1 to 10 based on creativity, relevance to the keywords/themes, and musicality. Higher total score indicates a better composition.
name: many_dummy10_0.0

taskDescription: Compose and perform a short melody using the kalimba, noting the composition steps and final tune in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Place the kalimba, notebook, and pen on a desk. Sit on a chair facing the desk. Use the pen to jot down each note as you experiment with the kalimba to create a melody. The composition should be simple and last between 30 seconds to a minute. After noting down the melody, play it continuously to finalize the composition.
goalSetting: The goal is to create a coherent and harmonious melody using the kalimba, documented and repeated accurately from memory after composition.
scoringSystem: - Creativity of the melody: 1 to 5 points (1 for basic and 5 for highly creative and pleasant). - Accuracy in playing the composed melody from memory without looking at the notes: 1 to 5 points. - Successful completion of the melody's length (30 seconds to 1 minute): 1 point for each 10-second completed section.
name: many_dummy11_0.0

taskDescription: In this stacking game, players must roll a dice to determine how many building blocks and bowls they stack in alternating order.
detailedSetting: Arrange the building blocks and bowls on the rug to begin. The player rolls the dice to determine the number of blocks and bowls to stack (e.g., rolling a 3 would mean stacking 3 blocks and 3 bowls in alternating order). The player must create a stable tower without it toppling over. If one quantity runs out, the player continues stacking with the available type of item.
goalSetting: Build the tallest stack using the rolled number of items without it collapsing.
scoringSystem: - Each stacked layer beyond the rolled number scores 2 extra points. - Deduct 1 point for each layer that falls during stacking. - Bonus of 5 points for stacking all items successfully.
name: many_dummy11_0.0

taskDescription: A target game where books are thrown onto a "target" area created by pillows on a sofa, with additional points for landing a waste paper ball precisely.
detailedSetting: Arrange the pillows on the sofa to create a target zone. Stand at a predetermined distance from the sofa. Using the books as toss items, aim to land them on the pillow target zone. After the books, toss the waste paper ball aiming for the exact center of the pillows.
goalSetting: Successfully land the books within the pillow target and the waste paper ball at the center of the target.
scoringSystem: - Each book landing on a pillow: 3 points. - If a book lands outside the target, no points. - Successfully landing the waste paper ball in the center: 10 points bonus. - Total score is the sum of book scores and possible waste paper ball bonus.
name: many_dummy11_0.0

taskDescription: Create a short melody using the kalimba and write it down in the notebook for others to enjoy or critique.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa or a chair with the kalimba in hand. Have the notebook and pen ready on a desk nearby. Begin experimenting with sounds on the kalimba, jotting down each note's reference or a sketch of the melody as you play.
goalSetting: Compose an original and pleasing melody using the kalimba, filling a page in the notebook with the musical notes or descriptions.
scoringSystem: Rate the composed melody on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity, flow, and enjoyment. An additional point can be earned if the melody is over 16 notes long. Have a friend or the dummy (as a non-verbal listener) give 'feedback' based on how good you think they 'felt' about it.
name: many_dummy12_0.0

taskDescription: Stack the building blocks on a tray placed at the edge of a desk, carefully balancing them without causing a collapse.
detailedSetting: Place the tray at the edge of the desk. Start stacking the building blocks one by one on the tray, aiming to build the tallest balanced structure.
goalSetting: Successfully stack all five building blocks on the tray without them falling.
scoringSystem: Score 1 point for each block successfully stacked without collapse. An additional 2 points can be earned if the entire structure remains upright for 30 seconds after the last block is placed.
name: many_dummy12_0.0

taskDescription: Examine the details in both paintings and note observations. Write a short puzzle or riddle in the notebook based on these observations.
detailedSetting: Sit in front of the paintings, notebook, and pen in hand. Spend dedicated time observing details, colors, and scenes in both paintings, and develop a riddle or puzzle that incorporates these observations.
goalSetting: Create a clever and engaging puzzle that hints at distinct elements found in each painting.
scoringSystem: Rate the puzzle on a scale of 1-10 based on how creative and thought-provoking it is. Gather any available person's feedback (if you feel like involving the dummy as a 'silent' resolver) to objectively evaluate the complexity and solvability.
name: many_dummy12_0.0

taskDescription: Create and perform a short musical piece using the kalimba, documenting your composition in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Set up the kalimba on a desk next to the notebook and pen. The participant sits on a chair by the desk to work comfortably. Use the kalimba to explore different melodies. As you come up with a tune, write down the sequence of notes in the notebook.
goalSetting: Compose a unique melody using the kalimba and perform it from memory without referring to the notes.
scoringSystem: Originality: Rate the creativity of the composition on a scale of 1 to 5. Complexity: Rate the difficulty or intricacy of the melody on a scale of 1 to 5. Execution: Perform the melody from memory; judge based on accuracy on a scale of 1 to 5. Total score is the sum of ratings, with a maximum possible score of 15.
name: many_dummy13_0.0

taskDescription: Construct a stable pyramid using all the building blocks within a set time limit.
detailedSetting: Place the five building blocks on the desk, close to the clock. The participant stands or sits near the setup to begin constructing. Set the clock to a 2-minute countdown to challenge the participant to build swiftly.
goalSetting: Complete a balanced and stable pyramid using all the building blocks before time runs out.
scoringSystem: Speed: Complete the pyramid under 1 minute (5 points), 1-2 minutes (3 points), more than 2 minutes (1 point). Stability: Assess if the pyramid stands without toppling for 10 seconds (5 points if stable, 0 if not). Total score out of 10 points.
name: many_dummy13_0.0

taskDescription: Match elements from the paintings with features of the potted plant and record similarities in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Position the two paintings on the wall or against the desk within view. Place the potted plant on the desk under the paintings. Keep the notebook and pen next to the plant for note-taking. Stand or sit where both the paintings and the plant are visible.
goalSetting: Identify and note down at least three features the paintings and the potted plant have in common (e.g., similar colors, shapes).
scoringSystem: Accuracy: Award 1 point for each accurate similarity identified, up to 3 points. Creativity: Score the creativity of the comparisons on a scale of 1 to 2, based on originality and depth. Total score out of 5 points.
name: many_dummy13_0.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest and most stable tower using building blocks on an unsteady surface.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on a flat surface like the desk. Next, put the bowl upside down in the center of the tray to create an unstable base. Use the building blocks to build a tower on top of the overturned bowl.
goalSetting: The objective is to build the tallest structure possible with the blocks without the tower collapsing.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for each block successfully added to the tower without it falling over. The more blocks used, the higher the score.
name: many_dummy14_0.0

taskDescription: Compose a short melody on the Kalimba and perform it while standing in front of a book-themed "audience."
detailedSetting: Set up the chair facing a wall or free space in the room, with open books standing up on the desk as if they were audience members. Sit on the chair and use the Kalimba to create a short tune.
goalSetting: The goal is to creatively compose and perform a melody lasting at least 30 seconds.
scoringSystem: Rate your composition on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity, rhythm, and enjoyment. Optionally, if other people are present, they can score the performance as well.
name: many_dummy14_0.0

taskDescription: Use the waste paper ball to score baskets into the trash can from varying distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Set up a chair and a pillow at different distances from the trash can to serve as throwing lines. Begin the game by sitting on the chair as the starting position and attempt to score with the waste paper ball. Once you succeed from the chair spot, move to the pillow spot further away.
goalSetting: Try to make a successful shot from each position in the room.
scoringSystem: Award 2 points for scoring from the chair distance and 5 points for scoring from the pillow position. Attempt to score the highest total points in 5 attempts.
name: many_dummy14_0.0

taskDescription: Create and perform a short melody on a Kalimba, documenting your progress and final composition.
detailedSetting: Set up the Kalimba on a desk where you can comfortably sit and play. Place the notebook and pen nearby for jotting down any melody notes or revisions. Use the clock to time your practice session, aiming to compose a short melody within a given timeframe.
goalSetting: The goal is to compose and perform a unique melody on the Kalimba within a 10-minute session and document the process in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Judges (self or the other participant) can rate the melody on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity, consistency, and overall performance. Bonus points can be awarded for smooth transitions and thematic uniqueness.
name: many_dummy15_0.0

taskDescription: Creative construction and balancing game using dice rolls to determine what to build with the blocks.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on a flat surface, usually on top of a desk. Using the building blocks, players construct a tower or structure on the tray. The dice determines a random rule for each turn (e.g., only using 3 blocks, stacking in a particular order).
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest possible structure on the tray that remains balanced.
scoringSystem: Participants roll the dice after each successful round (completed structure that doesn’t fall), gaining points equal to the number rolled. Additional points are awarded for creativity in construction per the aesthetic and stability evaluated at the end of the game.
name: many_dummy15_0.0

taskDescription: A challenging indoor basketball game where the objective is to score as many 'baskets' using a waste paper ball into a trash can.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room and mark the shooting line using a pillow several feet away. Use the clock to time each session, setting a 5-minute timer for attempts.
goalSetting: The goal is to shoot the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible within the time limit.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot is worth 2 points. Bonus points (additional 1 point) for each consecutive successful shot sequence. Total the points within the time limit to declare the winner or self-performance high score.
name: many_dummy15_0.0

taskDescription: Test your creativity and skill by performing trick shots using a basketball and a waste paper ball, while aiming to land them onto a tray placed at different positions in the room.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on the seat of a chair. The player stands at a chosen distance from the tray and attempts to throw the basketball and the waste paper ball into the tray. The chair can be moved to various spots in the room to increase difficulty or change the shot type.
goalSetting: Successfully make as many trick shots as possible within a set number of attempts using both the basketball and the waste paper ball.
scoringSystem: Award 2 points for each successful basketball shot and 1 point for each successful waste paper ball shot. Count the total points after ten attempts to determine the final score.
name: many_dummy16_0.0

taskDescription: Stimulate your imagination by writing a short story inspired by a random passage selected from a book.
detailedSetting: Select any book from the available five. Flip to a random page, read a paragraph, and use it as the prompt to write your story in the notebook. The pen will be used for writing down the story.
goalSetting: Create a coherent and imaginative short story based on the selected prompt within a time limit of 30 minutes.
scoringSystem: Self-assess the creativity and coherence of your story on a scale from 1 to 10. Alternatively, if another person is in the room, have them judge the story for objectivity.
name: many_dummy16_0.0

taskDescription: Craft and play a soothing tune on the kalimba while sitting comfortably on pillows within a set time.
detailedSetting: Arrange the two pillows on the rug for a comfortable seating area. Sit on the pillows and use the clock to keep track of time while you create and play a soothing tune on the kalimba.
goalSetting: Compose and perform a unique tune that lasts at least 3 minutes.
scoringSystem: Evaluate your tune on a subjective scale from 1 to 10 based on factors like originality, rhythm, and how pleasing it sounds. If desired, have another person in the room provide feedback for additional scoring perspectives.
name: many_dummy16_0.0

taskDescription: A fun and creative bowling game using pillows as the primary means to knock over bowls placed upright, with the waste paper ball acting as a bowling ball.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four bowls in a triangle formation on the floor at one end of the room, similar to bowling pins. Designate a starting line at least three feet away from the first bowl. Place both pillows behind the starting line. The waste paper ball is used as the ‘bowling ball’ to throw at the bowls from behind the pillows.
goalSetting: The aim is to knock over as many bowls as possible with a limited number of throws using the waste paper ball while employing pillows to adjust trajectory or enhance difficulty.
scoringSystem: Each bowl knocked over scores 1 point. Completing a "frame" involves two throws total, and the score for that frame is based on the number of bowls knocked down. Players can play up to 10 frames, and points are accumulated per frame. The player or team with the highest cumulative score at the end wins. If the game is played solo, the goal is to score as high as possible across the ten frames.
name: many_dummy17_0.0

taskDescription: Attempt to score creative and challenging trick shots using a basketball and waste paper ball into a trash can to see who has the best aim and creativity.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. The basketball can be used to try long-distance shots, while the waste paper ball allows for more finesse shots. The participants can move around the room to find unique angles and spots for their shots as long as they remain within the room's boundaries.
goalSetting: Successfully land as many creative shots as possible using both the basketball and waste paper ball into the trash can.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket counts as 1 point. Creativity of shots can be scored by observers or self-judged on a scale from 1 to 5, adding bonus points to the standard 1 point per basket. The player with the highest combined score of successful shots and creativity points is the winner.
name: many_dummy18_0.0

taskDescription: Set up complex chess positions to solve or create your own chess puzzles, noting solutions in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Place the chess board on a desk or table. Use the notebook and pen to jot down initial positions, potential moves, and solutions. The game involves either solving pre-set challenging positions or creating new ones for future play.
goalSetting: Solve complex chess problems, improving strategic thinking. Alternatively, create a challenging puzzle for future use.
scoringSystem: Each correctly solved puzzle earns 2 points. Creating a new puzzle with a unique solution earns 3 points. Total points determine the task's success, with 10 points representing mastery in puzzle-solving or creation.
name: many_dummy18_0.0

taskDescription: Create a mini-golf course using household items and try to get the tennis ball into the tray in as few 'strokes' as possible.
detailedSetting: Arrange the potted plant(s) as obstacles between the starting point and the tray (serving as the 'hole'). Use the broom to hit the tennis ball and avoid the obstacles to achieve the goal. The setup should provide a clear path while allowing for challenging angles.
goalSetting: Navigate the tennis ball from the starting point into the tray with as few broom strokes as possible.
scoringSystem: Each stroke counts as one point. The fewer the strokes, the better the score. A par scoring system can also be created, with a target number of strokes to achieve, e.g., par 3. Players attempt to meet or underperform against the par.
name: many_dummy18_0.0

taskDescription: Stack books on a desk as high as possible without them toppling. The challenge is both a test of patience and balance.
detailedSetting: Place one desk in the center of the room. The books are stacked one at a time on the desk to build the tallest possible structure. The room should be free of other obstructions that might interfere with the stability of the stack.
goalSetting: The goal is to stack all five books in a single tower without it collapsing.
scoringSystem: 1 point per book successfully stacked without falling. Bonus 3 points if all five books are stacked successfully. Deduct 1 point each time the stack collapses. The highest possible score is 8 points.
name: many_dummy19_0.0

taskDescription: A unique twist on chess where dice determine the piece movement, adding a chance element to the strategic game.
detailedSetting: Set up the chess board as usual. Each player rolls the dice to determine which piece they move. Assign numbers to each piece (1-6) prior to starting (e.g., 1 for Pawn, 2 for Knight, etc.). Only the rolled number’s piece may be moved in that turn.
goalSetting: The standard goal of chess: to checkmate the opponent's king.
scoringSystem: 10 points for a checkmate. 2 additional points for each of the opponent's pieces captured. 3 points for achieving check without checkmate. Lose 1 point per illegal move attempt. The player with the highest point tally at the end wins or whoever achieves checkmate.
name: many_dummy19_0.0

taskDescription: Create and perform a musical piece using the kalimba, writing the composition in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably with the kalimba, notebook, and pen ready. Spend 15 minutes composing a melody and another 5 minutes performing it.
goalSetting: To create and play an original melody that either you or any available audience enjoy.
scoringSystem: Creativity: 1 to 5 points based on originality. Complexity: 1 to 5 points based on the musical intricacy. Performance: 1 to 5 points based on execution and engagement. The total score is out of 15, with optional feedback comments for improvement.
name: many_dummy19_0.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest possible tower using building blocks placed on a tray. Roll the dice to determine adjustments or restrictions as you build.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on the rug to provide a stable base for building. Each player takes turns adding blocks to the tower, starting with a base of one block. Before placing a new block, roll the dice to determine an adjustment: - 1 or 2: Add one layer. - 3 or 4: Must skip a turn. - 5: Must use two blocks for the next layer. - 6: Reverse turn sequence for two rounds. Continue until the tower collapses or runs out of blocks.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest possible tower without it toppling over.
scoringSystem: Each successfully added block counts as 1 point. The player with the most points at the end wins. If a player causes the tower to collapse, deduct 2 points from their score.
name: many_dummy20_0.0

taskDescription: Two players take turns shooting a waste paper ball into a trash can from a designated distance. The objective is to make as many successful shots as possible within a one-minute time frame.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can against one wall of the room. Position a chair approximately 3 meters away from the trash can to mark the shooting line. The clock is used to time each player's one-minute shooting period. Players alternate turns sitting on the second chair while the other takes shots. The waste paper ball is used to simulate a basketball for shooting.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible within one minute.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can earns the player 1 point. The player with the higher score at the end of their turns wins the challenge.
name: many_human1_0.0

taskDescription: A single player uses the kalimba to invent a short musical composition and writes the notes and structure down in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa with the kalimba in your lap. Keep the notebook and pen handy on the side. Begin experimenting with the kalimba until an enjoyable tune is discovered. Use the notebook to jot down the notes and sequence of the composition.
goalSetting: Create an original short musical tune of at least 5 different notes and write it down.
scoringSystem: Subjective scoring based on creativity and feeling. Rate the final composition on a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being not satisfied and 10 being extremely satisfied with the musical outcome.
name: many_human1_0.0

taskDescription: Players race to transport and stack all the chess pieces onto building blocks placed on a tray using a specific route around the room.
detailedSetting: Set up the chessboard with pieces at the starting desk. Place the tray with building blocks on the other desk, about 5 meters away, forming a relay course. One player at a time takes turns carrying one chess piece at a time and stacking it onto a building block on the tray, then returning quickly for the next piece.
goalSetting: To be the fastest to transfer and stack all chess pieces.
scoringSystem: Use a stopwatch to time each player’s completion of the task. The player with the shortest time wins. Each second slower than the fastest time is considered a point less in performance evaluation.
name: many_human1_0.0

taskDescription: The participant attempts to score points by making trick shots with a basketball and a waste paper ball into a trash can from an elevated position on a chair.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can near a wall to serve as the basket. Set the chair about 8 feet away from the trash can to act as the shooting platform. The participant stands on the chair and alternates shots using the basketball and the waste paper ball, trying to make them into the trash can.
goalSetting: The objective is to score as many points as possible within a set number of attempts by tossing the basketball or the waste paper ball into the trash can.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot with the waste paper ball scores 1 point. Each successful shot with the basketball scores 3 points. The participant has a total of 10 attempts and can choose the combination of balls for their attempts. The final score is the total number of points after all attempts are exhausted.
name: many_human2_0.0

taskDescription: Create a makeshift basketball game using two hangers as the basket rim and a waste paper ball as the basketball. The player’s goal is to throw the ball through the improvised hoop to score points.
detailedSetting: Secure the clothes hangers on the backrest of the chair, shaping them into a hoop-like structure over a distinct area in the room corner. Place a basket underneath to catch the paper ball that passes through the hoop. Stand or sit at a distance from the chair to attempt throwing the waste paper ball through the hanger hoop.
goalSetting: Score as many points as possible by successfully getting the waste paper ball through the hanger hoop in a limited timeframe or a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket through the hanger hoop counts as 2 points. The player can choose between a timed session (e.g., 2 minutes for as many baskets as possible) or a count-based session (e.g., 10 throws). The objective is to accumulate the highest possible score.
name: many_human3_0.0

taskDescription: Two participants engage in a chess game where they play standard matches and then document their moves, strategies, and reflections in a notebook during and after each game.
detailedSetting: Set up the chessboard on a desk. Each player uses the notebook to note their moves, anticipated opponent strategies, and personal thoughts on their gameplay. This allows players to reflect on their strategies and improvements.
goalSetting: Win the chess match by outsmarting the opponent through strategic moves and analysis. Document insights and reflections to improve future games.
scoringSystem: As chess is often won, lost, or drawn, a win scores 3 points, a draw scores 1 point for each player, and a loss scores 0 points. Players can also gain 1 bonus point for insightful strategic analysis documented in the notebook, as judged collectively or reviewed by the opponent.
name: many_human3_0.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns creating short rhythmic patterns on the kalimba, using a newspaper to muffle the sound at intervals for a creative musical game. The challenge involves timing and creativity.
detailedSetting: One participant holds the kalimba and plays a rhythm while the other uses a newspaper to intermittently muffle specific notes, challenging the player to adapt their rhythm. Time the rotations using the clock, with each participant having 1 minute to play and 1 minute to muffle.
goalSetting: Create unique and enjoyable rhythmic patterns despite the distractions of the newspaper muffling. The other player then attempts to replicate or improve upon this pattern during their turn.
scoringSystem: Players earn scores from 1 to 5 points based on creativity, rhythm stability, and adaptability under muffled conditions, as judged by the non-playing participant. The highest collective score across a set series of turns indicates the winner.
name: many_human3_0.0

taskDescription: A fun throwing game where players attempt to score points by tossing the basketball or waste paper ball into a trash can from varying distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can near one wall of the room. Mark three distinct throwing spots using chairs or other visible reference points at different distances from the trash can (e.g., 3 feet, 5 feet, and 7 feet). The player will take turns attempting to throw either the basketball or waste paper ball into the trash can from each marked position.
goalSetting: The goal is to score as many points as possible by successfully throwing the balls into the trash can from the designated spots.
scoringSystem: Successfully tossing the basketball into the trash can scores 3 points. Successfully tossing the waste paper ball into the trash can scores 1 point. Each player has three attempts with each ball from each distance. The player with the most total points after all attempts wins.
name: many_human4_0.0

taskDescription: A creative songwriting game where players compose short musical pieces using a Kalimba and then write a story inspired by the tune.
detailedSetting: Each player takes turns playing a short tune on the Kalimba for 1-2 minutes. After their performance, the other player writes a brief story or poem inspired by the melody in the notebook. Players then switch roles.
goalSetting: The objective is to create engaging and imaginative stories inspired by music.
scoringSystem: Creativity Score: Both players rate each other's stories from 1 to 10 based on creativity and how well the story matches the musical mood. Originality Bonus: An extra point is awarded by mutual agreement if a story is particularly unique or clever. The player with the highest total score after both stories are created wins.
name: many_human4_0.0

taskDescription: A strategic race to move a tray along a path created using books, using dice throws to determine movement steps.
detailedSetting: Arrange the books standing on their edges in a winding path on the floor. Use pillows to mark the start and finish lines. Place the tray at the starting pillow. Players take turns rolling the dice to advance the tray through the maze without knocking books over.
goalSetting: The aim is to navigate the tray from start to finish in the fewest dice rolls, avoiding any disruption to the book maze.
scoringSystem: Each successful dice roll (without toppling books) that moves the tray forwards scores 2 points. Deduct 1 point if any book is knocked down, and reset the tray to the last successful position. The player with the most points after reaching the finish line wins.
name: many_human4_0.0

taskDescription: A musical creativity challenge where participants take turns playing and notating melodies on a kalimba, evaluating each other's performances for creativity and originality.
detailedSetting: The kalimba is placed on one of the desks in the room. Participants sit side by side with the notebook and pen accessible for writing down notes and feedback. The first participant plays an original melody on the kalimba, while the other listens and then records their impressions in the notebook. Afterward, participants switch roles, repeating the process.
goalSetting: The objective is to create the most original and pleasing melody using the kalimba. Each participant aims to impress the other with their musical creativity.
scoringSystem: After each performance, the listener scores the melody on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity and originality. The participant with the highest total score after both have played wins.
name: many_human5_0.0

taskDescription: A strategic chess game where each move is timed, and players must quickly adapt and execute their strategies under pressure.
detailedSetting: Set up the chessboard on a desk and place the clock nearby. Each player sits on opposite sides of the board. The clock is used to time each player's turn, with a 2-minute limit per move.
goalSetting: To win the chess game by putting the opponent in checkmate, while managing the pressure of the time limit for each move.
scoringSystem: The winner of the game is determined by checkmate. If no checkmate occurs within an hour, the player with more significant captures and strategic board control, as agreed upon by both participants, is declared the victor.
name: many_human5_0.0

taskDescription: An indoor basketball-style challenge where participants aim to score from different positions and with different objects, testing precision and creativity.
detailedSetting: Arrange three chairs at varying distances from the trash can to act as the shooting positions. The fourth chair is set behind the trash can as a backboard. Participants take turns standing on the selected shooting position to aim and score either the basketball or the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: To score as many points as possible from different shooting positions using both the basketball and the waste paper ball for added challenge and creativity.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot with the waste paper ball scores 1 point, while the basketball scores 3 points. Participants take five shots per round, rotating through different chairs. The player with the highest total score across three rounds wins.
name: many_human5_0.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns trying to throw a waste paper ball into a distant trash can while sitting on a chair. The aim is to successfully score as many "baskets" as possible in a limited time.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Position the two chairs in a line approximately 10 feet from the trash can. Set up the clock in view of the participants to keep time. The waste paper ball is shared between the participants.
goalSetting: Aim to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can while seated.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can earns 3 points. Each round lasts for 60 seconds, and players alternate after each attempt. The player with the most points after six rounds (three each) wins.
name: many_human6_0.0

taskDescription: Participants try to balance books on the flat top of a potted plant using clothes hangers as tools without touching the books with their hands.
detailedSetting: Place the potted plant on the sofa. Stack the books near the sofa. Participants stand next to the sofa with one clothes hanger each, which they’ll use to maneuver and balance the books on the plant.
goalSetting: Balance as many books as possible on the potted plant using clothes hangers within the time limit.
scoringSystem: 1 point is awarded for each book successfully balanced by the end of 3 minutes. Deduct 1 point for each book that falls off within the timeframe. The participant with the highest score at the end of the session wins.
name: many_human6_0.0

taskDescription: One participant plays a short melody on the Kalimba, and the other writes down lyrics or notes to fit the mood and rhythm within a time limit.
detailedSetting: The Kalimba is held by one person who improvises melodies. The notebook and pen are used by the other person to jot down lyrics or descriptive notes. Use the clock to manage time, with a visible view for both participants.
goalSetting: Collaboratively create a short piece of music and accompanying lyrics or notes within a set time.
scoringSystem: Creativity: Rate the creativity of the final piece from 1 to 5. Cohesiveness: Rate how well the music and lyrics fit together from 1 to 5. Enjoyment: Participants rate how fun the task was from 1 to 5. Total possible score is 15, with higher scores indicating better performance.
name: many_human6_0.0

taskDescription: Players take turns walking on the treadmill while playing a sequence on the kalimba. The aim is to maintain a steady walking speed and correctly play a musical sequence.
detailedSetting: Position the Kalimba within the reach of the treadmill's user. Set the treadmill to a comfortable walking speed. Use the clock to time each player's attempt for 2 minutes. Players alternate turns using the treadmill and playing the kalimba, and they must try to play a simple melody without stopping their walk.
goalSetting: The task's objective is to successfully play a sequence on the kalimba while maintaining a steady walking speed on the treadmill for the entire duration.
scoringSystem: Each correct note played while walking on the treadmill counts as 1 point. Deduct 1 point for each mistake or any instance where the player stops walking. The highest-scoring player at the end of a predetermined round number wins.
name: many_human7_0.0

taskDescription: Players take turns attempting to throw a waste paper ball into a trash can from various distances.
detailedSetting: Arrange the chairs at different distances from the trash can to act as shooting positions. Use the clock to time each player's round for 1 minute. Players stand on chairs and throw the waste paper ball into the trash can, moving from nearer to further chairs once they make a shot from the closest position.
goalSetting: Successfully land the waste paper ball into the trash can from all chair positions within one minute.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can is worth 2 points. The player who accumulates the most points within the time limit is declared the winner.
name: many_human7_0.0

taskDescription: Two people compete to create an entertaining story by reading from books, taking notes, and presenting their story to the other person, who will then rate it.
detailedSetting: Each participant chooses a book and is given 10 minutes to read and make story notes using the notebook and pen. Afterward, participants take turns sharing their stories in front of the TV (as a fake audience), explaining their tales in a dramatic way.
goalSetting: Create and deliver the most captivating story based on the chosen book excerpts.
scoringSystem: The listener rates the story on creativity, presentation, and coherence on a scale of 1 to 5 (with 5 being the best) in each category. The player with the higher combined score wins the round.
name: many_human7_0.0

taskDescription: A two-player game where participants play a kalimba tune within a set time. The goal is to produce a harmonious melody judged by creativity and timing.
detailedSetting: Set up the chair for the performer in the center of the room. The player sits with the kalimba, and the clock is positioned nearby to keep time. The other person acts as the judge, listening and timing the performance.
goalSetting: Each participant aims to create the most captivating 2-minute performance on the kalimba, showcasing creativity and timing.
scoringSystem: Performances are scored out of 10 based on two criteria: creativity (up to 5 points) and timing (up to 5 points). The judge awards points after each performance, and the player with the highest score wins.
name: many_human8_0.0

taskDescription: A solo game where the player builds the tallest and most stable block tower on a tray that should withstand a "wind" challenge.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on a desk. The player uses the 5 building blocks to build a tower on the tray. Once the tower is built, the player blows the waste paper ball towards the tower to simulate wind.
goalSetting: Construct the tallest stable tower that remains standing after being hit by the paper ball.
scoringSystem: The score is calculated based on height and stability. The player earns 2 points per block used in the structure when the wind doesn't topple the tower. A bonus of 3 points is given if all blocks are utilized without falling.
name: many_human8_0.0

taskDescription: A solo game where the player attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from different positions using the basketball as a dribbling object.
detailedSetting: The trash can is placed near the center of the room. The player uses a chair to mark different shooting positions at various distances from the can. The player starts from a marked spot, dribbles the basketball while moving to the position, and then attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully score the paper ball into the trash can from various spots after dribbling the ball, promoting hand-eye coordination and precision.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket earns the player 2 points. Completing a round from all positions without missing any baskets grants an additional 5-point bonus.
name: many_human8_0.0

taskDescription: In this task, participants use the available books to build the tallest possible tower on a tray. The challenge is to create a stable tower that stands for at least 10 seconds without collapsing.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on a flat surface, such as the desk or rug, as the foundation for the tower. Stack the books one by one, trying to build as high a tower as possible. Participants take turns stacking books until the tower falls.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest possible tower using all available books that can stand for at least 10 seconds.
scoringSystem: Points are awarded based on the height of the tower in books: 1 point for each book successfully stacked. Bonus of 2 points if the tower stands for at least 10 seconds after the final book is placed. The player with the most points after all rounds wins the challenge.
name: many_human9_0.0

taskDescription: Participants use the kalimba to create a short melody and transcribe it into the notebook. Each person will perform their melody and receive feedback from the other participant.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa or a chair with the kalimba and notebook in front of you. Spend a few minutes experimenting with different notes, then compose a short melody of 8-12 notes. Write the sequence of notes in the notebook with the pen.
goalSetting: The goal is to create an original melody and demonstrate the ability to play it consistently.
scoringSystem: Scores are given in two categories: Creativity: Rated 1-5 by the listener based on originality and enjoyment of the melody. Consistency: Rated 1-5 based on the performer's ability to play the melody without errors in 3 consecutive attempts. The total score is the sum of both ratings.
name: many_human9_0.0

taskDescription: A fun, single-player activity where the participant sits on a chair and attempts to toss a waste paper ball into a trash can with various challenges.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can a reasonable distance away from the chair, directly in line with where the participant is seated. The chair can be repositioned, but the participant must always be seated when throwing.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible within a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the trash can is worth 2 points. If the participant can make 3 consecutive successful tosses, they earn an additional bonus of 3 points. The total is the sum of all successful tosses and bonuses accumulated in 10 attempts.
name: many_human9_0.0

taskDescription: Create a miniature bowling alley using bowls as pins and dice as a bowling ball. Knock over as many bowls as possible with the dice for a score.
detailedSetting: Arrange three bowls in a triangular formation at one end of a tray to act as pins, with one in front and two directly behind it. Place one bowl upside down on the other end of the tray to support the dice before rolling. The player sits on a chair behind the tray, rolling the dice across the tray to hit the bowls.
goalSetting: The objective is to knock over the maximum number of bowls with a single roll of the dice.
scoringSystem: Each bowl knocked down counts as 1 point. A perfect strike, where all three bowls are knocked down in a single roll, scores an additional bonus point, for a total of 4 points. Each player gets five turns, and the highest cumulative score wins.
name: many_human10_0.0

taskDescription: Balance as many books as possible on a tray, then try to slide a waste paper ball under the tray without toppling the stack.
detailedSetting: Place a tray on a flat surface like a desk. One by one, stack up to five books vertically on the tray. Once the books are stacked, attempt to slide the waste paper ball under the tray without the books falling over.
goalSetting: The aim is to balance all five books and successfully slide the paper ball under the tray without dislodging any books.
scoringSystem: Each successfully balanced book before sliding the waste paper ball earns 1 point. Successfully sliding the ball without toppling any books earns an additional 2 points. The maximum score possible is 7 points.
name: many_human10_0.0

taskDescription: Throw a pillow and aim to land it on a target created on a rug, making use of the basketball to define target zones for scoring.
detailedSetting: Lay the rug flat on the floor and place the basketball in the middle as a bullseye target. The player stands a few feet away and throws pillows, aiming to land them as close to the basketball as possible. A circle around the basketball can be imagined visually for scoring zones.
goalSetting: Get the pillow to land closest to the basketball for the highest score.
scoringSystem: Pillow landing on or touching the basketball scores 5 points. A pillow landing within an imagined one-foot radius surrounding the basketball scores 3 points. A pillow outside this zone but still on the rug scores 1 point. Each player has two pillow tosses, and the total score for both attempts determines the winner.
name: many_human10_0.0

taskDescription: Create a fun and challenging obstacle course within the room using available items. The objective is to navigate through the course as quickly and accurately as possible.
detailedSetting: Arrange the chairs to create a zig-zag path in the room. Use the desks as hurdles that participants must jump over or crawl under. Place the rug as a 'safe zone' where participants can rest for two seconds. Position the basketball at one end to be dribbled through the zig-zag path, while retaining accuracy. Lay the broom as a balance beam, and use the pillows as stepping stones through which participants hop without touching the floor. Set the waste paper ball as a target that must be hit with a foot before finishing the course.
goalSetting: The goal of the task is to complete the entire obstacle course correctly in the shortest time possible, navigating all obstacles and achieving related objectives like dribbling the basketball and hitting the target.
scoringSystem: Participants receive 10 points for completing the course. For every obstacle they touch incorrectly (e.g., chairs hit while dribbling or stepping off pillows), 1 point is deducted. The fastest time earns bonus points: 5 bonus points for under 2 minutes and 3 points for under 3 minutes. The person with the highest points after deductions is the winner.
name: many_human11_0.0

taskDescription: Create a fun mini-bowling game using items found in the room. Roll the waste paper ball to knock over newspaper-coned pins.
detailedSetting: Roll the newspaper into tall pin shapes and place them upright at one end of the room to resemble bowling pins. Arrange the newspaper pins in a triangle formation using one Bowl to support the base of each rolled newspaper. Stand at least five feet away from the pins. Use the waste paper ball as a bowling ball to knock over the pins by rolling it towards them.
goalSetting: Knock down all the newspaper pins in as few rolls as possible.
scoringSystem: Each pin knocked down with a single roll is worth 2 points. If all pins are knocked down in one roll, it's a strike worth 10 points. If all pins are knocked down across multiple rolls, it's a spare worth 5 points. Total the points for each round. The game can be played in a series of rounds with the highest total score winning.
name: many_human12_0.0

taskDescription: Use paintings as inspiration to create an imaginative story and write it down in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Set up both paintings at eye level on a wall or propped against a desk. Sit on the sofa or a chair with the notebook and pen in hand. Use one of the books to reference writing styles or for inspiration if necessary. Spend a moment observing the paintings, then begin writing an original story inspired by them.
goalSetting: Craft a short story with a clear beginning, middle, and end based on visual inspiration from the paintings.
scoringSystem: Upon completion, evaluate the story based on creativity, coherence, and connection to the paintings. Rate each criterion on a scale of 1 to 5. Calculate a total score out of 15. Sharing the story with "Other people" for additional feedback can provide an extra subjective opinion score.
name: many_human12_0.0

taskDescription: A balance challenge using chess pieces and cups, testing steady hands and strategic stacking without toppling.
detailedSetting: Set the chessboard on a flat surface such as a desk. Players take turns stacking chess pieces inside the cup, balancing them as high as possible without knocking them over. Cups can also be used to keep the base stable by flipping and using them as stands for more challenging stability.
goalSetting: Balance and stack the most chess pieces inside and on top of the cups without causing the arrangement to fall.
scoringSystem: Each successfully balanced piece is worth 1 point. The player who stacks and balances the most pieces without falling wins. In the event of a tie, use a timer to determine who stacked the pieces quickest or continue for a second round.
name: many_human12_0.0

taskDescription: Two players compete against each other in a fast-paced game of chess. The objective is to make quick decisions to capture the opponent's king within a limited time.
detailedSetting: Set up the chess board on a desk. Place the clock next to the board to keep track of time. Each player has a notebook and pen to jot down their moves. The clock is set for 5-minute intervals for each player.
goalSetting: The goal is to checkmate the opponent within their designated 5-minute time frame.
scoringSystem: A point is awarded for each piece the player captures from their opponent. An additional 5 points are given for successfully checkmating the opponent within the time limit. If time runs out before a checkmate, the player with more captured pieces wins.
name: many_human13_0.0

taskDescription: Participants must accurately throw objects to land them inside a target area by using pillows to alter the trajectory.
detailedSetting: Set up the trash can across the room. Use the pillows placed midway to create a barrier. Participants will take turns attempting to throw the basketball or wastepaper ball into the trash can by bouncing it off the pillows.
goalSetting: The objective is to hit the target by strategically using the pillows to assist in bounce throws, ensuring the object lands inside the trash can.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can using the basketball counts as 3 points and the wastepaper ball counts as 1 point. The player with the highest total score after five throws each wins.
name: many_human13_0.0

taskDescription: Two participants create and perform original tunes on a kalimba. They are scored based on creativity and performance.
detailedSetting: Set up two chairs opposite one another. Place the kalimba on one player’s lap while the other player sits beside them. The TV can be used as a screen to display potential themes or to play a backing track. Participants have 10 minutes to compose a tune in a notebook.
goalSetting: The aim is to compose and perform the most creative and melodious kalimba tune in a limited time.
