scoringSystem: Each tune is scored from 1 to 10 by the non-playing participant based on creativity, melody, and emotional impact. The person with the highest aggregate score from three performances each wins.
name: many_human13_0.0

taskDescription: A fun indoor game where players attempt to score by throwing a waste paper ball into a trash can using a basketball as inspiration.
detailedSetting: Set one chair at a reasonable distance from the trash can to act as the shooting line. The trash can is placed upright in a corner or against a wall, ensuring it won't tip over. The two players take turns standing behind the chair to shoot the paper ball at the trash can. The basketball is used to mark out a "basketball court" on the rug, creating a playful ambiance.
goalSetting: The objective is for participants to score the most "baskets" by successfully throwing the waste paper ball into the trash can.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw scores 1 point for the player. Players take five shots each per round. The game continues for four rounds, and the player with the highest cumulative score at the end wins. In the case of a tie, players continue shooting until one scores and the other misses (sudden death).

taskDescription: Players take turns to toss the basketball and waste paper ball into a trash can from varying distances, aiming to score points based on their accuracy.

Set up one chair at a distance of approximately 5 feet from the trash can, and the second chair at 10 feet. Players must sit on the chairs to make their tosses. Each participant gets to throw both the basketball and the waste paper ball from each chair, taking turns.
goalSetting: The aim is to score as many points as possible by successfully tossing the basketball and waste paper ball into the trash can from the designated distances.
scoringSystem:
- Successfully tossing the waste paper ball from the 5-foot distance is worth 1 point.
- Successfully tossing the waste paper ball from the 10-foot distance is worth 2 points.
- Successfully tossing the basketball from the 5-foot distance is worth 2 points.
- Successfully tossing the basketball from the 10-foot distance is worth 3 points.  The player with the most points after a predetermined number of rounds wins.

taskDescription: Participants compose and play short melodies on the kalimba, testing their creativity and timing, with each melody performed within a minute.
detailedSetting: Players sit comfortably at a desk, with the kalimba in front of them. The notebook and pen are used to jot down notes for the melody they want to create. Use the clock to monitor the time each participant has to compose and play their piece.
goalSetting: The goal is to compose and play the most creative and pleasant melody on the kalimba within a one minute timeframe.
scoringSystem:
- Creativity: up to 5 points (rated by the other person)
- Melody pleasantness: up to 5 points (rated by the other person)
- Each missed beat (out of time): -1 point per occurrence  The highest score after each participant has played once wins.

taskDescription: Contestants navigate an obstacle course balancing a tennis ball on a tray without dropping it, demonstrating agility and control.
detailedSetting: Set up an obstacle course in the room. Place the chairs in a zigzag formation and create a route going around the sofa and back to the starting point. The desks are arranged to create a makeshift low table that the participants must navigate around. Participants start at one end of the course, using the tray to carry the tennis ball without it falling off. The course is completed once they return to the starting point.
goalSetting: To successfully complete the obstacle course in the shortest time possible without dropping the tennis ball from the tray.
scoringSystem: Each participant's time is recorded, with a time penalty of 5 seconds added each time the ball falls off the tray. The fastest adjusted time wins.
name: many_human15_0.0

taskDescription: A two-player game where participants take turns throwing a waste paper ball into a trash can from a seated position.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Position a chair several feet away (typically 6-10 feet, depending on room size). Each player sits on the chair and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: The objective is to successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible within three turns.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can earns 3 points. The player with the highest score after three turns each is declared the winner. In case of a tie, players continue with one throw each until a winner is determined.

taskDescription: A fast-paced game of chess played in dim lighting, where each move must be made within a strict time limit.

goalSetting: Each player must make their move within 30 seconds during their turn. The first player to put the opponent into checkmate, or the player with the most opponents' pieces captured when time runs out, wins the game.
scoringSystem: A checkmate win results in 10 points for the winner. If the game ends due to time, 1 point per captured opponent piece is awarded. The player with the higher score wins. If scores are tied, the game is declared a draw.

taskDescription: A solo task where the player composes a short piece of music using the kalimba and documents it in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably at a desk with the kalimba, notebook, and pen. Use the kalimba to experiment with different sounds and melodies, writing down the notes and composing a short song lasting around 1 minute.
goalSetting: Compose and record a complete melody in the notebook that can be performed using the kalimba.
scoringSystem: Give yourself a score from 1 to 10 based on creativity, noting how pleased you are with the melody and structure. An additional 2 points can be awarded for each uniquely created tune, with a max of up to 5 unique tunes for 10 extra points total.
name: many_human16_0.0

taskDescription: This is a fun tossing game where participants aim to score points by throwing different sized balls into the potted plant and waste paper ball into the basket.
detailedSetting: Place the potted plant near a wall at one end of the room, ensuring it is stable. Position yourself or the other participant about 8 feet away from the plant. The basketball and the waste paper ball are placed at the starting line. The waste paper ball can be thrown first followed by the basketball.
goalSetting: The objective is to successfully toss both the waste paper ball and the basketball into the plant pot consecutively as many times as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw of the waste paper ball into the plant is worth 1 point. Each successful toss of the basketball into the plant is worth 3 points. The game comprises 5 rounds. The participant with the highest cumulative score at the end of all rounds wins.

taskDescription: Participants will compose and play an original melody on the Kalimba.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa with the kalimba in hand. Have the notebook and pen ready on a desk for jotting down notes and ideas as you play. You will spend an initial 10 minutes drafting your melody ideas in the notebook.
goalSetting: Compose an original melody on the Kalimba and play it as smoothly as possible.
scoringSystem: Performers rate their melody on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity, flow, and enjoyment. Optionally, if another person is available, they can provide a score as well, with the final score being an average of the two ratings.
name: many_human17_0.0

taskDescription: Use the newspaper and building blocks to construct the tallest freestanding tower possible.
detailedSetting: Clear an area on the rug where the tower will be built. Use the newspaper to create stability at the base, and stack the blocks one on top of another. The waste paper ball can be rolled up to add balance to the top of the tower.
goalSetting: Construct the tallest tower that stands unaided using the given materials.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in inches or centimeters. Each inch or centimeter counts as 1 point. If the tower remains standing for over 10 seconds after completion, an additional 10 points are added. The goal is to achieve the highest total score.
name: many_human17_0.0

taskDescription: Build a tower as high as possible using building blocks, then roll the dice to determine if additional blocks can be added.
detailedSetting: Place one desk in a central spot in the room as the building station. Stack the 5 building blocks on the desk, creating the tallest possible tower. Use the dice to add to the challenge; each number rolled represents a chance to restack the tower or add a different configuration.
goalSetting: The objective is to construct the tallest tower with reconfigurations guided by dice rolls and to see how stable it can remain without toppling.
scoringSystem: Each successful block added to the existing structure earns 2 points. If your reconfigured tower remains standing for 10 seconds, you earn extra 5 points. The total height of the final structure (in blocks) multiplied by its stability time (in seconds) defines the final score. An additional 3 bonus points for using all 5 blocks. The player with the highest points wins.

taskDescription: Each person takes turns composing and performing a short melody on the kalimba.
detailedSetting: The kalimba and a notebook with a pen are set on a desk, centrally positioned for easy access. Each participant will write down a sequence of notes in the notebook and then perform it on the kalimba.
goalSetting: The goal is to compose the most pleasing and original melody using written notes and translating them into music using the kalimba.
scoringSystem: Each performance is scored from 1 to 10 based on creativity, complexity, and listener preference. Bonus 2 points for original compositions where all notes were different from prior melodies. The person with the highest average score after two rounds wins.
name: many_human18_0.0

taskDescription: A timed reading and comprehension challenge using a newspaper.
detailedSetting: Set two chairs facing each other with the newspaper placed on one chair. The lamp is turned on to illuminate the newspaper for clearer readability for both participants.
goalSetting: Each participant reads a randomly selected article from the newspaper as quickly as possible and recalls as many details as possible in a quick comprehension quiz.
scoringSystem: Participants earn 1 point for each correct detail recalled about the article's content. Deduct 1 point for each minute spent reading beyond the set 5-minute limit. Bonus 5 points for remembering the article's headline verbatim. The player with the most points after the quiz wins.
name: many_human18_0.0

taskDescription: Players attempt to score hoops by throwing a waste paper ball into a trash can from a set distance, similar to shooting a basketball. Players use a chair to define the shooting line. The task allows for practice shots with the basketball before the main challenge starts with the waste paper ball.

Players stand behind the chair to make their shots. Before the competition begins, players can practice with the basketball to get a feel for the distance.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible from behind the chair.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw of the waste paper ball into the trash can from behind the chair earns 1 point. The number of attempts per player can be set (e.g., 5 throws each), and the player with the most points at the end of their attempts wins the game.

taskDescription: A soothing music creation and listening task where the participant plays tunes on the Kalimba to create a mini-concert atmosphere. The participant can write down musical ideas or inspirations in the notebook during breaks.

goalSetting: Create and play soothing melodies using the Kalimba to enjoy a peaceful and creative session. Write down any musical ideas or personal reflections in the notebook.
scoringSystem: The participant rates their overall satisfaction with the music they created on a scale of 1-10, with 10 being highly satisfied and 1 not satisfied at all. Additional points can be awarded for each musical idea or insight captured in the notebook, encouraging depth and reflection.
name: many_human19_0.0

taskDescription: Create a playful obstacle course using available furniture and items. Participants roll a die to determine which obstacles to interact with throughout the course.
detailedSetting: Arrange two chairs apart to crawl under or over. Place a pillow on one end of the course for a balance challenge, and use a desk to serve as a tunnel or a climbing point. Set the tray on another desk as the finishing line where participants stop. The die determines which obstacles the participant must engage with during their run.
goalSetting: Successfully navigate the obstacle course by completing challenges dictated by the roll of a die. Each number corresponds to a specific challenge or route modification.
scoringSystem: The first roll of the die dictates the obstacle to tackle first. Participants score 5 points for completing each obstacle level without touching or toppling items. An additional 5 points can be earned by finishing the course in less than 2 minutes. Participants add their points together to get a final score.
name: many_human19_0.0

taskDescription: Test your balance and coordination by setting up a balancing challenge that involves maintaining posture on pillows while playing a tune on the kalimba, all under the added stipulation decided by a dice roll.
detailedSetting: Place the two pillows on the floor side by side, making sure they are stable but wobbly enough to challenge balance. Set the two chairs facing each other about a meter apart, creating an open field where the pillows are placed in the middle. Place the kalimba nearby for easy reach. The dice is used to determine an additional balancing task rule, such as standing on one leg or playing with closed eyes, determined by the number rolled.
goalSetting: The objective is to stand on the pillows while correctly playing a tune of your choice on the kalimba. The additional balance task generated by the dice roll must also be accomplished to successfully achieve the goal.
scoringSystem: Successfully standing on the pillows without stepping off for the duration of the tune: 10 points. Completing the task under the additional rule dictated by the dice roll: 5 extra points. Deductions can include points lost for each step off the pillow (-2 points per step-off) or incorrect tune notes (-1 point per wrong note). Maximum total score is 15.
name: many_human20_0.0

taskDescription: Work in pairs to hone agility and reflexes by balancing a tennis ball on a tray while navigating an obstacle course made from chairs, dice in hand.
detailedSetting: Arrange four chairs to create a zigzag path as the obstacle course in the room. One participant holds the tray with the tennis ball balanced on it while the other player stands at the end and rolls the dice to determine the number of blindfolded steps the tray-holder must take unassisted. This adds unpredictability and enhances the challenge.
goalSetting: The goal is to navigate through the course without dropping the tennis ball, guided by verbal cues from the partner.
scoringSystem: Completing the course without dropping the ball: 10 points. Bonus points for each step successfully taken blindfolded (as determined by the dice roll): 1 point per step. Penalize 2 points for each ball drop/excessive tray tilt. Maximum score depending on the number rolled, capped at 20.

taskDescription: Compete against a partner in a literary quote race that tests your knowledge and speed in locating quotes from different books.
detailedSetting: Arrange the five books in a line on a desk. Sit with your partner at another desk, each with a notebook and pen. One person calls out a random popular quote or theme/prompt, and both participants race to find a corresponding passage from any of the books on the desk and jot it down.
goalSetting: Quickly find and note down the corresponding quote or related passage with as close a match as possible.
scoringSystem: First player to correctly find and write the quote: 5 points for speed. If both manage correctly within the same timeframe, each gets 3 points for accuracy. Bonus points awarded for well-matched thematic passages (+2 points). A failsafe could be 0 points if no relevant passage is located or if found quote does not match prompt. Maximum score is 7 per round.
name: many_human20_0.0

taskDescription: A solo game where the participant attempts to throw a waste paper ball into a trash can from different distances, using a chair as a marker for the shooting points.
detailedSetting: Place a chair at a starting distance of 1 meter from the trash can. Stand behind the chair and attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can. After each successful throw, move the chair back by 0.5 meters and try again.
goalSetting: The objective is to score as many successive throws into the trash can as possible, increasing the distance with each successful shot.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can earns 1 point. The score stops when a throw is missed. The total score is the number of successful throws made consecutively.

taskDescription: A balancing challenge where the participant stacks books and a notebook on their head while standing on a rug, attempting to maintain balance for a set period.
detailedSetting: Place the rug on the floor as the designated balancing area. The participant stands on the rug and carefully stacks up to five books and a notebook on their head. Use the clock to time the balance duration.
goalSetting: The goal is to balance all six items on the head without dropping any, aiming to maintain the balance for as long as possible.
scoringSystem: Score 1 point for every 5 seconds the stack remains balanced. The maximum score possible is determined by the participant's stamina and balance skill.
name: few_dummy1_1.0

taskDescription: A reflective art critique where the participant observes and critiques a poster's design while seated comfortably, using a cup as a prop for creativity.
detailedSetting: Sit on the sofa facing the poster. Use the cup to hold the pen and tissue for jotting down thoughts and critiques about the poster's design elements.
goalSetting: The objective is to develop a thoughtful critique of the poster's design, including elements like color, composition, and overall impact.
scoringSystem: Rate the critique on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity, depth of analysis, and overall insightfulness. A self-evaluation or peer (if available) assessment can be used for scoring, aiming for a higher score through detailed and inventive commentary.
name: few_dummy1_1.0

taskDescription: Participants must balance a bowl on their head while sitting on a chair and attempt to drop the waste paper ball into a bowl placed on a desk.
detailedSetting: Place a desk at one end of the room with a bowl on top. Position a chair about two meters away from the desk. Participants must sit on the chair with another bowl balanced on their head. They are provided with one waste paper ball to throw into the bowl on the desk.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the bowl on the desk without the bowl falling off their head.
scoringSystem: 5 points for successfully throwing the ball into the bowl. 3 points if the ball touches the bowl but does not go in. Lose 1 point if the bowl falls off their head during the attempt. Highest score wins after three attempts per participant.
name: few_dummy2_1.0

taskDescription: Participants use chairs, pillows, and a newspaper to build the most creative and stable fort. The cup acts as a decorative element.
detailedSetting: Place four chairs in a rectangle formation with a space inside to allow for fort-building. The pillows and newspaper are used as construction materials, and the cups as decorative elements. Each participant uses their creativity to design their fort within a 20-minute time limit.
goalSetting: Build the most stable and creatively designed fort using the available items.
scoringSystem: Creativity (up to 5 points) based on design innovation. Stability (up to 5 points) based on how well the fort holds together with light pressure applied. Decoration (up to 3 points) for creative use of cups and pillows. Maximum score of 13 points; the highest score wins.
name: few_dummy2_1.0

taskDescription: Use a broom as a golf club to guide the kettle across the rug toward the tray "hole" positioned at the end, with obstacles created by the potted plant.
detailedSetting: Arrange a rug as the mini-golf course. Position the tray as the "hole" at one end. The broom serves as the golf club, and the kettle as the golf ball. Place the potted plant strategically as an obstacle the player must navigate around or through.
goalSetting: Maneuver the kettle into the tray with the fewest "strokes" using the broom.
scoringSystem: One stroke per "swing" or broom movement. 10 points for completing the course in 5 strokes or fewer. 5 points if completed in 6-10 strokes. 1 point for finishing regardless of the number of strokes. The player with the most points wins after all participants have completed the course.
name: few_dummy2_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest tower using all available books without the structure falling apart.
detailedSetting: Arrange all five books on a flat surface (such as a desk or a rug). The challenge is to stack them vertically as high as possible without the tower toppling over.
goalSetting: Successfully build the tallest possible tower using all the books.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower with a ruler or by comparing against a fixed point such as a lamp or a chair. The score is based on the height achieved in centimeters. Bonus points are awarded for a stable structure that stands for over a minute.
name: few_dummy3_1.0

taskDescription: Stand or sit in a designated position and attempt to toss a waste paper ball into a trash can from a distance.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room and set a chair or create a designated area at the other side, maintaining a fair distance (around 3-4 meters if space allows). The player stands or sits at this spot and tries to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball such that it lands inside the trash can.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss earns 10 points. Three consecutive successes gain you an additional 10-point bonus. Multiple rounds can be played to accumulate points.
name: few_dummy3_1.0

taskDescription: Use logic and creativity to arrange paintings and note observations and patterns.
detailedSetting: Hang or prop the two paintings on different walls. Use the notebook and pen to jot down observations about patterns within and between the paintings. Create a small narrative or spot the differences/similarities between the two artworks.
goalSetting: Identify and describe patterns, similarities, and differences between the paintings in detail.
scoringSystem:
Assign points based on the number of patterns discovered and the depth of insights:
- 1 point for each identified pattern or similarity.
- Bonus points for creative narratives that link the paintings (up to 5 points).
- Maximum score is subjective, but thoroughness and creativity are key criteria.
name: few_dummy3_1.0

taskDescription: Participants try to balance a bowl on the end of a broom while standing on a pillow. The challenge is to keep the bowl on the broom for as long as possible without dropping it.
detailedSetting: Place the pillow on the floor as the designated standing area. Hold the broom upright and place the bowl on the top end. The participant stands on the pillow and attempts to balance the bowl on the broom while maintaining their own balance.
goalSetting: The objective is to balance the bowl on the broom for the longest possible time without dropping it or stepping off the pillow.
scoringSystem: Time the duration the bowl stays balanced. Award 1 point for every 10 seconds the bowl remains on the broom. The highest score wins.
name: few_dummy4_1.0

taskDescription: Participants build a tower using all available books on a desk, without the tower falling. The aim is to see how tall you can make it while sitting in a chair.
detailedSetting: Set one desk as the construction area. The participant sits on a chair in front of the desk and builds a tower using the books, stacking them in such a way that maximizes their height while maintaining stability.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest possible book tower that remains stable for at least 10 seconds.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in centimeters. Award 1 point per centimeter of height. The participant with the tallest tower at the end wins.
name: few_dummy4_1.0

taskDescription: Participants sketch their interpretation or extension of an existing painting using a notebook and pen under the lamp's light for inspiration.
detailedSetting: Place the notebook and pen on a desk or table near the lamp. Position the painting so it's clearly visible. Use the lamp to illuminate the painting and notebook, creating a focused workspace.
goalSetting: The aim is to creatively interpret the painting by sketching your version or narrative inspired by it in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Rate each sketch based on creativity, likeness, and personal interpretation on a scale of 1 to 10. A higher score indicates a better expression of creativity and connection to the painting.
name: few_dummy4_1.0

taskDescription: Create the tallest stable tower using the available books on a chair.
detailedSetting: Place one chair in the center of the room. The participant will use the five books to build a tower on the seat of the chair. The books must be placed one on top of the other, balancing them as high as possible without toppling over.
goalSetting: Construct a stable tower using all available books, maximizing the height of the tower.
scoringSystem: 1 point for each book used successfully without the tower falling over. If all five books are used and the tower remains standing for 10 seconds, a bonus of 5 points is awarded.
name: few_dummy5_1.0

taskDescription: A solo basketball-like game where the goal is to shoot the waste paper ball into the trash can from varying distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Use one chair as the shooting mark, placing it firstly about 3 feet from the trash can. Then, set another chair at 5 feet. The waste paper ball is made using sheets from the newspaper. The participant stands on each chair in succession and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from both chair locations.
scoringSystem: 3 points for making the shot from the closer chair, 5 points for the shot from the farther chair. Add a 2-point bonus if both shots are made consecutively without a miss.
name: few_dummy5_1.0

taskDescription: Sketch the sofa with the notebook and pen, using the lamp to highlight its details.
detailedSetting: Place the lamp near the sofa, adjusting its light to cast interesting shadows and highlights on the sofa. The participant sits comfortably, either on the floor opposite the sofa or on another piece of furniture, using the pen and notebook to draw.
goalSetting: Capture a detailed sketch of the sofa, focusing on light and shadow as illuminated by the lamp.
scoringSystem: The sketch is scored on a scale of 1 to 10, considering factors such as creativity, detail, and use of light and shadow. A bonus of 3 points is given if the sketch includes unique features or artistic expression.
name: few_dummy5_1.0

taskDescription: Create a short story inspired by the paintings in the room, then write it down in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Set up a chair in front of the paintings. With the notebook and pen in hand, the participant will observe the paintings and draw inspiration to craft a narrative. They will then write this narrative in the notebook while seated comfortably.
goalSetting: The goal is to write a creative short story in the notebook inspired by the visual cues and themes found in the paintings.
scoringSystem: Rate the short story on a scale of 1 to 10 based on creativity, coherence, and how well it reflects the paintings. A companion (if present) or a self-assessment can be used for scoring.
name: few_dummy6_1.0

taskDescription: Balance the bowls on the tray while trying to keep the waste paper ball in a central position on one of the bowls as you move.
detailedSetting: Place the waste paper ball on top of one bowl. Arrange the four bowls on the tray, with the bowl containing the waste paper ball in the center. Carefully balance the tray and move around the room without dropping the paper ball or bowls.
goalSetting: The objective is to walk a complete circuit of the room while keeping the waste paper ball balanced on the bowl without any spilling or falling.
scoringSystem: Award 10 points for completing the circuit without any mishaps. Deduct 1 point for each time a bowl moves significantly out of place, and 3 points if the paper ball falls off.
name: few_dummy6_1.0

taskDescription: Read an article from the newspaper and set a timer as a trivia quiz to recall key details after a refreshment break.
detailedSetting: Sit on a chair with the newspaper. Read an article thoroughly for 5 minutes. Afterward, use the kettle to make a cup of tea and spend the next 5 minutes enjoying the tea. Then, set the clock to a 5-minute countdown to answer trivia questions based on the article.
goalSetting: The task is to retain and recall as much relevant information from the article as possible after a short break, answering as many trivia questions as you can within the time limit.
scoringSystem: Each correctly answered trivia question about the article earns 2 points. The total number of points determines the final score, with potential bonus points for extra detail or context.
name: few_dummy6_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns attempting to throw a waste paper ball into a trash can from a designated distance, using a chair as a shooting position.
detailedSetting: Place a trash can at one end of the room. Set up a chair at a distance of about 6 feet from the trash can. Participants sit on the chair and take turns trying to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can. Each participant gets three attempts per round.
goalSetting: The goal is to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from the sitting position.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the trash can earns 1 point. The player with the most points after three rounds wins.
name: few_dummy7_1.0

taskDescription: Participants read a random page from the book and then write down as many details as they can remember in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Select one of the books from the pile. Open the book to a random page and give the participant 2 minutes to read it. Once the time is up, close the book. The participant then uses the pen to write down as many details as they recall on a page in the notebook.
goalSetting: The objective is to accurately recall and record as much information from the page as possible.
scoringSystem: Assign 1 point for each correctly remembered detail. Total the points, and see how well the participant remembered the details from the book.
name: few_dummy7_1.0

taskDescription: Create a bowling game using household items, with players rolling a newspaper ball into a set of bowls.
detailedSetting: Set up the bowls in a triangle formation near the sofa, with some space between each bowl. Roll the newspaper into a tight ball. Participants stand or sit behind the sofa and aim to roll the newspaper ball to knock over as many bowls as possible.
goalSetting: The aim is to knock over all the bowls using the newspaper ball.
scoringSystem: Each knocked-over bowl is worth 2 points. Total the points after three attempts to determine the winner.
name: few_dummy7_1.0

taskDescription: Test your aim by tossing a waste paper ball into a trash can from variable distances and angles, using a chair to change height and angle conditions.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Position the chair at various marked distances from the trash can, starting from 1 meter away and increasing to a maximum of 5 meters. Sit or stand on the chair to vary throwing positions.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from each marked distance using minimal attempts.
scoringSystem: Award 5 points for a successful toss from each position on the first attempt, 3 points for the second, and 1 point for the third. No points if it takes more than three tries. Total potential score is 25 points.
name: few_dummy8_1.0

taskDescription: Create a mini obstacle course using a newspaper and other items, then navigate through it without dropping the newspaper from your head.
detailedSetting: Set up the chairs and pillows across the room to act as obstacles, ensuring there’s enough room to step around and over them. Place the newspaper on your head and maneuver through the maze without letting the newspaper fall.
goalSetting: Walk through the entire maze from start to finish while balancing the newspaper on your head.
scoringSystem: Complete the maze with the newspaper still on your head to earn 10 points. Deduct 2 points each time the newspaper falls. Maximum score is 10 points.
name: few_dummy8_1.0

taskDescription: Challenge yourself to see how quickly you can read through a section of a book and jot down key ideas.
detailedSetting: Choose a comfortable spot on the sofa or chair. Use the clock to time yourself reading a predetermined number of pages from the book. Summarize the main points in the notebook with the pen when time is up.
goalSetting: Read a section swiftly while retaining key information, demonstrating comprehension by writing a summary.
scoringSystem: Rate yourself on speed (1-5 scale, 5 being fastest), comprehension (accuracy of summaries, 1-5 scale, 5 being most accurate), and reflection on improvement (1-5 scale, 5 being most improved). Maximum score is 15 points.
name: few_dummy8_1.0

taskDescription: Participants attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from a designated spot while sitting on a chair.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at a reasonable distance from the chair. The participant sits on the chair and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can. The chair's position can be adjusted to increase difficulty.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can is worth 1 point. The participant has 10 attempts. The total score is the number of successful throws out of 10.
name: few_dummy9_1.0

taskDescription: Participants balance books on their head while navigating a simple obstacle course made with a lamp and a cushion from the sofa.
detailedSetting: Place the sofa cushion and lamp at intervals to create a path that the participant must navigate. The participant places up to three books on their head and attempts to walk the course without dropping them.
goalSetting: The goal is to walk the entire course without dropping any books.
scoringSystem: Successfully navigating the obstacle course with all three books is worth 3 points. Losing a book reduces the score by 1 point per book. Completion time of under one minute adds a bonus point.
name: few_dummy9_1.0

taskDescription: A playful indoor bowling game using bowls as pins and a waste paper ball as the bowling ball.
detailedSetting: Arrange the bowls in a triangular formation as bowling pins at one end of the room. The participant stands at the opposite end and rolls the waste paper ball to knock over the bowls.
goalSetting: The goal is to knock down all the bowls in the fewest rolls possible.
scoringSystem: Each bowl knocked over is worth 1 point. Participants have three attempts to achieve the maximum score of 4 points. A bonus point is awarded for achieving this in just one roll.
name: few_dummy9_1.0

taskDescription: Participants balance a pillow on their head while trying to place a bowl filled with the potted plant on top without letting anything fall.
detailedSetting: Place the pillow gently on top of the participant's head. While maintaining balance, they must use only one hand to place and hold a bowl, which contains the potted plant, atop the pillow. They must stand still for at least 30 seconds without anything falling.
goalSetting: Successfully balance the pillow, bowl, and potted plant on the participant's head for 30 consecutive seconds.
scoringSystem: - 5 points for achieving the full 30 seconds without dropping. - Deduct 1 point for each time a part of the setup falls before the time is complete. - 2 bonus points if the participant remains still for an additional 15 seconds (45 seconds total).
name: few_dummy10_1.0

taskDescription: Participants use headlines from the newspaper and sentences from a randomly selected book page to create an original story in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Open the newspaper to a random page and select a headline. Select a book, flip to a random page, and pick two sentences. These will serve as inspiration for crafting a short, creative story written in the notebook with the pen.
goalSetting: Write a coherent and creative story in the notebook that integrates the chosen newspaper headline and book sentences.
scoringSystem: - 10 points for a complete story that incorporates all elements innovatively. - 5 points for creativity and originality in storyline. - Participant may rate their satisfaction with their creative process on a scale of 1-5 for an additional subjective score.
name: few_dummy10_1.0

taskDescription: An indoor bowling game where bowls are set as pins and the waste paper ball is used as the bowling ball.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four bowls in a triangular formation at one end of the room, similar to bowling pins. Place the tray upside down to create a smooth lane. The participant rolls or slides the waste paper ball from the opposite end of the room to knock over the bowls.
goalSetting: Successfully knock over as many bowls as possible with three attempts.
scoringSystem: - 2 points for each bowl knocked over. - A strike (all bowls down in one roll) earns a bonus of 3 points. - 1 point deducted for each bowl not knocked over after three attempts.
name: few_dummy10_1.0

taskDescription: The participant builds a stable and creative tower using a set number of books, enhancing balancing and creative spatial skills.
detailedSetting: Place the tray upside-down on a flat surface, such as a desk or a rug. The participant then starts stacking the books on the turned tray, trying to create the highest possible tower without it falling.
goalSetting: The goal is to stack all five books on the tray without the tower toppling over.
scoringSystem: Scoring is based on height and stability: 1 point for each book successfully balanced; Bonus points (2 points) for completing the tower without any books falling.
name: few_dummy11_1.0

taskDescription: The participant, while blindfolded, tries to toss a waste paper ball into a trash can from a seated position on a chair.
detailedSetting: Place the chair in a designated spot in the room with the participant seated on it. Position the trash can a couple of meters in front of the chair. The participant holds the waste paper ball and uses the pillow as a blindfold. On the count of three, the participant attempts to throw the ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: The aim is to successfully land the waste paper ball into the trash can while blindfolded.
scoringSystem: 2 points for landing the ball in the trash can; 1 point if the ball hits the trash can but does not go in; 0 points for any other outcome.
name: few_dummy11_1.0

taskDescription: The participant creates a quick presentation inspired by the poster, using the pen and notebook to jot down key points.
detailedSetting: Set the poster on one of the desks where it's clearly visible. The participant sits at an adjoining desk with the notebook and pen and is given five minutes to write down a mini-presentation inspired by the content of the poster.
goalSetting: The goal is to create a coherent, insightful presentation based on the poster within five minutes.
scoringSystem: Content Creativity: 0-5 points based on originality; Presentation Structure: 0-5 points based on clarity and organization; Total score possible: 10 points.
name: few_dummy11_1.0

taskDescription: Create shadow art by using a lamp to cast shadows of a dummy against a poster.
detailedSetting: Place the poster on a flat surface against the wall. Position the dummy between the lamp and the poster so that the lamp casts the dummy's shadow onto the poster. Adjust the distance and angles to alter the size and shape of the shadows.
goalSetting: The goal is to create interesting and creative shadow art using the dummy's shadow cast on the poster.
scoringSystem: Score creativity and complexity of the shadow art on a scale from 1-10, with 10 being highly creative and complex, and 1 being simple or lacking creativity.
name: few_dummy12_1.0

taskDescription: Attempt to toss a waste paper ball into the trash can from increasingly distant positions.
detailedSetting: Place a chair at a starting point, with a trash can positioned at a reasonable distance away. Sit on the chair and try to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can. After each successful toss, move the chair one step further away from the trash can and repeat.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from the furthest distance possible.
scoringSystem: Score is based on the number of successful tosses. Each successful toss from a further position adds 1 point to your score. The maximum score depends on the number of positions set.
name: few_dummy12_1.0

taskDescription: Balance as many pillows as possible while lying on the sofa within one minute.
detailedSetting: Lie on the sofa with a pillow placed on different parts of your body (e.g., arms, legs, head). Use the clock to time the task, ensuring you keep the pillows balanced without them falling for 60 seconds.
goalSetting: The goal is to balance the maximum number of pillows on your body without letting them fall off for a duration of one minute.
scoringSystem: Score 1 point for each pillow successfully balanced for the entire minute. If any pillows fall off, they do not count towards the score. Maximum score is based on the number of pillows used.
name: few_dummy12_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns using a pillow to knock a waste paper ball into a trash can from a fixed distance.
detailedSetting: Set up a line on the floor with one pillow, which marks the standing point. The trash can is placed 5 feet away, and the waste paper ball starts at the standing point. Players will use the other pillow to push the ball towards the trash can.
goalSetting: The aim is to deliver the paper ball into the trash can using the pillow in as few pushes as possible.
scoringSystem: Each player scores points based on the number of attempts taken to get the ball in the trash can. Each attempt is worth 1 point. The player with the fewest points after three rounds wins.
name: few_dummy13_1.0

taskDescription: Creativity meets speed as players design a quick sketch inspired by the room's existing paintings within one minute.
detailedSetting: Position the dummy in front of the paintings. Each participant starts with a notebook and a pen. Standing in front of the dummy for inspiration, participants have exactly one minute to sketch something influenced by the paintings’ style.
goalSetting: Create a uniquely inspired sketch in under a minute.
scoringSystem: After completing the sketches, participants exchange their drawings. Each drawing is rated on creativity and resemblance to the painting on a scale of 1 to 5 by the other player. The highest combined score out of 10 wins.
name: few_dummy13_1.0

taskDescription: Test your knowledge and memory by reading an article from the newspaper and then answering trivia questions based on it.
detailedSetting: Sit in a chair with the clock nearby. Read a selected article from the newspaper for three minutes, using the clock to keep track of time.
goalSetting: Answer as many trivia questions related to the article correctly as possible after reading.
scoringSystem: Each correct answer to the trivia questions earns 2 points. A partner or second person can ask the questions. If playing alone, prepare questions in advance. The goal is to accumulate the highest score through correct answers.
name: few_dummy13_1.0

taskDescription: A fun tossing game where the player aims to throw a waste paper ball into bowls placed at varying distances.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four bowls in a line on the floor at different distances from a designated throwing spot marked by the chair. The player sits on the chair and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the bowls. Place the bowls at distances of 1m, 2m, 3m, and 4m.
goalSetting: To successfully toss the paper ball into as many bowls as possible from the sitting position.
scoringSystem:
Bowl 1 (1m distance): 1 point
Bowl 2 (2m distance): 2 points
Bowl 3 (3m distance): 3 points
Bowl 4 (4m distance): 4 points
Maximum score possible per round is 10 points. Replay the game 3 times, and the highest cumulative score wins.
name: few_dummy14_1.0

taskDescription: A balance challenge where participants must walk across the rug balancing a pillow on their head within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Place the rug on the floor as the racecourse. Use the clock to time 30 seconds for the race. The player must start at one end of the rug, put a pillow on their head, and walk to the other end without dropping the pillow.
goalSetting: To walk across the rug without the pillow falling off within 30 seconds.
scoringSystem:
Reaching the end without dropping: 5 points
Dropping the pillow but finishing: 2 points
Not finishing within 30 seconds: 0 points
Conduct three rounds for the ultimate pillow balance master, and the person with the highest total score wins.
name: few_dummy14_1.0

taskDescription: A timed writing challenge to craft a short story, using words and ideas inspired by a randomly chosen page from the newspaper.
detailedSetting: Set the clock for 10 minutes. The player selects a random page from the newspaper and uses it as inspiration to write a short story in the notebook with the pen provided. The clock is set to start when the writing begins.
goalSetting: To write a coherent and creative short story in 10 minutes inspired by the newspaper content.
scoringSystem:
Creativity: 1-5 points
Coherence: 1-5 points
Use of newspaper content: 1-5 points
Maximum score is 15 points. Optionally, a second person (if available) can judge the entry. The entry with the highest score after three rounds wins.
name: few_dummy14_1.0

taskDescription: Create a bowling-like game using books as pins and a waste paper ball as the bowling ball.
detailedSetting: Arrange the books in a V formation on one side of the room. The bowl acts as a placeholder for the ball when not in use. Stand at the opposite end of the room and bowl the paper ball towards the books, trying to knock over as many as possible.
goalSetting: Knock over all the books with the fewest throws of the waste paper ball.
scoringSystem: 1 point for each book knocked over per throw. The challenge is to use the fewest throws to score all 5 points; therefore, fewer throws yield a better score.
name: few_dummy15_1.0

taskDescription: Test your memory by matching items with their descriptions using a notebook and newspaper.
detailedSetting: Write different descriptions or words (related to items in the room) on ten pages of the notebook and cover each with a pillow. Use the newspaper to obscure view of the selected words while preparing. Subsequently, reveal them one by one and recall or guess from memory what item or concept each relates to.
goalSetting: Accurately match as many descriptions to items as possible using memory.
scoringSystem: Score 1 point for each correct match. Aim for all descriptions to be correctly matched for a perfect score.
name: few_dummy15_1.0

taskDescription: Construct a fort using available items and complete a creative role-playing adventure.
detailedSetting: The sofa acts as the base of the fort. Use the tray and paintings as walls and ceilings of the fort. The potted plant serves as decoration or defensive armor in the quest. The kettle is your treasure at the heart of the fort.
goalSetting: Create a detailed adventure storyline culminating in finding the kettle treasure within your improvised fort.
scoringSystem: Creativity and immersion score: Rate from 1-10 based on the story's depth, the fort's design quality, and the engagement level throughout your adventure.
name: few_dummy15_1.0

taskDescription: Attempt to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from various designated distances using different techniques.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Position a chair 5 feet away as the starting point and mark three additional spots at increasing distances (7 feet, 9 feet, 11 feet). The participant stands on each marked spot and attempts to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from each marked distance.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss from the starting point earns 1 point, 7 feet earns 2 points, 9 feet earns 3 points, and 11 feet earns 5 points. The maximum score is 11 points.
name: few_dummy16_1.0

taskDescription: Balance bowls on a tray while walking from one side of the room to the other without dropping any.
detailedSetting: Place one pillow at one side of the room as the starting point. Stack up to four bowls on the tray. The participant starts from the pillow, balancing the tray with bowls, and walks across the room.
goalSetting: Reach the opposite side of the room without tipping any bowls off the tray.
scoringSystem: Earn 1 point for each bowl that remains balanced at the end of the walk. The maximum score is 4 points.
name: few_dummy16_1.0

taskDescription: Write a short story using words from randomly selected book pages within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Select two books and open them randomly to a page. Use the pen and notebook to write a short story by incorporating at least 10 words from each book's selected pages. Use the clock to set a time limit of 30 minutes.
goalSetting: Craft a cohesive and creative story utilizing words found from the books within the time limit.
scoringSystem: Self-evaluate the story on creativity (0-5 points) and cohesiveness (0-5 points). The maximum score is 10 points.
name: few_dummy16_1.0

taskDescription: The player will sit on a chair and attempt to throw a waste paper ball into a trash can placed at a distance. The objective is to score as many baskets as possible within a given number of attempts.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at least 2 meters away from the chair. The player sits on the chair with the waste paper ball in hand. They will throw the ball aiming to get it into the trash can.
goalSetting: Shoot the waste paper ball into the trash can accurately and score as many points as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can is worth 1 point. The player attempts 10 throws, and their score is the total number of successful shots out of 10.
name: few_dummy17_1.0

taskDescription: Players will create a tower using pillows and books on a desk without the structure toppling. The objective is to use all items in the tower without it collapsing within a limited time frame.
detailedSetting: Place a desk in an open area of the room. Stack pillows and books alternately on top of each other on the desk, aiming to build the tallest tower possible without it falling.
goalSetting: Build a stable tower using all the provided items.
scoringSystem: Award 2 points for each item successfully placed in the tower without collapsing. An additional 5-point bonus is given if all items are used and the tower stands for over 30 seconds.
name: few_dummy17_1.0

taskDescription: Participants will cut out images and text from a newspaper to create an art collage in the notebook, using a pen for additional drawings or embellishments.
detailedSetting: Use the notebook as a base for the collage. Cut out various pieces from the newspaper and arrange them aesthetically inside the notebook. Use the pen to draw lines, borders, or add notes alongside the pasted images.
goalSetting: Create a visually appealing collage that tells a story or represents a theme of choice.
scoringSystem: Once finished, evaluate the collage on creativity, coherence of theme, and overall visual impact on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being exceptionally creative and coherent.
name: few_dummy17_1.0

taskDescription: Toss a waste paper ball into a trash can from a distance while sitting in a chair.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Place a chair at a reasonable distance from the trash can (about 6-10 feet depending on room size). The participant sits on the chair and attempts to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from the chair.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the trash can earns 10 points. Attempt the toss 5 times, and the highest possible score is 50 points. Adjust the chair distance based on difficulty preference.
name: few_dummy18_1.0

taskDescription: Balance a book on your head while walking around with a pillow under one arm in a timed setting.
detailedSetting: Place a book on your head and hold a pillow under one arm. Use the clock to time yourself walking from one end of the room to the other without dropping the book or pillow.
goalSetting: The goal is to complete the walk in the fastest time possible while keeping the book balanced and the pillow secured.
scoringSystem: Complete the walk in less than 30 seconds for 10 points, 31-60 seconds for 5 points, and any longer without dropping results in 1 point. Dropping the book or pillow results in 0 points.
name: few_dummy18_1.0

taskDescription: Recreate the visuals of one of the paintings by sketching in your notebook.
detailedSetting: Select one of the paintings in the room as your subject. Sit comfortably with your notebook and pen, and spend time sketching your interpretation of the painting.
goalSetting: The goal is to capture the essence or details of the painting as accurately or creatively as possible.
scoringSystem: Rate the sketch from 1 to 10 based on detail, creativity, and resemblance to the painting. Use personal judgment or ask someone else to evaluate if possible.
name: few_dummy18_1.0

taskDescription: A fun indoor bowling game using pillows as "pins" and a waste paper ball as the "bowling ball."
detailedSetting: Set up four chairs in a square formation, two on each side to create lanes. Position the two pillows upright on the floor at one end of the lane to act as the bowling pins. Stand the waste paper ball at the opposite end, which acts as the bowling "ball."
goalSetting: Knock over the pillows by rolling the waste paper ball at them, as if bowling.
scoringSystem: Each pillow knocked over earns 5 points. The maximum score per roll is 10 points. Each player gets two rolls per turn, and the player with the highest total score after three rounds wins.
name: few_dummy19_1.0

taskDescription: Create a tall and steady tower of books using all the book items and one notebook to see who can build the tallest tower without toppling it.
detailedSetting: Place a desk in an open area of the room. Players take turns stacking the books and notebook on the desk, starting with a strong base and continuing upward.
goalSetting: Build the tallest stable book tower within three minutes, without the tower falling.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of each completed book tower. The tower that is tallest and remains stable for at least 10 seconds after building earns the most points. Top points are 15 for maintaining the highest tower, 10 for second-highest, and 5 for third-any stable entries.
name: few_dummy19_1.0

taskDescription: Aiming game where participants throw pieces of rolled-up newspaper into a trash can from different distances marked by bowls on the rug.
detailedSetting: Spread the rug on the floor and place the trash can on one end. Set two bowls at different distances along the rug to serve as throwing lines for varying challenge levels. Tear the newspaper into several rolled-up balls for throwing.
goalSetting: Score points by successfully tossing newspaper balls into the trash can from designated distances marked by the bowls.
scoringSystem: Throws made from the nearest bowl line earn 1 point, and those from the furthest line earn 3 points. Each participant gets ten attempts, with the participant scoring the highest points declared as the winner.
name: few_dummy19_1.0

taskDescription: Create a game using discarded paper and a trash can where participants aim to score by tossing the paper ball into the trash can.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Stand at a designated spot several feet away from the trash can, using a rolled-up newspaper as the throwing line. Take turns tossing the waste paper ball towards the trash can, trying to get it in.
goalSetting: Get the paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible within a set number of throws.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the trash can scores 2 points. If the paper ball touches the rim but doesn't go in, award 1 point. The participant with the highest score after a set number of attempts (e.g., 10 throws) wins.
name: few_dummy20_1.0

taskDescription: A balance challenge where the participant attempts to balance a pen on an upside-down cup.
detailedSetting: Place the cup upside down on a flat surface, such as a desk. The objective is to balance the pen on the base of the upside-down cup without it falling off for a set duration of time like 30 seconds.
goalSetting: Successfully balance the pen on the cup for the specified duration without it falling.
scoringSystem: Award 3 points for balancing the pen for 30 seconds. Deduct 1 point for each fall, trying again until the allotted time runs out. The goal is to achieve as many points as possible.
name: few_dummy20_1.0

taskDescription: A speed reading challenge where the participant aims to read and comprehend a passage as quickly as possible.
detailedSetting: Arrange the chairs in a semi-circle with a book placed on each seat. Using the clock to time yourself, start with the first book and read a specified passage. Move on to the next chair and book in sequence as quickly as possible.
goalSetting: Read and comprehend passages from all five books in the shortest time.
scoringSystem: Record the completion time for reading all passages. After finishing, answer basic comprehension questions about each passage. Each correct answer earns 5 points, and a bonus of 10 points is given for completing the task in under a specified time, such as 5 minutes. The total score is determined by combined comprehension and timing points.
name: few_dummy20_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest stable book stack possible on a chair without it toppling over.
detailedSetting: Place a chair next to a desk. Use the five available books to create a stack on the chair. You can use the desk for support or to lean on, but the books must be stacked on the chair itself.
goalSetting: To construct the tallest stable stack of books that remains standing for at least 10 seconds.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of each completed stack. Award 1 point for every inch of height achieved. The score is added only if the stack maintains stability for 10 seconds.
name: few_dummy21_1.0

taskDescription: Use a waste paper ball to knock over a small bowling setup involving bowls placed on a tray.
detailedSetting: Arrange four bowls in a diamond formation on a tray, which serves as the bowling alley. Stand about 6 feet from the tray and use the waste paper ball as a makeshift bowling ball, rolling it towards the bowls.
goalSetting: To knock over as many bowls as possible with a single roll of the waste paper ball.
scoringSystem: Each knocked-over bowl counts as 1 point. Score points based on the number of knocked-over bowls per turn. The maximum score for one roll is 4 points.
name: few_dummy21_1.0

taskDescription: Create a short story inspired by visual elements from a poster.
detailedSetting: Hang the poster on a wall or lay it flat on a surface where it can be viewed clearly. Sit comfortably with the notebook and pen ready.
goalSetting: To write a short story of at least 100 words based on interpreting the visuals in the poster.
scoringSystem: Rate the creativity of the story on a scale from 1 to 10, using criteria such as creativity, coherence, and connection to the poster's elements. Self-assessment or an assessment from the optional participant (if available) can be utilized.
name: few_dummy21_1.0

taskDescription: The goal is to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from a set distance while seated on a chair.
detailedSetting: The trash can is placed at a set distance from a chair. The player sits on the chair and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can. The distance can be adjusted based on the player's skill level.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible within a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the trash can earns 1 point. A perfect score (all attempts successful) can earn a bonus point. The player with the highest points after a set number of rounds wins.
name: few_dummy22_1.0

taskDescription: The aim of the task is to balance a broom vertically using one finger for as long as possible.
detailedSetting: The player stands in an open area in the room and positions the broom vertically on the tip of one finger. The clock is started as soon as the broom is balancing, and time is recorded until the broom falls.
goalSetting: Attempt to balance the broom in a vertical position for the longest possible duration.
scoringSystem: Time is recorded in seconds, with each second contributing 1 point. Bonus points are awarded for reaching significant thresholds, such as an additional 5 points for reaching 60 seconds.
name: few_dummy22_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compete to build the tallest and most stable tower using books on a desk.
detailedSetting: Five books are provided, and the desk serves as the base platform. Players take turns stacking the books one on top of another to create a book tower without it falling.
goalSetting: The goal is to build a taller, steady tower using all available books without it toppling over.
scoringSystem: Points are awarded for each book successfully stacked, with a bonus for using all books without toppling. Each stable book in the tower earns 2 points, and completion with all books without falling earns an extra 5 points.
name: few_dummy22_1.0

taskDescription: Two players compete in a game of Pictionary, using a pen to draw on a poster. One player draws a word or phrase, while the other guesses as quickly as possible.
detailedSetting: Place the poster on the desk or a sofa, so it's visible to both players. Each player takes turns selecting a word or phrase to draw with the pen on the poster. The artist has 1 minute to complete their drawing.
goalSetting: The goal for each round is to guess the correct word or phrase before the time runs out.
scoringSystem: Each correct guess within the minute earns the guessing player 1 point. The player with the most points after a set number of turns (e.g., 5 rounds each) wins the game.
name: few_dummy23_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns balancing books on their heads while seated on a chair, utilizing pillows as obstacles for added challenge.
detailedSetting: Arrange a chair in the room with two pillows placed on the floor around it to create a small obstacle course. Each participant sits on the chair and attempts to balance three books on their head. Players must sit still for at least 30 seconds without letting the books fall.
goalSetting: Successfully balance all three books for the entire duration without any falling.
scoringSystem: Successfully balancing all three books for 30 seconds earns 3 points. Losing one book results in 2 points; two books, 1 point; and three books, 0 points. The player with the most points over three attempts wins.
name: few_dummy23_1.0

taskDescription: Players aim to toss a waste paper ball into a trash can from a set distance while sitting on a chair.
detailedSetting: Position a chair a few feet away from the trash can. Each participant sits on the chair and takes turns tossing the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully land the waste paper ball in the trash can.
scoringSystem: Landing the waste paper ball in the trash can earns the player 1 point. Players have five attempts, and the player with the highest score wins. In the event of a tie, a sudden death additional round is conducted.
name: few_dummy23_1.0

taskDescription: This is a solo game where the player must toss a paper ball from a pillow into one of the bowls positioned at varying distances.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to place the pillow on the floor near one corner of the room. Arrange two bowls at different distances from the pillow: one bowl should be 3 feet away and the other 5 feet away. The player sits or kneels on the pillow with the waste paper ball in hand.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to toss the waste paper ball into either of the bowls, aiming to score in the farther targets.
scoringSystem: In this task, scoring is as follows: 10 points for landing the ball in the closer bowl, 20 points for the farther bowl. The player has 5 attempts and total points determine success.
name: few_dummy24_1.0

taskDescription: The participant reads a book and performs a scavenger hunt by searching for specific words or phrases noted in the notebook.
detailedSetting: To start this task, choose one book and place it on the desk. Keep the notebook and pen on the desk for easy access. Pre-determine a list of 10 words or phrases to find and write them in the notebook.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to find and mark all the specified words or phrases in the book as quickly as possible.
scoringSystem: In this task, award 5 points per word/phrase found, with 1 bonus point for finding all within 10 minutes. Total score is out of 51.
name: few_dummy24_1.0

taskDescription: Set up an indoor scene using available items and take creative photos of the potted plant with different lighting and backgrounds.
detailedSetting: To start this task, position the lamp to highlight the potted plants with adjustable lighting. Use the paintings as different background settings. Turn on the TV to display a static image as an alternative background.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to create and photograph three unique setups with the potted plant, focusing on different lighting, angles, or backgrounds.
scoringSystem: In this task, self-evaluate creativity for each photo on a scale of 1-5. Maximum score is 15 points based on creativity.
name: few_dummy24_1.0

taskDescription: Participants are tasked with creating a sketch of the room scenery focusing on the potted plant and paintings.
detailedSetting: Place the chair where you have a good view of the potted plant and one of the paintings. Sit with the notebook and pen in hand. Use the notebook to draw a sketch of the room focusing on the potted plant and one painting. Encourage creativity and unique perspectives.
goalSetting: Capture the essence of the room's scenery in your sketch within 20 minutes.
scoringSystem: Evaluate the sketch on a scale of 1 to 10 based on creativity, accuracy, and use of space. A perfect score is 10, showing a creative interpretation with attention to detail.
name: few_dummy25_1.0

taskDescription: Balance as many books on your head as possible while walking back and forth across the rug for a set time.
detailedSetting: Place the books on a flat surface near the rug. Stand at one end of the rug, place one book on top of your head, and try to walk to the other end without dropping it. Use the clock to time your activity and increase the number of books being balanced with each successful trip.
goalSetting: Walk across the rug balancing the maximum number of books without dropping them within 10 minutes.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for each book successfully carried to the other side without dropping. The participant with the most points after 10 minutes wins.
name: few_dummy25_1.0

taskDescription: Toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from varying distances using the chairs.
detailedSetting: Arrange the chairs in a line starting at 2 feet away from the trash can and extending to 6 feet. Start at the closest chair, sit down, and attempt to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from each chair.
scoringSystem: Award 2 points for each successful toss from a chair. Completing a toss from all four chairs equals a perfect score of 8 points.
name: few_dummy25_1.0

taskDescription: Participants race against time to read as much as possible in a limited timeframe.
detailedSetting: Select one book from the available collection and sit comfortably by the desk with the lamp for optimal lighting. A clock is set nearby to track the reading duration.
goalSetting: Read as many pages as possible within a set time limit of 10 minutes.
scoringSystem: Each page read within the timeframe counts as 1 point. Incomplete pages do not count. Record the total points after the time expires.
name: few_dummy26_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create a themed art piece in a notebook, drawing inspiration from chosen objects in the room.
detailedSetting: Sit at any desk with the notebook and pen. Position the potted plant in view as one inspiration source. Use the paintings on the walls as additional visual themes for the artwork.
goalSetting: Create a unique and themed art piece within the notebook over a 30-minute period, drawing from the chosen room elements for inspiration.
scoringSystem: Score from 1-10 based on the creativity and thematic representation in the final artwork, with feedback from another participant if available or a self-assessment focusing on theme and originality.
name: few_dummy26_1.0

taskDescription: Navigate through an obstacle course to sit on the designated chair while avoiding obstacles.
detailedSetting: Arrange three chairs in a line, spaced evenly apart. The fourth chair is placed at the end as the target "sit" chair. Use pillows and the broom as obstacles along the course path. The waste paper ball is used as a distraction to navigate around.
goalSetting: Successfully reach the target chair and sit without knocking over any obstacle within 2 minutes.
scoringSystem: Participants earn 10 points for reaching and sitting on the target chair within time. Deduct 2 points for each obstacle hit or displaced. Maximum score achievable is 10 points per round.
name: few_dummy26_1.0

taskDescription: Use the waste paper ball to shoot into the trash can while sitting on a chair using pillows for target range variation.
detailedSetting: Place a chair at one end of the room. Position the trash can at a reasonable distance (about 6 feet) from the chair. Use the pillows to create different stations with varying distances from which the player will shoot the waste paper ball into the trash can. The player must remain seated on the chair while making the shots.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from different distances.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot from a close range (without pillows) is 1 point, from the medium-range (one pillow station) 3 points, and from a long-range (two pillow station) 5 points. Add up the points from successful shots. The goal is to achieve the highest score possible within a set number of throws (e.g., 10 throws).
name: few_dummy27_1.0

taskDescription: Speed-read a collection of books, summarizing each as succinctly as possible against the clock.
detailedSetting: Arrange the five books on the desk. Place the clock in a visible location to serve as a timer. The participant reads each book as quickly as possible, spending a maximum of 5 minutes per book, and then writes a one-sentence summary.
goalSetting: Complete all summaries within the allocated time for each book with a focus on capturing the essence of the content.
scoringSystem: Each completed summary earns the participant 10 points if done within the 5-minute mark. An additional creativity bonus of up to 5 points can be awarded per summary by evaluating the uniqueness and insightfulness of the summary. Total points can range from 0 to 75.
name: few_dummy27_1.0

taskDescription: Two players take turns drawing different sections of a collaborative poster design within a limited time.
detailedSetting: Place the poster on a flat surface on top of one of the desks. Each player gets a turn to draw on a designated section of the poster using the pen, switching every 30 seconds as prompted by the clock.
goalSetting: Create a complete and visually interesting design collaboratively on the poster.
scoringSystem: Once the poster is complete, each participant gives a score from 1 to 10 for creativity and coherence, with the final score being the average of these ratings. High marks are given for teamwork and the aesthetic quality of the poster.
name: few_dummy27_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player creates the tallest and most stable stack of books on a pillow.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to place one pillow on the floor as a base, then use the books to create the tallest stack possible on top of the pillow. The clock is used for timing the stability of the stack.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to stack all five books on top of the pillow without them falling for at least 10 seconds.
scoringSystem: In this task, players earn 5 points for each book successfully stacked, with a 10 bonus points if the stack remains stable for 10 seconds. The maximum potential score is 35 points.
name: few_dummy28_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player tests aim and coordination by shooting a waste paper ball into the trash can from a fixed distance.
detailedSetting: To set up this task, the player places one chair at a designated distance (e.g., 2 meters) from the trash can, sits on this chair, and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can. The second chair is used to mark the start and reset point.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from the sitting position.
scoringSystem: In this task, players score 10 points for each successful throw, with a deduction of 1 point for each missed attempt. The first person to reach 50 points wins.
name: few_dummy28_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player reads for relaxation and comprehension followed by a short writing exercise to summarize.
detailedSetting: To start the task, the player sits on the sofa with the lamp turned on for good lighting, reads the newspaper, and after reading, uses the notebook and pen to write a brief summary or reflection about the article read.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to achieve relaxation through reading and accurately summarize or reflect on what was read.
scoringSystem: In this task, relaxation is rated on a scale of 1-10 post-reading, and the written summary is evaluated out of 10 points based on clarity and insight. Both scores are combined for a total possible score of 20 points.
name: few_dummy28_1.0

taskDescription: Participants attempt to toss a waste paper ball onto pillows placed on chairs from a distance.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four chairs in a line, each with a pillow placed on the seat. The chairs should be spaced equally apart. Participants stand at a designated throw line, approximately 5 feet away, and try to toss the waste paper ball onto any of the pillows.
goalSetting: The objective is to land the waste paper ball on as many pillows as possible in five attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss onto a pillow earns 1 point. The participant with the highest number of points after all attempts wins.
name: few_dummy29_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compete against the clock to see how quickly they can read a predetermined number of pages from a book.
detailedSetting: Place the books on the desks. Each participant sits on a chair in front of a desk. The clock is placed where all participants can see it, set to count down from a specified time (e.g., 5 minutes).
goalSetting: The goal is to read as many pages as possible before time runs out.
scoringSystem: Each participant earns 1 point for each full page read. The participant with the most pages read at the end of the time wins.
name: few_dummy29_1.0

taskDescription: Participants arrange various items on a tray and attempt to carry it across the room without dropping anything.
detailedSetting: The tray starts on the sofa with all items (2 cups, 4 bowls, 1 potted plant) placed on or around it. Participants lift the loaded tray and carefully traverse the room to a designated endpoint and back.
goalSetting: The aim is to transport all items on the tray across the room and back without dropping any.
scoringSystem: Points are awarded based on the number of items successfully transported: 1 point per cup, 1 point per bowl, and 2 points for the potted plant. If all items remain balanced on the tray after the journey, a bonus of 2 points is added. The highest score indicates the winner.
name: few_dummy29_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, you will test your plant care knowledge and creativity by creating a care plan for the potted plant and presenting it creatively.
detailedSetting: Place the potted plant on a desk. Sit down with the notebook and pen. Use the waste paper ball as a brainstorming tool by throwing it to yourself after jotting down each idea, aiming to hit a target (e.g., chair or trash can).
goalSetting: Create a 7-day plant care schedule that includes watering, sunlight requirements, and creative ways to enhance its growth. Use the notes to guide your care strategy.
scoringSystem: Award yourself 1 point for each comprehensive care idea written. Score an additional 3 points for successfully hitting your waste paper ball target within three tries while brainstorming. Maximum score is 10 points.
name: few_dummy30_1.0

taskDescription: Test your coordination by carrying a tray with bowls balanced on it while navigating around obstacles within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Place the sofa and chairs to form a small obstacle course. Place the bowls on the tray. Start at one end of the room and use the clock to keep time.
goalSetting: Walk the course as quickly as possible without dropping any bowls. Complete the course in under 2 minutes for a perfect score.
