scoringSystem: Award 5 points for each bowl that remains on the tray at the end. Deduct 2 points for every 30 seconds over the time limit. Maximum score is 20 points.
name: few_dummy30_1.0

taskDescription: Exercise your memory and creativity by creating a memory game from descriptions of paintings, books, and newspaper articles.
detailedSetting: Describe each painting and select interesting articles from the books and newspaper. Place writings on chairs, splitting them into pairs representing descriptions and titles, respectively.
goalSetting: Match the descriptions with the correct painting, book excerpt, or newspaper article.
scoringSystem: Receive 2 points for each correct match made. A bonus of 3 points is awarded for completing all matches within 5 minutes. Maximum score is 30 points.
name: few_dummy30_1.0

taskDescription: Create the tallest book tower using available books while standing on a chair for extra height.
detailedSetting: Place two chairs side by side to form a stable base. Stand on one chair and stack books taken from the other chair to form the tallest tower possible without toppling.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the highest stable tower that can stand for at least 5 seconds without falling over.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the book tower. Each inch of height is worth 1 point. Additional 5 points are awarded if the tower remains standing for an additional 10 seconds beyond the initial 5 seconds.
name: few_human1_1.0

taskDescription: Two participants act as art critics, each evaluating a poster and two paintings, attempting to guess the theme or emotion intended by the artist.
detailedSetting: Hang the poster and two paintings on the walls. Each participant takes turns describing the art pieces, suggesting themes, and explaining their reasoning.
goalSetting: The objective is to creatively interpret the artwork and provide the most convincing and entertaining criticism.
scoringSystem: Each participant receives points based on originality (1-10 points), coherence (1-10 points), and entertainment value (1-10 points) as scored by their peer. The highest total score wins.
name: few_human1_1.0

taskDescription: Turn the room into a mini basketball court where participants score by throwing the waste paper ball into the trash can from varying distances.
detailedSetting: Place four chairs at different spots in the room, marking four shooting positions with increasing distance from the trash can. Assign point values (e.g., 1 point, 2 points, 3 points, and 5 points) based on difficulty.
goalSetting: Score the highest number of points by successfully making throws into the trash can from the various marked positions.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot adds to the participant's score based on the point value of the position they shot from. The player with the most points after all positions are attempted wins.
name: few_human1_1.0

taskDescription: Two players compete to score the most points by tossing a waste paper ball into a trash can from the sofa.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can a suitable distance from the sofa (e.g., 3-5 meters, depending on the size of the room). Each player sits on the sofa and takes turns tossing the waste paper ball towards the trash can.
goalSetting: The objective is to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible within a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the trash can scores 1 point. The person with the highest score after a predefined number of rounds (e.g., 10 tosses per person) wins the challenge.
name: few_human2_1.0

taskDescription: Participants write a poetic piece or a short prose inspired by the potted plant, then share it with each other.
detailedSetting: Sit on the sofa with the notebook and pen. Position the potted plant within sight for inspiration. Each participant has 15 minutes to write their poetry or prose piece.
goalSetting: The task aims to create the most moving or creative piece based on the potted plant.
scoringSystem: After writing, participants read their pieces aloud. Each participant scores the other's piece based on creativity and emotional impact, from 1 to 10. The piece with the highest total score wins.
name: few_human2_1.0

taskDescription: Set up an obstacle course using furniture, and see who can navigate it the fastest while balancing a book on their head.
detailedSetting: Arrange the chairs and other items (lamp, clothes hangers, broom) on top of the rug to create a path with turns and narrow gaps. Balance a book on each participant’s head as they walk through the maze.
goalSetting: Navigate the course successfully without dropping the book, using the fastest and most controlled pace.
scoringSystem: Time each participant as they complete the maze. The participant with the fastest time while keeping the book on their head wins 5 points. If the book falls, 1 point is deducted for each drop.
name: few_human2_1.0

taskDescription: Use the newspaper to create a ball and aim to knock over the bowls arranged like bowling pins.
detailedSetting: Roll the newspaper into a tight ball. Arrange the 4 bowls in a triangular bowling pin setup at one end of the room. Stand at least 3 meters away and use the newspaper ball to try and knock down the bowls.
goalSetting: The goal is to knock down as many bowls as possible with a single throw of the newspaper ball.
scoringSystem: Each knocked-down bowl equals 1 point. A perfect score is 4 points in one round. Play a total of 5 rounds, and the participant with the highest score wins.
name: few_human3_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns critiquing the paintings and noting their observations, aiming to provide the most insightful commentary.
detailedSetting: Hang the two paintings on opposite walls in the room. Each participant takes turns with the notebook and pen, standing in front of the paintings, and writing a brief critique or observation. Allow two minutes per painting.
goalSetting: The goal is to come up with the most insightful and creative critique of the paintings.
scoringSystem: After both participants have written their critiques, they present them to each other. Each participant rates their peer's critique on a scale from 1 to 10 based on creativity and insightfulness. The highest combined score wins.
name: few_human3_1.0

taskDescription: Create a fun and challenging obstacle course using available furniture and pillows to navigate around the room.
detailedSetting: Arrange the chairs and pillows as barriers, stepping stones, or to climb over. The sofa can serve as the start and finish line. Set the pillows on opposite sides of an imaginary path created with the chairs.
goalSetting: The goal is to complete the obstacle course from start to finish in the quickest time without touching the floor.
scoringSystem: Time each participant’s run from start to finish. Deduct 5 seconds for each time the participant touches the floor instead of the obstacles. The participant with the shortest adjusted time wins.
name: few_human3_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player acts as a plant caretaker, ensuring the potted plant is watered and taken care of within a set time.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to place the potted plant on the tray near natural lighting if possible. Use any non-provided imaginary source of water to pretend water the plant. Participants take turns caring for the plant, with the aim of keeping it 'healthy.'
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to correctly perform a sequence of plant-care actions as instructed, such as watering, trimming, or moving the plant to better conditions within the room.
scoringSystem: In this task, participants receive 1 point for each correctly performed action within a designated time frame (e.g., 2 minutes), up to a maximum of 5 points.
name: few_human4_1.0

taskDescription: Creat a mini-bowling game where players roll a waste paper ball towards a set of bowls arranged like bowling pins.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to arrange the four bowls in a triangle formation on the floor, resembling bowling pins. Participants take turns from a marked distance (e.g., 5 feet away) to roll the waste paper ball towards the bowls with the intention of knocking them over.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to knock down as many bowls as possible with the waste paper ball in two attempts per turn.
scoringSystem: In this task, players earn 1 point for each bowl knocked down per round. The player with the highest total score after three rounds wins.
name: few_human4_1.0

taskDescription: This task involves a timed creative writing contest between two participants using the provided notebook and pen.
detailedSetting: To start this task, each participant takes turns using the notebook and pen. Participant 1 writes for 5 minutes, crafting a brief story or description related to an object in the room. After 5 minutes, the notebook is passed to Participant 2, who continues or starts a new segment using another object as inspiration.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to write the most engaging or creative piece within the time limit.
scoringSystem: In this task, after both participants have written their entries, they read them aloud. Each participant rates the other's creativity on a scale of 1 to 10. The entry with the highest score wins.
name: few_human4_1.0

taskDescription: Two participants compete to boil water in the kettle the fastest to see who can guess the boiling time more accurately.
detailedSetting: Place the kettle on a heat source, if available, in the room. Both participants will estimate how long it will take to bring the water to boil. The clock is used to time the boiling process.
goalSetting: The goal is for each participant to predict the boiling time as accurately as possible.
scoringSystem: Participants write down their estimated time in minutes and seconds before starting. Once the kettle whistles, the time is stopped. The participant whose guess is closest to the actual boiling time without going over earns a point. The participant with the most points after a predetermined number of rounds wins.
name: few_human5_1.0

taskDescription: Participants balance books on their heads while walking from one chair to another.
detailedSetting: Place two chairs at opposite sides of the room as starting and ending points. Each participant balances as many books as possible on their head and walks from the starting chair to the ending chair without dropping any books.
goalSetting: The objective is to carry the maximum number of books successfully from the starting chair to the ending chair.
scoringSystem: Each book successfully carried to the ending chair counts as 1 point. Books that are partially moved but dropped before reaching the goal do not count. The participant with the highest book points after all rounds is the winner.
name: few_human5_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create a short story using ten words they find from random sections in the newspaper.
detailedSetting: Each participant randomly selects ten words from the newspaper. These words are written in the notebook. Using the pen, participants create a short story that incorporates each of the selected words.
goalSetting: The goal is to write a coherent and creative story that uses all ten selected words.
scoringSystem: After sharing their stories, each participant rates the other’s story on creativity, coherence, and use of words from 1 to 10. The scores are averaged, and the participant with the higher score wins.
name: few_human5_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns attempting to throw a waste paper ball into a trash can from a designated distance using a chair as a marker.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can in one corner of the room. Set a chair at a challenging but feasible distance from the trash can to mark the shooting position. The player stands behind the chair when taking their shot.
goalSetting: The objective is to successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can earns 1 point. The player with the most points after 10 attempts wins.
name: few_human6_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compete to build the tallest, freestanding tower using the provided books within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Choose a desk as the base for the construction. The books should be stacked vertically on the desk to form a tower. The participant builds a tower using the books provided.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest possible stable tower using all five books.
scoringSystem: Score based on the height and stability of the book tower. Participants earn 1 point per book successfully stacked. If the tower remains standing after 1 minute, an additional 2 points is awarded.
name: few_human6_1.0

taskDescription: Create an imaginative story inspired by the themes or scenes depicted in the paintings, writing down ideas in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Hang both paintings within a clear view. Sit comfortably on the sofa, armed with a pen and notebook, and begin by observing the details in the paintings.
goalSetting: Compose a creative and coherent short story or piece, consisting of at least five sentences, inspired by any elements or themes observed in the paintings.
scoringSystem: Once the story is completed, it is rated on creativity, coherence, and how well it connects to the paintings on a scale of 1-10 by the person involved or the other person in the room.
name: few_human6_1.0

taskDescription: Participants build the tallest possible stable tower using upturned chairs, balanced by a tissue.
detailedSetting: Four chairs are provided to the participant, who is tasked with stacking them on top of each other to create a tower. A single tissue is used to balance on the top, marking the height. Participants must ensure the structure remains stable and upright.
goalSetting: The goal is to construct the highest tower using all four chairs with the tissue positioned at the top without the structure falling.
scoringSystem: The structure is judged based on height from the floor to the tissue. Base height is awarded 1 point per chair used successfully, and a bonus of 5 points if the tissue stays balanced for 30 seconds. The total score is out of 9 points.
name: few_human7_1.0

taskDescription: A fun and relaxed game where the participant tries to throw a waste paper ball into a trash can from a seated position on the sofa.
detailedSetting: Place the sofa across the room approximately 3 meters away from the trash can. The participant sits comfortably on the sofa and attempts to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can in as few attempts as possible.
goalSetting: The aim is to land the paper ball in the trash can within the least number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the trash can scores 3 points. Subtract 1 point per additional attempt after the first successful toss. The objective is to maintain a high score on fewer attempts.
name: few_human7_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns to creatively interpret and critique two paintings, judged by originality and insight.
detailedSetting: The two paintings are set up side by side within clear view. Each person takes turns describing their interpretation and engaging in a mock critique, with the other person prepared to listen and respond.
goalSetting: The goal is to provide the most creative and engaging critique of the paintings, listening carefully to the other's response to develop a dialogue about art interpretations.
scoringSystem: Each participant critiques both paintings, scoring from 1-10 based on originality, creativity, and engagement by the listener. Total cumulative scores from both participants will determine the winner, out of a possible 20 points.
name: few_human7_1.0

taskDescription: Use the waste paper ball to score points by tossing it into the trash can from different distances within the room.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can in the center of the room. Use a chair to mark different distances (3 feet, 5 feet, and 7 feet) from the trash can. Stand at each marked distance and toss the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from each marked distance.
scoringSystem: Successfully tossing the ball into the trash can from 3 feet earns 1 point, from 5 feet earns 3 points, and from 7 feet earns 5 points. The highest total score wins.
name: few_human8_1.0

taskDescription: Search through the newspaper to find and note down specific items or words that match a predetermined list.
detailedSetting: Use the notebook to write down a list of categories or words to find in the newspaper (e.g., "article title," "advertisement," "image with a pet"). Then, use the pen to mark or list in the notebook where these items or words occur in the newspaper.
goalSetting: Identify and note down all items or words from the list as quickly as possible.
scoringSystem: Each correctly identified and recorded item or word in the notebook earns 2 points. The participant who scores all points in the shortest time wins.
name: few_human8_1.0

taskDescription: Use the bowl as a bowling ball to knock down a setup of books that act as pins, sliding along a path on the floor.
detailedSetting: Arrange three books in a triangular formation on the floor in front of the sofa, which serves as a backstop. Use the pillow to sit or kneel comfortably behind the "bowling lane." Roll the bowl along the floor to knock over the books.
goalSetting: Knock over as many books as possible with one roll of the bowl.
scoringSystem: Each knocked-over book earns 3 points. If all books are knocked over in a single roll, earn an additional 5-point bonus. The highest total score after a set number of rounds wins.
name: few_human8_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns stacking as many books as possible on their head while seated on the sofa. The aim is to maintain balance and avoid the books falling for as long as possible.
detailedSetting: The participant sits comfortably on the sofa. The stack of five books is placed within reach. The participant attempts to balance one book at a time on their head. Another person can help hand the books to the participant if needed.
goalSetting: The goal is to balance all five books on your head without them falling off for the longest duration.
scoringSystem: 1 point is awarded for each successfully balanced book. Maintaining the full stack of 5 books for more than 10 seconds earns a bonus of 5 points. The person with the highest total score wins.
name: few_human9_1.0

taskDescription: Participants use old newspaper sheets to sketch unique designs or abstract art. Then they describe their creation in the notebook using a pen.
detailedSetting: Spread a newspaper sheet on the desk. Use a pen to draw designs or images on the newspaper page. After completing the drawing, the participant writes a descriptive paragraph about their artwork in the notebook.
goalSetting: Create an imaginative piece of art and describe the thought process or story behind it.
scoringSystem: Participants rate each other's artwork and description on a scale of 1 (poor) to 10 (excellent) for creativity and originality. The highest total score from both ratings wins.
name: few_human9_1.0

taskDescription: A relay race around a series of chairs using a tray to carry a potted plant and delivering a waste paper ball to the finish line.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four chairs in a square formation. The potted plant is placed on the tray, and the participant must navigate around the chairs without dropping the plant. The waste paper ball is carried on the tray initially and must be left on one of the chairs during the relay.
goalSetting: Complete the relay around the chairs and successfully place the waste paper ball on a chair without dropping the plant.
scoringSystem: Participants are timed from start to finish. An additional 10 seconds is added for each time the plant or tray is dropped. The quickest time, after adjustments, determines the winner.
name: few_human9_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns trying to toss a waste paper ball into a trash can from a set distance to score points.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at a designated spot on the floor. Position a chair a few feet away from the trash can. The player sits on the chair and attempts to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can. Each player gets three attempts before switching turns.
goalSetting: Successfully land the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw scores 1 point. The player with the most points after a round of three throws wins.
name: few_human10_1.0

taskDescription: Players ask each other questions about the content from selected books to test their knowledge and memory.
detailedSetting: Select three books from the collection and sit around a desk. Each player reads a short passage from a book, writes down a question related to the passage in the notebook, and then asks the other player to answer it. Alternating turns, each player gets a chance to both question and answer.
goalSetting: Answer as many questions as correctly as possible based on the book passages.
scoringSystem: Each correct answer earns 2 points. The player with the most points at the end of the round wins.
name: few_human10_1.0

taskDescription: Test your balance and coordination by walking back and forth across a designated path while balancing books on a tray.
detailedSetting: Lay out a path on the floor between the sofa and the clock. Place two books on a tray. The player must walk this path while balancing the tray without letting the books fall. The clock is used to time one minute per attempt.
goalSetting: Complete as many laps as possible along the path without dropping the books within a minute.
scoringSystem: Each complete lap without dropping any books scores 1 point. The player with the most points after a timed session is the winner.
name: few_human10_1.0

taskDescription: Use the bowls as "pins" and the waste paper ball as the "bowling ball" to knock down the bowls in a fun indoor bowling game.
detailedSetting: Place the four bowls in a triangle formation on the tray to act as pins. The tray is positioned at one end of the room. Stand at a designated spot a few feet away and roll the waste paper ball to try and knock down as many bowls as possible.
goalSetting: The objective is to knock down all four bowls using the waste paper ball.
scoringSystem: Each bowl knocked over counts as one point. Knocking over all four in one roll awards an additional bonus point. Maximum score per round is 5 points.
name: few_human11_1.0

taskDescription: Conduct an interactive quiz based on the care and knowledge about the potted plant.
detailedSetting: Place the potted plant on a desk. Sit with the other person on the sofa. The quizmaster (you or the participant) writes questions related to plant care in the notebook. Conduct the quiz by asking these questions aloud.
goalSetting: The goal is to answer the questions to the best of participants' ability, earning points for correct answers.
scoringSystem: Each correct answer earns 1 point, with a perfect score rewarding an extra bonus point. The maximum possible score depends on the number of questions, with an additional point for full completion.
name: few_human11_1.0

taskDescription: Participants build the tallest stable tower using available books on the desk and chairs.
detailedSetting: Place the two desks side by side, ensuring they're stable and at a comfortable height for building. Set the chairs around the desks so participants can easily maneuver and stack the books. Participants take turns stacking the books to create the tallest possible tower that must fit entirely on top of the two desks.
goalSetting: The goal is to construct the highest possible book tower without it collapsing.
scoringSystem: Measure the final height of the tower using a ruler or estimate by eye. Award 1 point for each inch (or estimated inch) the tower stands without falling. Deduct 2 points for each book that causes the tower to fall.
name: few_human12_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns throwing a waste paper ball at a hanging poster target, aiming for precision and accuracy.
detailedSetting: Hang the poster using the clothes hangers from an improvised line or the clothes tree. Position the sofa at a reasonable distance to serve as the throwing spot. Participants will stand or sit on the sofa to throw the waste paper ball.
goalSetting: The aim is to hit specific sections of the poster, which may be marked or predefined by folds or drawings for point values.
scoringSystem: Mark zones on the poster prior to the game, allocating points for each zone (e.g., center = 5 points, surrounding areas = 3 points, edge = 1 point). Each participant takes turns, and points are tallied per throw. The player with the highest total after a set number of throws wins.
name: few_human12_1.0

taskDescription: Participants attempt to toss a waste paper ball into a line of chairs from a set distance in a time-sensitive challenge.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four chairs in a line, each spaced about a foot apart. Designate a tossing line approximately five feet away from the first chair. The waste paper ball should be placed at the tossing line.
goalSetting: The goal is to toss the waste paper ball successfully onto as many of the chairs as possible within one minute.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss that lands and stays on a chair scores 1 point. The participant with the most points after all attempts wins.
name: few_human13_1.0

taskDescription: Two players take turns acting out scenes or titles from the available books, while the other person guesses.
detailedSetting: Place the five books on one of the available desks. Each player draws one book per turn and silently acts out a scene, character, or the title from the book for the other person to guess.
goalSetting: The goal is to guess as many book titles or scenes correctly within a time limit.
scoringSystem: Each correct guess earns 2 points. Play multiple rounds with each person acting, winner is the one with the highest total points.
name: few_human13_1.0

taskDescription: Use the lamp and tissue to create shadow sculptures or scenes on the wall, involving naturally available items for a creative touch.
detailedSetting: Place the lamp on the desk, with the light facing a clear wall. Position the tissue and potted plant between the lamp and the wall to create interesting shadow shapes. Adjust the distance and angles to form recognizable or artistic patterns.
goalSetting: The goal is to create the most visually appealing or creative shadow sculptures using the available items.
scoringSystem: Participants rank each other's shadow creations on creativity and aesthetic appeal from 1 to 5 points. The shadow with the highest average score wins.
name: few_human13_1.0

taskDescription: Play a fun game of bowling using a waste paper ball as the bowling ball and books as pins.
detailedSetting: Arrange the books in a triangle formation at one end of the rug with all books standing up, resembling a bowling pin setup. Stand at the opposite end of the rug, using it as the designated bowling lane. Roll the waste paper ball towards the books, aiming to knock them over.
goalSetting: The goal is to knock over as many books as possible by rolling the waste paper ball across the rug.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for each book knocked down. The maximum score per roll is 5 points. Play a set of three rounds, and the player with the highest total score wins.
name: few_human14_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns sketching an object of choice in a notebook, while the other guesses what it is under limited lighting.
detailedSetting: Position the lamp on a desk and lower its light to create a dim setting. The first participant selects an item in the room without revealing it to the other, sketches it in the notebook using the pen, and gives hints about the object only if necessary.
goalSetting: The objective is to accurately guess the object being sketched using fewer hints.
scoringSystem: Each guesser gets 1 point for each correct guess with no hints. If hints are required, 1 point is deducted per hint. The participant with the most points after both have had three turns at guessing wins.
name: few_human14_1.0

taskDescription: A team relay game where players must carefully carry cups filled with water across a series of chairs without spilling.
detailedSetting: Arrange the chairs in a straight line. Each player must carry a cup filled to the brim with water, using the tray to hold it, and walk across the chairs one by one.
goalSetting: The objective is to successfully carry the cup from the first to the last chair without spilling.
scoringSystem: Each successful traversal without spills earns 5 points. Should any water spill, 1 point is deducted per drop that spills outside the tray. The player with the highest score after three rounds wins.
name: few_human14_1.0

taskDescription: Participants attempt to toss a waste paper ball into a trash can using the pillows as barriers.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Stack the two pillows on top of each other approximately 4 feet away from the trash can to partially block it. The participant stands behind a designated line, roughly 8 feet from the trash can, and attempts to throw the waste paper ball over or around the pillows into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can despite the pillow barriers.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can is worth 5 points. The participant has 5 attempts, and the total score is the sum of all successful throws.
name: few_human15_1.0

taskDescription: The participant draws sketches inspired by the paintings and the potted plant present in the room.
detailedSetting: Position the notebook and pen on one of the desks. The participant sits at the desk with a clear view of the paintings and the potted plant. They are encouraged to draw interpretations or details from these two sources.
goalSetting: Create as many detailed sketches as desired within a 20-minute timeframe, focusing on creativity and expression.
scoringSystem: After 20 minutes, the participant evaluates their sketches based on creativity (1-10), detail (1-10), and resemblance (1-10). The total score is the sum of these ratings, with a possible maximum score of 30.
name: few_human15_1.0

taskDescription: Create a makeshift bowling game using bowls as pins and a rolled-up newspaper as a ball.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four bowls in a pyramid formation at the far end of the room, with one bowl in the front and three bowls behind it in a triangular pattern. The participant stands at the opposite end of the room. Roll the newspaper tightly and use the tray as a launching pad to bowl.
goalSetting: Knock down all the bowls in as few throws as possible.
scoringSystem: Each knocked-over bowl is worth 2 points. The participant has five attempts to knock down all the bowls; bonus points (5 points) are awarded if all bowls are knocked over in one attempt. The highest possible score is 13 points if all bowls are knocked down with one throw.
name: few_human15_1.0

taskDescription: Participants engage in a quick sketch contest where each person uses the pen and notebook to sketch a scene or object within a limited time.
detailedSetting: Both participants sit across from each other with the pillow placed in the middle of a chair or on the sofa. The pen and notebook are shared, with each person taking their turn. The task can be to sketch the pillow or create a scene involving it within a set time, such as 3 minutes.
goalSetting: Create the most creative or detailed sketch within the time limit.
scoringSystem: Sketches are scored on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity, detail, and resemblance to the object. Both participants then share scores and the highest total score wins.
name: few_human16_1.0

taskDescription: Participants alternate reading a passage from each of the five books, attempting to finish reading designated sections within the shortest time possible without making mistakes.
detailedSetting: Two desks are set up side by side, each with a chair. The five books are placed in a line between the two desks. Participants sit and pick any book to begin reading, continuing around the circle of books. Each participant takes turns read aloud and notes errors or pauses.
goalSetting: Read passages accurately and quickly. The fastest error-free passage reading wins.
scoringSystem: Each participant receives points based on speed and accuracy. Deduct 1 point for each reading mistake. Award 1 point for each book successfully completed. The participant with the most points at the end of the relay wins.
name: few_human16_1.0

taskDescription: A relaxation and balance game, where participants hold different poses inspired by the potted plant's shapes or surroundings, attempting to remain steady for as long as possible.
detailedSetting: The rug is placed centrally in the room with the potted plant on one side and the bowl placed on the other. Participants alternately pose on the rug, drawing inspiration from the plant’s shape or growth style, balancing and holding for extended periods.
goalSetting: Hold the inspired pose for the longest possible time without losing balance.
scoringSystem: Measured in seconds, each second held in the pose without wobbling or moving from the spot earns 1 point. Bonus points are awarded for extra creativity and closeness to the plant's natural form, rated by the second participant or a subjective self-assessment. The highest score wins the challenge.
name: few_human16_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns balancing books on their heads while carrying the waste paper ball to the other side of the room without dropping anything.
detailedSetting: Each participant starts at one side of the room with three books stacked on their head. They hold a waste paper ball in their hand. The objective is to walk to the other side of the room and back without the books falling.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully make it to the other side of the room and back without dropping the books or the waste paper ball.
scoringSystem: Participants earn 1 point for each step taken without dropping the books. If the books are dropped, they restart from where they last successfully held them.
name: few_human17_1.0

taskDescription: A participant writes a creative story based on random words provided by the other person in the room, aiming to complete the story in a set time.
detailedSetting: The participant sits at a desk with the notebook and pen. The other individual provides five random words. The writer incorporates these words into a story within a 15-minute period.
goalSetting: Create an engaging and coherent story using all the given words in the time limit.
scoringSystem: Stories are rated on a creativity scale from 1 to 10, with input from both participants. The score is the average of both ratings.
name: few_human17_1.0

taskDescription: Participants use a tray as a sliding platform to knock over bowls that have been stacked on chairs.
detailedSetting: Three chairs are aligned at one side of the room. A bowl is stacked on each chair, while a fourth bowl is placed upright a few feet in front of the row of chairs. Participants stand at a designated line and slide the tray on the floor to knock over as many bowls as possible.
goalSetting: Knock down the bowls on the chairs using the sliding tray.
scoringSystem: Each knocked-over bowl earns the participant 2 points. The position of the bowls at the end of each throw determines the final score.
name: few_human17_1.0

taskDescription: A fun indoor game where the goal is to throw a waste paper ball onto chairs from a designated standing point to score points.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four chairs in a line, each spaced about two feet apart. Designate a standing line about six feet away from the first chair. Players take turns standing at the line and throwing the waste paper ball to land on the seats of the chairs.
goalSetting: The goal is to land the waste paper ball on as many chairs as possible within five throws.
scoringSystem: Each successful attempt to land the waste paper ball on a chair earns the player one point. Accumulate points, and the player with the most points after five rounds wins.
name: few_human18_1.0

taskDescription: A knowledge-based game where participants quiz each other on book contents to score points.
detailedSetting: Select three books and place them on a desk. Both participants read sections of the books for 10 minutes. After reading, each prepares 3 trivia questions for the other, using the notebook and pen.
goalSetting: Correctly answer as many trivia questions as possible based on the book content.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for each correct answer. The player with the most points after all questions are answered wins.
name: few_human18_1.0

taskDescription: An inventive game where players use bowls to 'bowl' down cups and avoid knocking over the potted plant, creating a fun new take on bowling.
detailedSetting: Arrange two cups upright with the potted plant between them to form a triangle. Set a starting line about six feet away from the setup. Players take turns rolling a bowl from the line, aiming to knock over the cups without touching the plant.
goalSetting: Knock down both cups while keeping the potted plant standing after three rolls.
scoringSystem: Knocking over one cup earns 1 point, both cups 3 points; knocking over the potted plant results in a deduction of 2 points. The player with the highest score after all turns wins.
name: few_human18_1.0

taskDescription: Participants engage in a game of bowling using a potted plant as the target and bowls as bowling balls.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four bowls in a row, each spaced equally apart, on one end of the rug. Place the potted plant upright at the opposite end of the rug. Participants stand behind a starting line marked with a piece of tissue and take turns rolling the bowls towards the plant, trying to knock it over.
goalSetting: Knock over the potted plant using the bowls as bowling balls.
scoringSystem: Each successful attempt where the plant is knocked over scores 5 points. If the plant wobbles but does not fall, award 2 points. The player with the most points after three rounds wins.
name: few_human19_1.0

taskDescription: Use snippets from the newspaper to create a mysterious story that can captivate any audience.
detailedSetting: Lay the newspaper flat on the desk alongside the book and a notebook. Use the pen to excerpt interesting headlines, articles, or images from the newspaper, and combine them with elements from a book to draft your story in the notebook.
goalSetting: Create the most intriguing mystery story using inspiration from the newspaper and book.
scoringSystem: The other participant reads the story and provides a creativity score from 1 to 10. Higher scores reflect better storytelling and more engaging plots.
name: few_human19_1.0

taskDescription: Plan a fictional day in which participants efficiently allocate time slots for various activities, represented visually by the clock.
detailedSetting: Place the clock prominently on the desk where it is easily viewable. Use the notebook to plan a schedule for a fictional day's activities. Use the pen to draft the schedule, and the lamp to create a focused working area by illuminating the workspace.
goalSetting: Create a detailed and efficient daily schedule that makes the most of each hour represented on the clock.
scoringSystem: Each schedule is reviewed by the other participant who will rate its organization and feasibility on a 1 to 10 scale. A higher score reflects a well-structured plan that maximizes productivity and balances activities.
name: few_human19_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns reading sections of a book aloud, racing against the clock to cover as much material as possible within a set time frame per participant.
detailedSetting: Arrange two chairs in the room, spaced evenly apart. Place two selected books on each chair. Set the clock visible to both participants for timekeeping. Each participant sits on a chair with a book, while the other has a turn reading.
goalSetting: The goal is to read aloud as many pages as possible within a 3-minute time limit per turn, improving reading speed and comprehension.
scoringSystem: Count the number of complete pages read accurately within the time. Each complete and accurately read page counts as 1 point. The highest total score after both participants have taken their turns wins.
name: few_human20_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create quick scribbles inspired by the paintings in the room, focusing on creativity and speed on a blank page of the notebook.
detailedSetting: Set up the notebook and pen on a flat surface near the paintings. Set the lamp to focus on the notebook for better visibility.
goalSetting: The objective is to fill as many pages with creative scribbles or sketches inspired by the paintings within a 5-minute period.
scoringSystem: Each filled page earns 2 points. Creativity is judged subjectively, with additional points (1-3) awarded by the other participant based on the expressive quality of the scribbles. The participant with the most points wins.
name: few_human20_1.0

taskDescription: Build a fort using items commonly found in the room, then enjoy a movie from the comfort of your self-made fort.
detailedSetting: Use the sofa and chair as structural bases. Place pillows and the rug or a blanket over these to form a cozy fort. Set up facing the TV to be able to view comfortably from inside.
goalSetting: The goal is to create the most comfortable and creative fort in the room to enjoy watching a short show or movie clip on the TV.
scoringSystem: Evaluate based on creativity (1-5 points) and comfort (1-5 points) as rated by the other participant or self-assessment. Maximum possible score is 10. The higher score determines the winner for this task.
name: few_human20_1.0

taskDescription: The participant must toss the waste paper ball, made from the newspaper, into the trash can from a distance. This is a test of skill and accuracy.
detailedSetting: Set up the trash can on one side of the room. Place a mark on the floor (e.g., using a small book or tape) about 3 meters away from the trash can. The participant stands at the mark and throws the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the paper ball into the trash can from the marked spot.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for each successful throw into the trash can. The participant can make up to 10 attempts. The highest scorer has the most successful throws within these attempts.
name: few_human21_1.0

taskDescription: The participant prepares tea and solves a word puzzle, using the notebook and pen, while waiting for the tea.
detailedSetting: Set the tray with two cups and the kettle nearby. Heat water with the kettle and pour it into one of the cups. Use the notebook to write down as many words as you can form from the letters in the word "KETTLE" while the tea cools.
goalSetting: Create as many unique words as possible from the letters in "KETTLE" during the time it takes for the boiling water to cool in the cup.
scoringSystem: Each valid, unique word counts as 1 point. The participant can set their timer or feel the temperature to declare the end when they deem the tea cool enough to drink, at which point they sum their points.
name: few_human21_1.0

taskDescription: Construct a creative structure using books and pillows on the sofa within a set time limit, testing creativity and structural balance.
detailedSetting: Place the sofa in an open space where both sides are accessible. Use the five books and two pillows to build a tower or other structure on the sofa. Use the clock to time the activity to five minutes.
goalSetting: Create the tallest and most stable structure possible using the books and pillows on the sofa within the time limit.
scoringSystem: After five minutes, measure the height of the structure in inches or centimeters. Award 1 point for every 2 centimeters. Give an additional 5 points if the structure doesn't collapse for 30 seconds after time is up.
name: few_human21_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns tossing a waste paper ball, aiming to land it on a pillow on the chair, then into a trash can to score points.
detailedSetting: Place two chairs about 5 feet apart. On each chair, place a pillow. The trash can is positioned 2 feet behind one of the chairs. Players stand behind the other chair and toss the waste paper ball, aiming first for the pillow, then into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully land the paper ball onto the pillow and then into the trash can in one toss.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss onto a pillow earns 1 point, and landing it into the trash can thereafter earns 3 additional points. The player with the highest score after 5 rounds wins.
name: few_human22_1.0

taskDescription: Players pick a random book page and create a story based on its text, writing it in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Arrange the books on a desk or sofa. Each player takes turns randomly selecting a page from any book and reads it silently. Using the pen and notebook, they write a short story inspired by the chosen page within a 10-minute time frame.
goalSetting: Craft an imaginative and complete story within the time limit.
scoringSystem: After both participants present their stories, each player scores the other's story on creativity, coherence, and originality, on a scale from 1 to 5 in each category. The player with the highest combined score wins.
name: few_human22_1.0

taskDescription: Participants balance a tray with bowls stacked on it while following a set path around the room.
detailedSetting: Arrange a path using furniture or floor elements like the potted plant as markers. The player must walk the defined path while balancing the tray with stacked bowls on one hand.
goalSetting: Complete the path without dropping any bowls from the tray.
scoringSystem: Completing the path without dropping any bowls grants 10 points. Dropping a bowl results in a loss of 2 points per bowl. The person with the highest score after three attempts is the winner.
name: few_human22_1.0

taskDescription: Build a fort using pillows, a sofa, and chairs to create a cozy structure within the room.
detailedSetting: Arrange the two pillows on top of the sofa and use the chairs around the sofa to create walls or a supporting structure for the fort. If allowed, use available fabric or sheets (imaginary for the sake of the task) to drape over the chairs and sofa to form the roof and sides of the fort.
goalSetting: The goal is to create a sturdy and comfortable pillow fort that can fit at least one person inside.
scoringSystem: Judge the fort on a scale of 1-10 based on three criteria: stability (up to 3 points), creativity (up to 3 points), and comfort (up to 4 points). A higher score indicates a better fort.
name: few_human23_1.0

taskDescription: The participant stands at a distance and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can against one wall of the room. The participant stands at a set distance (e.g., 5 feet) from the trash can and has five attempts to throw the waste paper ball into it.
goalSetting: The objective is to get the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can counts as 1 point. With five attempts, the maximum score is 5 points.
name: few_human23_1.0

taskDescription: Two players select random sentences from the books and create short stories or poems in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Each participant selects a book and finds a random sentence to inspire a short story or poem. Using the notebook and pen, each person writes for 5 minutes based on their chosen sentence. Swap sentences after the first round for a second round.
goalSetting: The goal is to creatively combine the sentence from the book into an original short story or poem.
scoringSystem: Each story is scored based on creativity (1-5), coherence (1-3), and use of the sentence (1-2), with a total possible score of 10 per story. The highest cumulative score after two rounds wins.
name: few_human23_1.0

taskDescription: Compete to read a chosen paragraph from a book as quickly and accurately as possible.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs two participants. Each player selects a book and sits comfortably on the pillows placed on the floor. They choose the same paragraph to read. Both participants read simultaneously, with the non-reading participant keeping time or judging accuracy.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to accurately read the paragraph faster than the other participant.
scoringSystem: In this task, each word read accurately counts as 1 point. A deduction of 0.5 points is applied for each mistake. The participant with the highest total score wins, and in the case of a tie, the fastest time determines the winner.
name: few_human24_1.0

taskDescription: Arrange the poster and paintings creatively and sketch the final layout within the room.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs one desk as a work area. Participants use the notebook and pen to plan their arrangement. The poster and paintings are then placed in various creative configurations on the wall or room area.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to create the most aesthetically pleasing arrangement and sketch it in the notebook.
scoringSystem: In this task, participants rate each other’s arrangements based on creativity, practicality, and aesthetics. The scale used is from 1 to 10 for each criterion, with a maximum score of 30 points. The participant with the highest score wins.
name: few_human24_1.0

taskDescription: Score as many points as possible by tossing the waste paper ball into the trash can from varying distances.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to arrange chairs at different distances from the trash can to serve as shooting lines. Each line corresponds to a different point value: closest is 1 point, second is 2 points, third is 3 points, and farthest is 5 points.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to accumulate the highest score by strategically choosing shooting distances and successfully tossing the ball into the trash can.
scoringSystem: In this task, a successful shot from each line earns the corresponding points. Each participant has five attempts, and the total score is the sum of the points from successful shots. The participant with the highest score wins.
name: few_human24_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns attempting to throw a waste paper ball into a trash can from different distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can in an open area of the room. Position a chair 5 feet away from the trash can as the starting line. Each player takes a position on the chair and throws the waste paper ball towards the trash can. Distance is increased by moving the chair further away.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from various distances, with the goal of making the most successful throws.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can earns 1 point. The person with the most points after five throws wins.
name: few_human25_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compete to balance and stack as many books as possible on a tray held on their head while seated.
detailedSetting: Sit on a chair in an uncluttered area of the room. Place the tray on your head and start stacking books one by one on the tray.
goalSetting: Balance and stack as many books as possible on the tray without them falling off.
scoringSystem: Each book successfully balanced on the tray is worth 1 point. Players keep stacking books until they fall. The person with the highest stack at the end wins.
name: few_human25_1.0

taskDescription: Two players engage in a game of tag using pillows as tags, where the objective is to "tag" the opponent by touching them with the pillow.
detailedSetting: Each player takes a pillow and positions themselves in opposite corners of the room. The players attempt to tag each other by lightly touching their opponent with the pillow while avoiding being tagged themselves.
goalSetting: Tag the opponent player using a pillow without being tagged first.
scoringSystem: A successful tag equals 1 point. The game can be played in rounds, first to 5 points wins, or within a time limit (e.g., 5 minutes) and the player with the most points at the end wins.
name: few_human25_1.0

taskDescription: Use the pillows as bowling balls to knock down chairs set up like bowling pins.
detailedSetting: Arrange the 4 chairs in a triangular formation, spanning out from the corner of the room. Place the waste paper ball behind the chairs as the target pin. Use the pillows to gently roll or toss towards the chairs from a designated "bowling line" a few feet away.
goalSetting: The goal is to knock down as many chairs as possible, with points awarded for direct hits. Once the chairs are knocked down, the aim is to finally hit or land the waste paper ball.
scoringSystem: Knock down 1 chair: 1 point. Knock down 2 chairs: 3 points. Knock down 3 chairs: 5 points. Knock down 4 chairs: 8 points. Knock down the waste paper ball: Bonus 5 points.
name: few_human26_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest newspaper tower using support from the books and tray.
detailedSetting: Use the ground or a desk as the base. Start building your tower by folding and shaping the newspaper to create height and stability. Use the books on either side for extra structural support and balance. The tray can be used to cap the tower or provide a flat base for better stability.
goalSetting: The goal is to create the tallest possible tower using only the newspaper, books, and tray for support.
scoringSystem: Every inch of height achieved: 1 point. Completely balanced (stands on its own for 10 seconds): Additional 5 points. Reaches the height of the small tray used vertically: Bonus 10 points.
name: few_human26_1.0

taskDescription: Slide bowls across the desk aiming for specific time slots marked by the clock and score points based on accuracy.
detailedSetting: Place the two desks end to end to form a longer surface. Use the clock to mark different "time zones" along the desk surface, perhaps 3, 6, 9, and 12 indicating difficulty levels. Place the tray at the start of the desk as the launching line where the bowls must begin.
goalSetting: The objective is to slide the bowls across the desk so they stop in designated time zones, with higher points for harder zones.
scoringSystem: Bowl stops at 3 o'clock zone: 1 point. Bowl stops at 6 o'clock zone: 3 points. Bowl stops at 9 o'clock zone: 5 points. Bowl stops at 12 o'clock zone: 8 points. Successfully land all 4 bowls in different zones: Bonus 10 points.
name: few_human26_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest possible tower using chairs and a newspaper without the tower collapsing.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four chairs in a square to provide a stable base. The newspaper is then folded or twisted to be used as stoppers, steadying or extending the chair arrangement to increase height. Participants take turns stacking chairs vertically or creatively using the newspaper until the tower topples or the items are depleted.
goalSetting: The aim is to construct the highest tower possible using all chairs and the newspaper.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the chair tower in inches or centimeters. Each inch/centimeter counts as 1 point. The participant with the highest score wins. If the tower collapses during measurement, score the next tallest stable height.
name: few_human27_1.0

taskDescription: Toss a waste paper ball into a series of bowls from different distances to test accuracy and aim.
detailedSetting: Line up the four bowls in a path at various distances from a starting line, each placed on a chair to add height. The participant stands at the starting line and attempts to toss the waste paper ball into each bowl in sequence, moving further away with each successful toss.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully land the waste paper ball into all bowls, progressing from closest to furthest.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into a bowl earns 5 points, with a bonus of 5 points for getting all bowls within a single round. The person with the highest points within 10 tosses wins.
name: few_human27_1.0

taskDescription: Prepare a cup of tea using trivia challenges gleaned from books, where each correct answer allows progress in the tea-making process.
detailedSetting: Both participants sit around a desk or on the sofa. One person selects trivia questions from a book and asks the other person. After correctly answering a question, the participant can proceed to the next step: filling the kettle, boiling water, pouring tea into the cup, etc.
goalSetting: The task's objective is to correctly answer all trivia questions to successfully brew, pour, and drink a cup of tea before the opponent does.
scoringSystem: Each correctly answered trivia question allows a step forward in making tea, with the first person to complete and enjoy their cup of tea winning the game. Time taken to complete the task serves as a tiebreaker; the faster completion time wins in case of a draw.
name: few_human27_1.0

taskDescription: Play a mini-golf game by using a broom to hit a waste paper ball across the room into a trash can.
detailedSetting: Set up the desks and trash can on opposite sides of the room. Use the broom as a "golf club" to hit the waste paper ball across the room. Try to get the waste paper ball into the trash can in the fewest strokes possible.
goalSetting: Score a "hole-in-one" by getting the waste paper ball into the trash can in as few tries as possible.
scoringSystem: Count the total number of strokes it takes to get the ball into the trash can. Fewer strokes result in a higher score, similar to golf.
name: few_human28_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create a story based on random headlines from a newspaper, writing them down and presenting to an audience.
detailedSetting: Sit the participants around in chairs facing each other. Each participant takes turns randomly choosing a headline from the newspaper. They must create a short story based on that headline within 5 minutes and write it in the notebook with the pen. Each participant then presents their story to the other person.
goalSetting: Develop a creative and engaging story that captivates the audience using limited resources.
scoringSystem: The other participant rates the story on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity and storytelling skills.
name: few_human28_1.0

taskDescription: A timed challenge to balance bowls on a tray and walk around the room without dropping them.
detailedSetting: Set the start and end points by placing the sofa and potted plants on opposite sides of the room. Place all four bowls on the tray. The objective is to walk from the sofa to the potted plant, carrying the tray, and return to the sofa, in the shortest time possible without dropping any bowls.
goalSetting: Complete the course in the shortest time while keeping all bowls balanced on the tray.
scoringSystem: Time each attempt with the clock. Score is based on how quickly the course is completed; deduct 5 seconds for each bowl dropped. The best time wins.
name: few_human28_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns tossing the waste paper ball into a cup placed at varying distances to see who has better aim.
detailedSetting: Place the cup on the floor at one end of the room. Participants stand at a designated starting line and attempt to toss the waste paper ball into the cup. The trash can is used to collect missed attempts. Adjust the distance for each round to increase difficulty.
goalSetting: The aim is to successfully toss the paper ball into the cup as many times as possible from varying distances.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the cup is worth 1 point. The participant with the most points after five rounds wins. If there’s a tie, a sudden death round determines the winner.
name: few_human29_1.0

taskDescription: Test your skill in balance by stacking chairs onto each other without causing them to collapse, using the kettle as a balancing aid.
detailedSetting: Start with one chair on the ground, and carefully stack the remaining chairs on top of each other. The kettle is placed on the highest chair for added difficulty. Ensure a safe space is made for this activity.
goalSetting: Stack all chairs while maintaining balance with the kettle on top without any chairs falling over.
scoringSystem: 2 points are awarded for each successful chair stacked with the kettle not falling. Deduct 1 point for each failed stacking attempt where chairs fall. The person with the most points after attempting all chairs wins.
name: few_human29_1.0

taskDescription: Collaborate with your partner to create a series of quick sketch stories within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Sit at a desk with the notebook and pen ready. The clock is used to time each sketch. One person sketches a quick scene or object, while the other creates a short narrative for it. Rotate roles with each new drawing.
goalSetting: Develop creative and fun stories or scenes as quickly as possible.
scoringSystem: After a 30-minute session, assess the creativity and humor of the stories on a scale from 1-10. Each story is collectively rated by both participants, and the total score of all stories determines the winner.
name: few_human29_1.0

taskDescription: Pillow Bowling is a fun game where players use pillows to knock over a waste paper ball "pin" set up in a lane made by chairs.
detailedSetting: Arrange three chairs in a row to form a narrow lane. Place the waste paper ball at the end of the lane as the 'pin'. Participants stand at the opposite end, holding pillows, and attempt to throw the pillow to knock over the waste paper ball.
goalSetting: The goal is to knock over the waste paper ball using the least number of pillow throws.
scoringSystem: Each player gets 3 attempts to knock over the ball. Knocking it over on the first attempt scores 10 points, the second attempt scores 5 points, and the third attempt scores 2 points. The player with the highest score after three rounds wins.
name: few_human30_1.0

taskDescription: Using only the rolled-up newspaper, transfer the cup from one chair to another. Participants must balance the cup on the newspaper and race against time or another person.
detailedSetting: Set up two chairs approximately 10 feet apart. Participants must use the newspaper rolled into a tube to balance the cup and transfer it to the opposite chair without using their hands on the cup.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully transfer the cup from one chair to the other the fastest, without dropping it.
scoringSystem: Each successful transfer within a minute scores 10 points. Every dropped cup deducts 2 points from the score. The person with the most points after three attempts wins the game.
name: few_human30_1.0

taskDescription: Together with another person, participants build a fort using furniture and available bedding for a cozy and imaginative play space.
detailedSetting: Place the rug on the floor as the base of the fort. Arrange the sofa and chairs to form walls, and drape the blanket to form the roof. Use pillows inside for comfort and add creative elements to the entrance or interior using available items.
goalSetting: The goal is to create the coziest and most creative fort possible within a certain timeframe.
scoringSystem: Each person rates the fort on originality, comfort, and sturdiness on a scale of 1-10 for each criterion. The combined score determines the overall fort rating. Maximum possible score is 60.
name: few_human30_1.0

taskDescription: Compose and perform a short melody on the Kalimba while notating it in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Sit on the sofa with the Kalimba, notebook, and pen placed on the desk in front of you. Use the notebook to jot down any musical ideas or patterns as you experiment with sounds on the Kalimba.
goalSetting: Create and accurately perform an original melody consisting of at least 8 notes.
scoringSystem: Your performance is scored on creativity and accuracy: - Creativity of Melody (1-5 points): Rate the originality and appeal of your melody. - Accuracy of Performance (1-5 points): Perform the melody as written; full points for exact replication.
name: many_dummy1_1.0

taskDescription: Attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from a set distance within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room and a chair at a distance of 2 meters (or adjust based on room size) away from the can. Use the clock to time a two-minute challenge where you must remain seated on the chair during all attempts.
goalSetting: Successfully make as many baskets as possible in two minutes.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket scores 1 point. The challenge is completed with a high score of successful throws within the given time limit.
name: many_dummy1_1.0

taskDescription: Build a small sculpture inspired by a story from the book and position it creatively within the plants.
detailedSetting: Select a story from a book and use the building blocks to construct a sculpture related to the story's theme. Place the sculpture among the potted plants on a desk to create a thematic display.
goalSetting: Successfully build a sculpture that visually represents a part of the story and enhances the scene with the plant decoration.
scoringSystem: - Creativity (1-5 points): How creatively the sculpture represents the story. - Structural Integrity (1-5 points): Evaluate the stability and craftsmanship of the block sculpture.
name: many_dummy1_1.0

taskDescription: Create and play a short melody on the Kalimba, then write down the notes in the notebook.
detailedSetting: The participant sits comfortably on the sofa or chair with the notebook and pen on a nearby desk. The Kalimba is placed within easy reach. The participant spends a few minutes experimenting with the Kalimba to come up with a 10-note melody. Once a melody is decided, the notes are recorded in the notebook using the pen.
goalSetting: The goal is to compose an original 10-note melody and accurately document it.
scoringSystem: Rate the melody based on creativity and coherence on a scale of 1-10, where 10 represents an incredibly creative and coherent composition. Bonus points (+2) for successfully notating all 10 notes in the correct sequence.
name: many_dummy2_1.0

taskDescription: Practice shooting by tossing a waste paper ball into a basketball placed on a chair.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four chairs in a rectangle to form a makeshift basketball hoop with the basketball resting on one chair. Stand a few feet away and attempt to throw the waste paper ball to land inside the basketball using an underhand or overhand throw.
goalSetting: Successfully land the waste paper ball inside the basketball as many times as possible within five minutes.
scoringSystem: Earn 1 point for each successful shot. Attempt as many throws as possible within the time limit, and aim for a high score.
name: many_dummy2_1.0

taskDescription: Use building blocks to create a structure based on a scene from the book and present it on a tray.
detailedSetting: Select a book and read a passage to inspire a small structure or scene. Use the building blocks to create the scene on a tray positioned on the couch with pillows propped around it for comfort. The scene must creatively represent an element from the book.
goalSetting: Construct a small but imaginative scene using all five building blocks to represent the book passage.
scoringSystem: Evaluate the scene on creativity and how effectively it depicts the book passage on a scale from 1-10. An additional +3 points if all blocks are used ingeniously to enhance the scene.
name: many_dummy2_1.0

taskDescription: Create and memorize short melodies on the Kalimba, then try to match them from memory.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa or a chair with the Kalimba, notebook, and pen. Compose a melody of five notes or more on the Kalimba and write down the sequence in the notebook. Wait a minute, then play back the melody from memory.
goalSetting: Successfully recall and play the same melody that was initially composed and noted.
scoringSystem: Each correctly recalled note scores 2 points. A full match of the melody grants a bonus of 5 points. Max score per attempt is determined by the melody length.
name: many_dummy3_1.0

taskDescription: Balance a tennis ball on a tray while walking a short line across the room without dropping it.
detailedSetting: Clear a straight path in the room and set a chair at one end to mark the start line. Place the tennis ball on the tray and attempt to carry it from the starting chair across the room without dropping it.
goalSetting: Successfully transport the tennis ball on the tray from the start line to the end point, maintaining balance throughout.
scoringSystem: Completing the walk without dropping the ball scores 10 points. Each recovery if the ball starts to slip earns 1 point, but dropping the ball results in a loss of all current attempt points.
name: many_dummy3_1.0

taskDescription: Shoot a waste paper ball into a trash can from various distances to score points.
detailedSetting: Position the trash can at a fixed point in the room. Use the desk and chair to mark different shooting distances for varying difficulty. Start with the chair closest to the trash can and gradually move back to the desk.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from each marked distance.
scoringSystem: Throws from the chair earn 2 points per basket. Throws from the desk earn 5 points per basket. Attempt all positions; highest total score wins.
name: many_dummy3_1.0

taskDescription: Create and perform an original short melody using the Kalimba. Write down the sequence of notes and any necessary annotations in the notebook. The performance should be judged based on creativity and execution.
detailedSetting: The player sits comfortably on the sofa with the notebook and pen beside them. The Kalimba is held in their hands. The player takes time to devise a melody, jotting down notes as needed. Once ready, perform the melody to yourself or, if applicable, to another person.
goalSetting: Compose an original melody and perform it, seeking to create an enjoyable and smooth musical experience.
scoringSystem: Rate the performance on a scale of 1-10 based on creativity (5 points) and execution (5 points). Creativity is judged by originality and appeal, while execution includes smoothness of play and adherence to the written notes.
name: many_dummy4_1.0

taskDescription: Play a game of miniature sports by attempting to toss a tennis ball into an upright tray positioned at a distance.
detailedSetting: Place the chair at one end of the room and set the tray upright against it, forming a makeshift hoop. Stand at a designated distance from the chair and attempt to toss the tennis ball into the tray. The distance can be adjusted based on difficulty preference.
goalSetting: Successfully land the tennis ball into the tray as many times as possible within five attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw earns 2 points. If all five attempts land successfully, award an additional 5 bonus points for a perfect round.
name: many_dummy4_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest stack possible using the bowls and balance the waste paper ball on top. It's a test of stability and precision.
detailedSetting: Use the desk as a base. Carefully stack each bowl on top of the other to form a tower. Once the structure is complete, attempt to balance the waste paper ball on the top bowl.
goalSetting: Create a stable tower of bowls and balance the waste paper ball on top for at least 10 seconds.
scoringSystem: Successfully balancing the tower with the paper ball for 10 seconds score 10 points. If unable, score 1 point for each bowl successfully stacked by itself.
name: many_dummy4_1.0

taskDescription: A strategic chess game played between two people to capture the opponent's king using logical and tactical movements.
detailedSetting: Set the chess board on one of the desks, and place two chairs on opposite sides for the players to sit. Arrange the chess pieces on the board according to standard chess rules.
goalSetting: The goal is to checkmate the opponent’s king, thus winning the game.
scoringSystem: Points are awarded based on pieces captured—1 point for pawns, 3 for knights or bishops, 5 for rooks, 9 for the queen, and 10 bonus points for a checkmate. The player with the most points when the game ends wins.
name: many_dummy5_1.0

taskDescription: A fun and skill-testing challenge to build the tallest tower possible using building blocks within a set time limit.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on the ground to serve as the base for the building blocks. Use the clock to time the activity, which lasts for 5 minutes.
goalSetting: The objective is to construct the tallest and most stable tower using the 5 building blocks within the time limit.
scoringSystem: For every centimeter in height of the completed tower, 1 point is awarded. An additional 5 points are granted if the tower remains stable for 30 seconds after construction ends.
name: many_dummy5_1.0

taskDescription: A solo game to practice aiming and throwing by attempting to toss a waste paper ball into a trash can from various distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can near the desk. The player sits on the chair 3 meters away to start and gradually moves closer or further as desired.
goalSetting: The aim is to make as many successful throws into the trash can as possible from the starting distance.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot made into the trash can scores 2 points. Reduce the distance by half and earn 1 bonus point for each successful shot. Player total scores are tallied in session.
name: many_dummy5_1.0

taskDescription: The participant creates and performs a short melody using the kalimba, then writes down the melody in the notebook.
detailedSetting: The participant sits comfortably on the sofa with the kalimba in hand. The notebook and pen are placed on the nearby desk for easy access. The participant invents a 30-second melody and then records the key sequence in the notebook for future performance or sharing.
goalSetting: The goal is to compose an original kalimba melody and accurately notate it for future reference or sharing.
scoringSystem: The participant evaluates their melody based on creativity, complexity, and accuracy of the notation, rating each category on a scale from 1 to 5. A perfect score is 15, with higher scores indicating a more successful task completion.
name: many_dummy6_1.0

taskDescription: The participant attempts to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from various distances, using the tissue for a quick cleanup after the game.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room, using a chair as a shooting spot for the player. The participant stands behind the chair at different distances, attempting to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can. The tissue is used to ensure the area remains tidy after each round.
goalSetting: The aim is to successfully throw the ball into the trash can from increasing distances without missing.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can from the initial distance scores 1 point. Each step back (further distance) scoring an additional point per successful throw (e.g., +2, +3). The maximum score is determined by how many distances the player successfully completes without missing.
name: many_dummy6_1.0

taskDescription: The participant attempts to stack the building blocks as high as possible on the tray without letting them fall.
detailedSetting: The tray is placed on the soft surface of the rug to increase challenge due to the potential instability. The blocks are placed near the tray for easy access. The participant has to stack the blocks vertically on the tray as high as they can.
goalSetting: To effectively stack all five blocks on the tray without them tumbling.
scoringSystem: The score is based on the number of blocks successfully stacked before they collapse. A perfect stack earns 5 points. Participants can challenge themselves further by timing the stack stability for bonus points (1 extra point per minute of stability).
name: many_dummy6_1.0

taskDescription: Try to toss the basketball into the trash can from various distances for points.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can in the center of the room. Arrange pillows at increasing distances of 2, 3, and 4 meters from the trash can to mark shooting spots. Participants must stand on the pillows to take their shots.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully toss the basketball into the trash can from different distances.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot from the 2-meter pillow is worth 1 point, the 3-meter pillow is worth 2 points, and the 4-meter pillow is worth 3 points. The person with the most points after three rounds wins.
name: many_dummy7_1.0

taskDescription: Race against the clock to construct a tall and stable tower using building blocks on a tray.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on a flat surface, such as a desk or table. Arrange the building blocks beside it. Use the clock to time the participant.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest and most stable tower using all five blocks in the shortest amount of time.
scoringSystem: Time is scored based on seconds taken to complete the task. Subtract 5 points for each block that falls off the tower. The fastest time with all blocks staying balanced is the winner.
name: many_dummy7_1.0

taskDescription: Pick a book, read a passage, and write a creative interpretation or summary.
detailedSetting: Sit in the chair with the notebook and pen. Choose a book from the available selection. Use a timer to allow 5 minutes to read a passage of your choice. After reading, spend another 10 minutes writing a creative interpretation or summary in the notebook.
goalSetting: The goal is to creatively interpret the passage you read and capture your thoughts concisely.
scoringSystem: Rate the creativity and clarity of each written interpretation on a scale from 1 to 10. If there are other people, they can provide feedback. The highest score for creativity and clarity combined determines the winner.
name: many_dummy7_1.0

taskDescription: A fast-paced game of chess where each player must complete their turn within 30 seconds to add a level of excitement and challenge to the traditional game.
detailedSetting: Set up the chess board on one of the desks, placing the clock nearby to keep track of time. Participants should sit across from each other with a clear view of the clock.
goalSetting: The objective is to checkmate your opponent as quickly as possible while adhering to the time constraints per move.
scoringSystem: Each game played and completed counts as 1 point. If a player wins, they receive an additional 2 points. Participants can play multiple games, totaling their scores to see who is the ultimate Speed Chess master.
name: many_dummy8_1.0
