taskDescription: A musical relay where participants must compose a short melody on the Kalimba during intervals on the treadmill.
detailedSetting: Place the Kalimba on a tray beside the treadmill. Assign the treadmill as the starting point. Participants take 1-minute turns running on the treadmill, then step off to play a short melody using the Kalimba.
goalSetting: Create a cohesive and pleasant melody collaboratively, using the Kalimba during breaks from the treadmill.
scoringSystem: Participants evaluate the final melody on a collaborative creativity scale of 1-10. Additionally, completing the treadmill and melody segment without stopping earns 1 participation point each round.
name: many_dummy8_1.0

taskDescription: An indoor target practice game where players attempt to hit designated targets with a tennis ball by overcoming obstacles made from everyday items.
detailedSetting: Arrange chairs in a zigzag pattern, placing the potted plant as the target at the end. Crunch the newspaper into a ball and place it where players must stand to attempt their throw using the tennis ball.
goalSetting: Successfully navigate the tennis ball through the chair obstacles and hit the potted plant with it.
scoringSystem: Each hit on the potted plant scores 5 points. If the ball touches any of the chairs during the throw, 2 points are deducted. Participants take turns, and the highest total score determines the winner.
name: many_dummy8_1.0

taskDescription: The player attempts to score points by shooting a crumpled newspaper into the trash can from different distances using a basketball shot technique.
detailedSetting: The trash can is placed at one end of the room, and the player starts at a designated spot at about 5 feet away with a crumpled newspaper. The player uses the basketball to 'pass' the newspaper ball towards the trash can. Each successful 'basket' counts towards the player's score.
goalSetting: The goal is to score the most points by successfully tossing the newspaper into the trash can using basketball shot techniques.
scoringSystem: A successful basket from 5 feet away earns 1 point, moving back 2 feet at a time for each successful shot can increase up to 5 points per shot. The game is played for 10 shots, and the player with the most points at the end wins.
name: many_dummy9_1.0

taskDescription: The player constructs the tallest stable tower possible using pillows and building blocks within a set time limit.
detailedSetting: Two pillows are placed flat on the floor. The player places one building block at a time on top of the pillow to build a tower. The clock is set to 3 minutes, and the player must stop once the time runs out.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest tower that can remain standing for 10 seconds after the time runs out.
scoringSystem: For every level consisting of at least one building block, the player earns 2 points. An additional 5-point bonus is awarded if the tower remains standing for 10 seconds after time expires.
name: many_dummy9_1.0

taskDescription: The player listens to a melody played on a kalimba and tries to reproduce it accurately.
detailedSetting: The player uses the kalimba to play back a melody they heard or imagined. They can use the notebook and pen to jot down notes or tune sequences during practice. The player can practice for 5 minutes before attempting to play the melody.
goalSetting: The objective is to play the melody as accurately as possible based on memory and notes.
scoringSystem: Scoring is based on accuracy: 1 point for each correctly hit note in sequence. A perfect match of 10 notes (or more) yields a 5-point bonus. A subjective evaluation can be introduced where a score out of 10 is given based on the difficulty of the melody played by the player.
name: many_dummy9_1.0

taskDescription: Create and perform basketball trick shots using household items for targets. Compete to see who can make the most creative and challenging shots using unconventional setups.
detailedSetting: Place the waste paper ball on top of a chair as the first target. Use the sofa as a backboard for bounce shots. The second chair can be placed at varying distances to challenge shooting skills. Participants may sit or stand while attempting shots from different distances and angles.
goalSetting: Successfully make as many creative basketball shots as possible using the set targets and furniture configurations.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot scores 3 points. Bonus points are awarded based on creativity (scale of 1-5) as judged subjectively by the other participant or a mutual agreement if playing solo.
name: many_dummy10_1.0

taskDescription: Compose and perform a short musical piece on the kalimba inspired by a random TV show or commercial.
detailedSetting: Sit on the sofa with the kalimba in hand. Turn on the television and randomly change channels until you land on a program or advertisement that inspires you. Use the notebook and pen to jot down any notes or ideas.
goalSetting: Create a short piece of music on the kalimba that reflects the mood or theme of the chosen TV content.
scoringSystem: Rate the composition on a scale from 1-10 based on creativity, rhythm, and how well it captures the essence of the TV program. A friend or the player may self-judge for evaluation.
name: many_dummy10_1.0

taskDescription: Balance a book on your head and navigate a relay course while timing yourself with the clock.
detailedSetting: Lay the rug on the floor as the starting line. Set up two chairs a few feet apart to create the course. The clock is set up to keep time. One book is balanced on the player's head as they attempt to navigate around the chairs and avoid obstacles without dropping the book. Use the broom as an additional challenge to step over or go around during the course.
goalSetting: Complete the relay course in the shortest time possible while successfully balancing a book on your head and maneuvering around obstacles.
scoringSystem: Time completion is the primary score, with 1 point deducted for each dropped book. Bonus points (5 each) are awarded for styles like walking backwards or performing spins without dropping the book.
name: many_dummy10_1.0

taskDescription: Use the basketball and waste paper ball to perform trick shots into the trash can from different positions in the room.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at a central spot in the room. Use a chair to create different height levels and angles for more challenging shots. The waste paper ball will be used as a smaller object for precision shots.
goalSetting: Successfully make the basketball or waste paper ball into the trash can from various marked spots around the room.
scoringSystem: - Basketball: 3 points per successful shot. - Waste paper ball: 5 points per successful shot. The player with the highest score after eight attempts wins the challenge.
name: many_dummy11_1.0

taskDescription: Compose and play short tunes on the kalimba within a set time, then note them down.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably at one of the desks with the kalimba, notebook, and pen in reach. Use the clock to time each composition and performance.
goalSetting: Compose and perform as many unique tunes as possible within 15 minutes.
scoringSystem: - 1 point for each different tune successfully played and notated. A subjective bonus of up to 5 points for creativity awarded based on a self-evaluation or another participant's feedback.
name: many_dummy11_1.0

taskDescription: Create different structures using the building blocks based on numbers rolled on the dice.
detailedSetting: Use one desk as the building area. Roll the dice to determine the number of sides or elements the structure should have.
goalSetting: Quickly build the structure according to the number rolled on the dice.
scoringSystem: - Structures built within 1 minute score 10 points if they meet the requirements. Decrease by 2 points for every additional 30 seconds taken. Bonus of 5 points for the most complex and stable structure as judged subjectively by the participant or another person in the room.
name: many_dummy11_1.0

taskDescription: Test your chess playing skills by competing against yourself to see how many moves it takes to achieve a checkmate from a random starting position.
detailedSetting: Set up the chessboard on a desk and sit in a chair. Randomly place the pieces on the board while ensuring each type of piece is on its correct side. Use strategic thinking to play both sides of the game.
goalSetting: The goal is to achieve a checkmate from a randomly generated starting position in the fewest possible moves.
scoringSystem: Count the total number of moves it takes to reach checkmate. A lower number of moves indicates better performance, with the aim of keeping the total to 20 moves or less.
name: many_dummy12_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest stable tower using five building blocks on a tray without letting it collapse.
detailedSetting: Place a tray on a chair to create the building surface. Use the five building blocks to construct a tower as tall as possible, balancing the blocks strategically to maintain stability.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest tower possible without any blocks falling off.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in centimeters. Points are awarded for every centimeter the tower stands, and the tower must remain standing for at least 10 seconds for the height to count.
name: many_dummy12_1.0

taskDescription: Compose a short melody using the Kalimba and write down the notes in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably with the Kalimba in your lap. Use the notebook and pen to jot down the notes as you compose a melody on the Kalimba.
goalSetting: The goal is to create an original 8-note melody and write down the sequence in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Rate the complexity and creativity of your melody on a scale of 1-10, considering factors like rhythm, originality, and the ease with which it can be played.
name: many_dummy12_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest and most stable tower using the provided building blocks.
detailedSetting: Place the five building blocks on the floor. The participant has to stack the blocks one on top of the other to create a tower. The building should be straight and balanced.
goalSetting: The goal is to construct the tallest tower possible using the blocks. The tower should stand independently without toppling over.
scoringSystem: The height of the tower in block levels is counted as points. Each block successfully placed adds 1 point. A bonus 2 points if your tower can withstand a gentle breeze (e.g., blowing on it), lasting at least 5 seconds without falling. Maximum score is 7 points when including the bonus points.
name: many_dummy13_1.0

taskDescription: Attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from various distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Mark three shooting lines at increasing distances from the trash can (e.g., 1 meter, 2 meters, and 3 meters). Use floor markings or place objects as indicators for each line.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from the designated distances.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can scores points based on the distance: 1 meter = 1 point, 2 meters = 2 points, 3 meters = 3 points. You can attempt each distance once per round. Total the points after all attempts, with 6 being the maximum score in a round.
name: many_dummy13_1.0

taskDescription: Write a creative short story using inspiration from a randomly selected page from a book.
detailedSetting: Open one book to a random page and read the first sentence. Use this sentence as inspiration or the starting sentence for a short story. Write the story in the notebook using the pen.
goalSetting: The goal is to write a complete short story that is creative and engaging based on the book's provided sentence.
scoringSystem: Use a subjective evaluation scale: Creativity: Rate 1 to 5 (5 being highly creative ideas), Cohesion: Rate 1 to 5 (5 being well-structured and coherent narrative), Language: Rate 1 to 5 (5 for excellent use of language and style). Maximum score is 15 points. Optionally, share with another person if available for an additional evaluation for more subjective feedback.
name: many_dummy13_1.0

taskDescription: Compose and play a short original melody on the kalimba, then write down the notes in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa with the kalimba on your lap. Use the notebook and pen to jot down a sequence of notes you plan to play. Spend time playing and practicing the tune until you are satisfied with your composition.
goalSetting: Create a pleasing and unique melody on the kalimba, documenting the notes in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Rate the melody on a scale of 1 to 5 based on creativity, complexity, and enjoyment. A composition that flows naturally and conveys emotion should aim for a higher score.
name: many_dummy14_1.0

taskDescription: Attempt to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from a distance using the chair as a marker.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room and set the chair at a moderate distance from it. Stand behind the chair as the starting point and attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Land the waste paper ball in the trash can using as few attempts as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the trash can counts as 1 point. Complete the task within 10 throws for a perfect score of 10 points. Subtract 1 point for each additional attempt beyond this limit.
name: many_dummy14_1.0

taskDescription: Stack the books and building blocks to create the tallest and stable tower possible without it toppling over.
detailedSetting: Place the rug as the base. Use the books as platforms and building blocks to build upward in alternating layers. Ensure each layer is stable before adding more.
goalSetting: Construct the tallest tower of books and blocks without it collapsing.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for each complete layer (book and block) successfully added and standing for 10 seconds. The tower must remain standing without assistance or wobbling for the points to count.
name: many_dummy14_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compete in balancing building blocks on the arm of the sofa to see who can build the tallest tower without it toppling over.
detailedSetting: Place the sofa in a clear area of the room. Each participant takes turns placing one building block on the armrest of the sofa. The goal is to stack blocks as high as possible without the tower collapsing.
goalSetting: Build the tallest tower of blocks on the armrest without it falling over.
scoringSystem: Each block successfully stacked counts as 1 point. If the tower collapses during a turn, the current score for that round is zero. The participant with the highest point total after three attempts wins.
name: many_dummy15_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compose and perform a short musical piece on the Kalimba. Creativity and uniqueness are encouraged.
detailedSetting: Set up a chair in the room with a Kalimba on it. The participant uses the notebook and pen to jot down ideas or lyrics if needed before performing a short piece (1-2 minutes long) on the Kalimba.
goalSetting: Create and perform an original piece of music using the Kalimba.
scoringSystem: A panel uses a scale from 1 to 10 to rate the composition based on creativity, rhythm, and enjoyment.
name: many_dummy15_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns shooting a basketball into a trash can from a designated spot on a rug, simulating a basketball free throw competition.
detailedSetting: Place the rug on the floor and position the trash can about 2 meters away. The participant stands on the edge of the rug and attempts to throw the basketball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Make as many successful shots into the trash can as possible within a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can is worth 1 point. The participant with the most points after 10 attempts wins the game.
name: many_dummy15_1.0

taskDescription: Create a fun indoor basketball challenge using pillows as obstacles, aimed at shooting the basketball into the trash can.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can on one side of the room and the pillows at varying distances and angles from the trash can to serve as obstacles. Stand behind a designated line to attempt your shots. The basketball is used for shooting attempts.
goalSetting: Successfully shoot the basketball into the trash can more times than your competitor, while avoiding the pillow obstacles.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can earns 3 points. If the basketball touches any pillow during a shot, you lose 1 point. The participant with the most points after 10 shots wins.
name: many_dummy16_1.0

taskDescription: A balancing and coordination challenge that involves transporting a waste paper ball on a tray across a course of chairs.
detailedSetting: Set up two chairs in a row with enough space between them to serve as a path. The newspaper is rolled up and placed on the floor as the starting line. The waste paper ball is then placed on the tray. Participants must balance the waste paper ball on the tray while walking around the chairs.
goalSetting: Carry the waste paper ball on the tray across the obstacle course without dropping the ball or knocking over the chairs.
scoringSystem: Complete the relay in the shortest time. A 5 seconds penalty is added for each time the ball is dropped or a chair is knocked over. The participant with the lowest adjusted time wins.
name: many_dummy16_1.0

taskDescription: Test your musical memory by composing and playing a melody on the Kalimba and challenging yourself to recall it.
detailedSetting: Sit in a chair with the notebook and pen beside you. Use the Kalimba to compose a short melody, writing down notes in the notebook. After a pause, without looking at your notes, try to play the melody from memory.
goalSetting: Accurately recreate the initial melody you composed on the Kalimba from memory.
scoringSystem: Score 2 points for each correctly remembered note. Deduct 1 point for each mistake. The higher your score, the better your musical memory. Maximum possible score is the size of your melody composed.
name: many_dummy16_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns tossing a crumpled newspaper ball into a trash can from a seated position to practice their aim and accuracy.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can approximately 6 feet away from where the participants will be sitting. Use one of the chairs for the seated player, who will roll the newspaper into a ball if it's not already in that state. Ensure there is enough space around the chair and trash can to avoid obstruction during the toss.
goalSetting: The goal is to sink the most waste paper balls into the trash can from a seated position.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can scores 1 point. The participant makes as many attempts as possible in 1 minute, and the total number of points determines the score. Compare scores if multiple players are involved; the highest score wins.
name: many_dummy17_1.0

taskDescription: Participants balance a book on their head while walking on a treadmill to test balance skills.
detailedSetting: Set the treadmill at a slow speed (e.g., 1-2 mph) appropriate for balance testing. Place a pillow behind the treadmill to catch fallen books and ensure player safety. Participants start by placing a book on their head and begin walking on the treadmill.
goalSetting: Walk for the longest time while maintaining the book on the head without it falling.
scoringSystem: Participants are scored based on the duration (in seconds) they keep the book balanced while walking. A timekeeping device can be used to measure the duration. The participant with the longest time wins.
name: many_dummy17_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create and play a short melody on a kalimba to showcase their musical creativity and performance skills.
detailedSetting: Place the notebook and pen on the desk next to the chair. The participant sits on the chair and uses the kalimba to create a melody. They can write down notes or ideas in the notebook if necessary.
goalSetting: Compose and perform a unique melody on the kalimba within 5 minutes.
scoringSystem: The performance is rated based on three criteria, each on a scale of 1 to 5: 1. Creativity of the melody. 2. Smoothness of the performance. 3. Overall enjoyment of the piece. The maximum score is 15 points, and the highest score wins. If playing with another person, they can serve as the judge.
name: many_dummy17_1.0

taskDescription: Roll the dice to determine how many times you need to bounce a tennis ball on each chair in the room.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four chairs in a square formation, leaving enough space between them for maneuverability. Place the tennis ball on one chair. The player stands in the center and rolls the dice. The dice result dictates how many times the ball needs to be bounced on each chair in sequence. The player attempts to bounce the ball on each chair according to the number on the dice before moving to the next chair.
goalSetting: Successfully bounce the tennis ball on each chair the designated number of times without dropping it on the floor.
scoringSystem: Each successful chair sequence (bouncing the ball the correct number of times) earns 5 points. Deduct 1 point for each failed attempt (ball drops). The player wins if they accumulate 20 points.
name: many_dummy18_1.0

taskDescription: Read a section from each book and draft a short creative story inspired by the readings.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa with two books, a notebook, and a pen within reach. Select a section from each book to read aloud. After reading, use the notebook and pen to write a short story that combines elements or themes from both book sections.
goalSetting: Complete a creative story that incorporates characters or themes from the chosen sections of the books.
scoringSystem: The story is scored on creativity, coherence, and length. Creativity earns up to 5 points, coherence up to 3 points, and if the story exceeds a page, an additional 2 points. Maximum score achievable is 10 points.
name: many_dummy18_1.0

taskDescription: Recreate the theme of one painting using the building blocks and display it on a desk.
detailedSetting: Place the two paintings upright on one desk for reference. Use the other desk to lay out the building blocks. Analyze the paintings and choose one to reinterpret using the blocks. Construct the block puzzle to represent any key theme or element of the selected painting.
goalSetting: Successfully create a recognizable representation of the chosen painting using the blocks.
scoringSystem: Accuracy to the theme earns up to 5 points, structural stability up to 3 points, and creative interpretation up to 2 points. A perfect representation grants the player 10 points.
name: many_dummy18_1.0

taskDescription: The player aims to throw the tennis ball into the trash can from a designated distance while seated on a chair.
detailedSetting: Place a trash can at one end of the room. Set a chair at a distance of about 3 meters (or a comfortable challenging distance depending on room size) from the trash can. The player sits on the chair and attempts to throw the tennis ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the tennis ball into the trash can as many times as possible within 10 attempts.
scoringSystem: 1 point is awarded for each successful throw where the ball lands inside the trash can. The total points are the sum of successful throws out of 10 attempts.
name: many_dummy19_1.0

taskDescription: Test your reflexes by quickly responding to a dice roll, where each number rolled corresponds to a different action within a limited time.
detailedSetting: Place the dice on the tray to ensure it doesn’t roll away. Keep the clock visible to use as a timer. Each number on the dice represents a different action, which the player needs to perform instantly: - 1: Clap hands - 2: Snap fingers - 3: Stomp feet - 4: Tap the tray - 5: Thumb up - 6: Pat your head
goalSetting: Successfully perform the matching action within 3 seconds of each dice roll for 10 rolls.
scoringSystem: Give 1 point for each correct action performed within the time limit. Aim to score as many points as possible out of 10.
name: many_dummy19_1.0

taskDescription: Engage your imagination by creating a unique structure using building blocks. Document your design process and final creation using the notebook and pen.
detailedSetting: Sit at a desk and use the building blocks to construct an imaginative structure. As you build, use the notebook and pen to sketch ideas or write notes that led to your creation.
goalSetting: Create a complete and structurally coherent design with the building blocks while documenting the process in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Rate each of these out of 10: Creativity of the design, Stability of the structure, and Completeness of documentation in the notebook. Max score of 30, calculated by adding up the three scores.
name: many_dummy19_1.0

taskDescription: Practice your shooting skills by tossing a waste paper ball into a trash can, trying to mimic the motion of shooting a basketball.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can against a wall. Stand approximately six feet away with the basketball and waste paper ball beside you. Use the waste paper ball to practice shooting into the trash can. Each time the paper ball lands inside, retrieve it and take another shot.
goalSetting: The objective is to land as many shots as possible into the trash can using the waste paper ball within a set duration.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot scores 1 point. Players have 10 attempts. Highest score wins.
name: many_dummy20_1.0

taskDescription: Invent and play a short melody on the Kalimba, noting down the notes in the notebook for future reference.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on a chair with the Kalimba in hand. Keep the notebook and pen on your lap or a nearby surface. Play with the Kalimba to create a melody and write down the sequence of notes.
goalSetting: Create a new, pleasing melody and accurately document it in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Play the melody for others or rate yourself. Each pleasing note sequence gets 2 points. Maximum score is subjective, based on creativity and memorability.
name: many_dummy20_1.0

taskDescription: See how quickly you can stack five building blocks on a tray placed on a desk without them toppling over.
detailedSetting: Set a tray on a desk. Lay all five building blocks nearby. When ready, stack the blocks as quickly as you can onto the tray.
goalSetting: Complete the stack without letting any blocks fall.
scoringSystem: Time yourself from the first block placement to complete stack stability. Subtract 1 point for each 2-second increase in final time. Highest time-under-points wins.
name: many_dummy20_1.0

taskDescription: Turn your room into a mini basketball court by shooting a waste paper ball into the trash can from a set distance using a chair as the marker.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one corner of the room. Set up the chair a reasonable distance away from the trash can as your shooting line. The player will sit or stand behind the chair to take shots using the waste paper ball.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully shoot the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible in ten attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot counts as 1 point. The total score is the number of successful shots out of ten. Aim for a perfect 10 to demonstrate precision!
name: many_dummy21_1.0

taskDescription: Compose a short piece of music on the Kalimba and note down the melody.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably with the kalimba in hand. Use the notebook and pen to jot down notes and sequences as you experiment with different melodies.
goalSetting: Create an original 16-note melody using the kalimba and document it in the notebook for future reference.
scoringSystem: Score yourself based on creativity and satisfaction with your composition on a scale of 1-10, with 10 being a masterpiece in your eyes. An extra 2 points can be awarded if you can play the complete melody without referring to the notes.
name: many_dummy21_1.0

taskDescription: Test your precision skills by stacking building blocks on a tray while maintaining balance on the desk's edge.
detailedSetting: Place a tray slightly overhanging the edge of a desk. Stand the building blocks on the tray one by one, attempting to stack them as tall as possible without toppling over.
goalSetting: The objective is to build the tallest stable tower of blocks on the tray without the stack falling over.
scoringSystem: Each successfully stacked block counts as 2 points. Deduct 1 point for each block that causes the stack to fall. Maximum score is 10 if you stack all blocks without mishap.
name: many_dummy21_1.0

taskDescription: The participant must compose and play a short melody on the Kalimba within a limited time frame.
detailedSetting: The participant sits comfortably on the sofa with the Kalimba. The clock is used to set a timer for 3 minutes. The goal is to create a unique melody using the Kalimba.
goalSetting: To compose and play an original Kalimba melody within 3 minutes.
scoringSystem: Creativity and melody flow are judged on a scale of 1-10. Additional 5 points are awarded if the melody is complete before time runs out.
name: many_dummy22_1.0

taskDescription: The participant creates drawings based on prompts derived from the poster using a roll of the dice.
detailedSetting: Roll the dice to determine a number that corresponds to a specific object or theme depicted on the poster. Using the notebook and pen, draw the chosen object or scene.
goalSetting: Accurately and creatively depict the specified prompt from the poster within the notebook.
scoringSystem: Artistic representation is judged on a scale of 1-10 based on likeness and creativity. The player can earn bonus points for originality by adding unique elements to their drawing that enhance the theme.
name: many_dummy22_1.0

taskDescription: The participant attempts to toss the basketball into bowls placed at various distances on the rug.
detailedSetting: The rug is laid out on the floor, and bowls are placed on it at different points, each designated with a pillow to mark their position. Sit or stand at a starting line and throw the basketball to land in the bowls.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the basketball into as many bowls as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into a bowl counts for 2 points. If all bowls are successfully targeted, an additional 5 bonus points are awarded.
name: many_dummy22_1.0

taskDescription: Create a random melody and replicate it on the Kalimba using a dice to determine note sequences.
detailedSetting: Seat yourself comfortably with the Kalimba in front of you. Roll the dice to determine the number of notes in your melody (1-6 notes). Use the notebook to write down the sequence dictated by subsequent dice rolls (e.g., roll a 3 and play the third note on the Kalimba). Continue rolling the dice to complete your sequence.
goalSetting: The goal is to accurately play back the melody from your notebook without mistakes.
scoringSystem: Each accurately played note scores 1 point. Maximum possible score is equal to the number of notes determined by the initial dice roll.
name: many_dummy23_1.0

taskDescription: A casual game to pass time by attempting to toss a waste paper ball into a trash can.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at a designated distance from your seated position on a chair. Adjust the distance based on your skill level for a challenge (e.g., 3 meters away).
goalSetting: The objective is to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible from your seated position.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can earns 3 points. Try to achieve the highest score in five attempts.
name: many_dummy23_1.0

taskDescription: This is a challenge that involves stacking books on a bowl without toppling them over.
detailedSetting: Place the bowl upside-down on a flat surface like a desk. Carefully balance five books on top of the inverted bowl, stacking them one at a time.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully stack all five books on the bowl without them falling over.
scoringSystem: Each successfully balanced book on the bowl scores 2 points. Achieve a maximum of 10 points if all five books are stacked without falling.
name: many_dummy23_1.0

taskDescription: Create and perform a short melody on the Kalimba, aiming to compose a pleasant tune.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa with the Kalimba in hand. Use the notebook and pen to jot down ideas for notes or patterns. Once ready, perform the melody.
goalSetting: Compose and perform a short melody that is both creative and soothing.
scoringSystem: Rate the composition on a scale of 1-10, considering creativity, rhythm, and overall pleasantness. Optionally, if "Other people" is present, they can also give a separate score. The final score will be an average of individual ratings.
name: many_dummy24_1.0

taskDescription: Construct the tallest and most stable tower possible with the building blocks within a limited timeframe.
detailedSetting: Place the building blocks on the rug in the center of the room. Set the clock to a 5-minute countdown.
goalSetting: Build the tallest tower possible without it toppling over by the end of 5 minutes.
scoringSystem: Each stable block adds 2 points to the score, while unstably balanced blocks subtract 1 point. The highest score possible is 10 points. An additional 2 points can be awarded for the tallest structure if it surpasses one foot in height.
name: many_dummy24_1.0

taskDescription: Toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from different distances marked using the broom and chair as reference points.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at a fixed corner of the room. Use the broom and chair to mark shooting points at varying distances—close, medium, and far. Each distance is marked with a small line or make-do marker from the pen.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball into the trash can from each marked distance.
scoringSystem: Close (1 point), Medium (2 points), and Far (3 points) distances have different point values assigned. The maximum possible score is 6 points if successful from each marked line.
name: many_dummy24_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest stack possible using building blocks balanced on a tray placed on a desk. Use the waste paper ball as a final touch to challenge the stability of your tower.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on top of a desk as the base platform. Start stacking building blocks one on top of another on the tray. Once all blocks are stacked, balance the waste paper ball on top of the stack, attempting to keep the tower upright for at least 5 seconds.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the highest tower without it collapsing under the weight or losing balance when the waste paper ball is added.
scoringSystem: Assign 1 point for each successfully stacked block. Gain an additional 5 points if the tower stands for 5 seconds with the paper ball on top. Deduct 2 points if any block falls during construction or adjustment.
name: many_dummy25_1.0

taskDescription: A game of precision where participants roll a dice to knock over a lineup of bowls using a waste paper ball.
detailedSetting: Place the rug on the floor to outline a bowling lane. Arrange two bowls upright at the far end of the rug, with some space between them to mimic bowling pins. Stand at the opposite end, using the dice to roll the waste paper ball towards the bowls, attempting to knock them down.
goalSetting: The aim is to roll the waste paper ball in a way that it hits and knocks down both bowls in the least number of tries.
scoringSystem: Each player starts with 10 points. Deduct 1 point for each roll it takes to knock down both bowls. Count the number of rolls to determine efficiency. The player with the most points after multiple turns wins.
name: many_dummy25_1.0

taskDescription: Solve a newspaper puzzle while walking on a treadmill. Use the table lamp for better visibility.
detailedSetting: Place the treadmill facing the newspaper on a reading stand or makeshift holder. Use the table lamp to ensure adequate lighting on the newspaper. Walk on the treadmill at a comfortable pace while attempting to solve a puzzle or read and understand an article from the newspaper.
goalSetting: The challenge is to maintain your pace on the treadmill while successfully completing a task from the newspaper, such as a crossword puzzle or reading an entire article aloud.
scoringSystem: Score 10 points for completing the newspaper task. Deduct 1 point for every 10 seconds of stopping to focus on the newspaper without walking. The goal is to maintain activity and multitask effectively.
name: many_dummy25_1.0

taskDescription: Compete to roll the highest number on a single die, recording each player's score in a notebook.
detailedSetting: Both participants sit facing each other at one of the desks with the notebook and pen between them. The dice is rolled by each player in turn, and the result is noted in the notebook by a designated scorer.
goalSetting: Aim to roll the highest number out of 10 rounds.
scoringSystem: For each round, the player who rolls a higher number scores a point. If both roll the same number, neither scores. The player with the most points after 10 rounds wins. In the case of a tie, an additional round is played.
name: many_dummy26_1.0

taskDescription: Create and play a new melody on the Kalimba, writing down notes in the notebook with inspiration from a random word cut out from the newspaper.
detailedSetting: Participants sit comfortably on the sofa with the Kalimba placed on the lap of the player. A random word is cut out from the newspaper and is placed on the notebook as the theme for the melody. The player composes a tune inspired by the word and writes the notes down in the notebook.
goalSetting: Compose a creative melody using the Kalimba that best represents the chosen word.
scoringSystem: After composing, replay the melody. A subjective score from 1 to 10 is given by each player based on creativity, adherence to the theme, and fluency. The highest total score wins.
name: many_dummy26_1.0

taskDescription: Use the building blocks to construct the tallest tower possible on a tray placed on a chair without toppling over.
detailedSetting: Set up a chair in an open area of the room, and place the tray on the seat of the chair. Players take turns stacking the building blocks on the tray to construct a tower.
goalSetting: Build the tallest stable tower using all 5 building blocks without causing it to fall.
scoringSystem: Points are scored based on the height of the tower before it falls (1 point per block high). Bonus points are given for completing the tower using all 5 blocks without it falling (2 extra points). Total scores are compared and the highest wins. If the tower falls during construction, that round ends with the current score for that attempt.
name: many_dummy26_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create the most creative and stable pillow fort using available furniture and items.
detailedSetting: Use the sofa as a base structure. Position the chairs on either side to support a blanket roof. Incorporate pillows as walls, and use building blocks to add creative elements or decorative features.
goalSetting: Construct a unique and stable pillow fort within the room.
scoringSystem: 1. Creativity: Up to 5 points based on innovative design. 2. Stability: Up to 5 points based on how well the fort remains standing when lightly tapped. 3. Use of available items: Up to 5 points for effectively using the most items.
name: many_dummy27_1.0

taskDescription: Play along with rhythms displayed randomly on the TV to test and develop musical timing skills.
detailedSetting: Set the TV to show a rhythm video or metronome app. Use the clock to time each player's attempt at following the rhythm. The Kalimba player tries to match the rhythm as closely as possible.
goalSetting: Accurately replicate the rhythm using the Kalimba.
scoringSystem: Each player is scored on timing accuracy, up to 10 points per round. A perfect score is achieved by perfectly matching the rhythm without time discrepancies.
name: many_dummy27_1.0

taskDescription: Attempt to throw waste paper into a trash can from different distances to mimic basketball shooting practice.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can in a fixed position. Align chairs at increasing distances (e.g., one at 1 meter, another at 2 meters, etc.). Players try to shoot the waste paper ball into the trash can from each chair, resembling free throw lines.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from each chair distance.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot earns 1 point. The player with the most points after all chair positions wins. In the case of a tie, use the basketball for a single tie-breaker shot.
name: many_dummy27_1.0

taskDescription: Build the tallest possible tower using all five building blocks on a tray.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on the floor or a flat surface. Use the five building blocks to create a tower that is as tall as possible without falling over.
goalSetting: The goal is to construct a tower that stands upright for at least 30 seconds.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in centimeters or inches. Each centimeter/inch counts as 1 point. Bonus 5 points if the tower stands for an additional minute without collapsing.
name: many_dummy28_1.0

taskDescription: Play a rhythm on the Kalimba for a set time while keeping time with a clock.
detailedSetting: Set the clock where it is visible. Use the Kalimba to play a rhythm for 2 minutes while lightly tapping the tissue in time with the clock's ticking seconds.
goalSetting: Maintain the beat consistently with the clock's ticking for the full duration.
scoringSystem: Rate your performance confidence on a scale from 1 to 10. An additional 2 points awarded for sustaining the beat for the entire 2 minutes without mistakes.
name: many_dummy28_1.0

taskDescription: Using a chair as a launching platform, throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
detailedSetting: Position a chair approximately 5 feet from the trash can. Sit on the chair and attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can. Use the basketball as a weight to hold down chair legs if needed.
goalSetting: Successfully land the waste paper ball in the trash can.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can counts as 3 points. Additional 1 point if you make it three times consecutively without missing.
name: many_dummy28_1.0

taskDescription: Construct a tower from building blocks and attempt to balance a waste paper ball on top.
detailedSetting: Place a chair at the center of the room. Use the building blocks to creatively stack and construct a stable tower on the seat of the chair. Once the tower is complete, gently place the waste paper ball on top and see if it balances without falling.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest possible tower that can still support the waste paper ball on top for at least 10 seconds.
scoringSystem: Measure the tower's height from the chair seat to the top of the waste paper ball. Award 1 point for each centimeter. An additional 5 points are given if the waste paper ball stays balanced for 10 seconds. Highest score wins.
name: many_dummy29_1.0

taskDescription: Use rolled-up newspaper pages to score points by shooting them into a trash can from a set distance.
detailedSetting: Roll each page of the newspaper into a ball. Position a chair at a comfortable shooting distance from the trash can. Attempt to throw each newspaper ball into the trash can while seated on the chair.
goalSetting: The objective is to successfully throw as many newspaper balls into the trash can as possible within a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for every newspaper ball that lands in the trash can. A bonus of 2 points for making three consecutive shots. Total your points at the end of the attempt.
name: many_dummy29_1.0

taskDescription: Compose and perform a melody using the kalimba while utilizing the desk lamp as a visual metronome.
detailedSetting: Place the desk under the lamp, adjusting the lamp's brightness to a comfortable setting. Use the kalimba to play a melody while turning the lamp on and off rhythmically as a guide to maintain tempo.
goalSetting: Create a harmonious melody that synchronizes with the lamp's light pattern, producing a cohesive performance.
scoringSystem: Self-rate the performance on melody harmony, rhythm consistency, and overall creativity on a scale from 1-10. Another person, if present, can provide a secondary rating for added fun. Combine the scores for a total performance evaluation.
name: many_dummy29_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compete to stack books on a tray held in their lap while sitting on a chair, testing balance and precision.
detailedSetting: Place a chair and a tray in the center of the room. The participant sits on the chair with the tray balanced on their lap. Start with no books on the tray.
goalSetting: The objective is to stack all five books on the tray without letting any fall over or off the tray.
scoringSystem: Each successfully stacked book earns 2 points. Bonus points are awarded based on speed: stacking all five books in less than one minute earns 5 extra points. If any books fall, the stacking stops, and no further books count towards the score.
name: many_dummy30_1.0

taskDescription: The goal is to create and play a short melody on the kalimba, then write down the notes in the notebook.
detailedSetting: Place the kalimba, notebook, and pen on a desk. The participant sits at the desk, using the notebook to jot down the notes while practicing the melody on the kalimba.
goalSetting: Compose a new melody lasting at least 30 seconds and write out the notes accurately in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Scoring is based on creativity, precision, and complexity: - Creativity: Rate on a scale of 1-10. - Precision: Each correct note documented earns 1 point. - Complexity: Up to 5 bonus points for using more than three distinct note sequences. Total score is the sum of all points.
name: many_dummy30_1.0

taskDescription: Participants shoot a waste paper ball into a trash can from a seated position, aiming for the highest number of successful throws.
detailedSetting: Position a chair approximately 5 feet from the trash can. The participant sits on the chair with the waste paper ball in hand.
goalSetting: The objective is to make as many successful shots into the trash can as possible within a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot earns 1 point. The task consists of 10 attempts, so the maximum score is 10 points. A bonus of 3 points is awarded if the participant makes 5 consecutive successful shots.
name: many_dummy30_1.0

taskDescription: Participants build the tallest tower using books balanced on a tray placed on a bowl, without letting it topple over.
detailedSetting: Place the bowl upside down on a flat surface of a desk as a base. Position the tray on top of the bowl to act as a platform. Participants stack the books one by one on the tray, trying to create the tallest stable tower possible.
goalSetting: The objective is to stack all 5 books on the tray without the tower collapsing.
scoringSystem: Points are awarded based on the number of books successfully stacked: 2 points per book. If all books are stacked without toppling, an additional 5 bonus points are given. The participant with the highest points after one round wins.
name: many_human1_1.0

taskDescription: Create and play a rhythm on the kalimba within a set timeframe, judged on creativity and timing.
detailedSetting: The participant sits comfortably on the sofa with the kalimba. The clock is placed in clear view on a desk nearby to keep track of time.
goalSetting: The player must create and perform a unique rhythm on the kalimba within 3 minutes.
scoringSystem: Judges (including "Other people") score the performance on a scale from 1 to 10 based on creativity (4 points), complexity (3 points), and timing precision (3 points). The average score from all judges determines the final score.
name: many_human1_1.0

taskDescription: Compete in tossing a waste paper ball through clothes hanger hoops into a trash can target.
detailedSetting: Position the chair upside down on the floor to form a target area. Secure the clothes hangers to the legs of the chair, creating hoops. Place the trash can behind the chair, aligned with the hoops. The player stands at a designated distance.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the waste paper ball through one or both of the hanger hoops and into the trash can.
scoringSystem: Each hoop toss that successfully lands in the trash can scores 5 points. If the ball passes through both hoops and lands in the trash can, it's a total of 15 points. Three attempts per round, and the total of all rounds decides the winner.
name: many_human1_1.0

taskDescription: Players attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from various distances. The further away a successful shot is made, the higher the score.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Mark shooting points on the floor at increasing distances using objects or imaginary lines (e.g., 1 meter, 2 meters, etc.). Optionally, use a chair to adjust the height for younger or shorter players if needed.
goalSetting: Accumulate the most points by successfully getting the paper ball into the trash can from different distances.
scoringSystem: 1 point for a shot made from the closest distance, 3 points for a mid-range shot, 5 points for the furthest distance. The player with the most total points after a set number of rounds wins.
name: many_human2_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns rolling the dice to determine storytelling prompts and collaboratively create a story. The dice rolls correspond to particular words or themes the players must incorporate into their story.
detailedSetting: Each number on the dice corresponds to a story element (e.g., 1 = a wizard, 2 = a spaceship, 3 = a forest, etc.). Players roll the dice in turn and must write a segment of the story incorporating the indicated element in the notebook. The partners build on each other's segments to create a complete story.
goalSetting: Craft the most creative or entertaining story using the dice-determined elements.
scoringSystem: After completing the story, players rate each section's creativity, cohesion with previous sections, and story progression on a scale from 1 to 5. The segment with the highest average score wins.
name: many_human2_1.0

taskDescription: Players compete to build the highest tower of building blocks on a chair using both chairs and blocks. Stability and height are key factors.
detailedSetting: Set one chair upright and give each player five building blocks. Use the tray as a base to stabilize the block stack on the chair. Players try to stack the blocks as high as possible without them toppling over.
goalSetting: Construct the highest possible block tower on the chair without collapsing.
scoringSystem: 1 point for each block placed successfully. Bonus 2 points if the stack remains standing for 30 seconds after the final block is placed. The highest number of points at the end wins the challenge.
name: many_human2_1.0

taskDescription: Create a simple indoor bowling game using the paper items as pins and the waste paper ball as the bowling ball.
detailedSetting: Roll up the newspaper to create a long, stable strip and place it flat on one end of the rug. At the other end of the rug, place the two cups upside down, approximately 10 centimeters apart, representing the pins. Stand at the newspaper end and take turns rolling the waste paper ball toward the cups.
goalSetting: The goal is to knock down both cups in as few rolls as possible.
scoringSystem: Each time the player manages to knock both cups over, they earn 2 points. If only one cup is knocked down, they earn 1 point. The player with the highest score after 10 attempts wins. If two people are playing, highest combined score wins.
name: many_human3_1.0

taskDescription: Create a tower building challenge using building blocks placed on a desk.
detailedSetting: Set up a chair at the desk and place the building blocks on the desk. The participant must sit on the chair and use one hand to stack the building blocks into the tallest stable tower within one minute.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest stable tower possible within the time limit.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in centimeters. Once measured, successfully higher attempts than the last are averaged together for a final score, with the tallest attempt earning a bonus of 5 points.
name: many_human3_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compose and perform a short tune using the Kalimba, then transcribe the melody.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably with the Kalimba and use the notebook and pen to jot down notes or simple musical annotations as the participant plays. The participant plays a simple self-composed tune, writing down the sequence of notes as they play.
goalSetting: The goal is to create a melody and accurately transcribe it.
scoringSystem: The tune is scored out of 10 based on creativity (up to 5 points) and accuracy in transcription (up to 5 points). If there's another person available, they can also rate the performance for additional points or feedback.
name: many_human3_1.0

taskDescription: The player performs a short musical piece on the Kalimba, aiming to create the most pleasing melody within a limited time.
detailedSetting: Set up a chair in an open area of the room. The player will sit on the chair, with the Kalimba on their lap. The objective is to create and play an original piece or a known song for an audience of one — either the other person in the room or an imaginary audience.
goalSetting: Create a musical piece using the Kalimba and perform it, focusing on creativity and harmony.
scoringSystem: The performance is rated on a scale of 1 to 10 by the other person (if available) or by the performer themselves, based on creativity, harmony, and originality.
name: many_human4_1.0

taskDescription: The player attempts to shoot the waste paper ball into the trash can from a set distance, using bowls as obstacles.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Position the two chairs in a line about two meters away from the trash can, facing it. Place the bowl upside down on one of the chairs to create an obstacle. The player stands behind the chairs and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from behind the chairs, aiming to clear the obstacles.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can earns 1 point. A successful shot means the ball goes directly into the trash can without touching the floor. The player gets five attempts in total.
name: many_human4_1.0

taskDescription: A simple relay race where two participants take turns constructing a tower using building blocks as quickly as possible.
detailedSetting: Place the building blocks on one desk at a neutral point in the room. Both participants stand at equal distances from the desk. On "Go!", Participant 1 runs to the desk, picks a block, and starts building the tower. Participant 2 can join in turn-taking fashion until all blocks are used.
goalSetting: Work collaboratively to build the tallest stable tower with all available building blocks as quickly as possible.
scoringSystem: Time taken to build the tower is recorded. The quicker the construction without it falling, the higher the score. Each second saved earns 1 point, and a bonus of 5 points is given if the tower is stable for 10 seconds post-completion.
name: many_human4_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns stacking five building blocks on top of each other while sitting on a chair. The objective is to stack all blocks without them falling.
detailedSetting: Two chairs are placed facing each other, approximately 3 feet apart. One participant sits on each chair. The five building blocks are placed on the floor in front of each participant.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully stack all five blocks on top of each other without them toppling over.
scoringSystem: 1 point is awarded for each block successfully stacked. If all 5 blocks are stacked without collapsing, the player earns an additional 3 bonus points. The participant with the highest score after two rounds wins.
name: many_human5_1.0

taskDescription: Participants aim to throw a pillow into a basket positioned at the other end of a treadmill. The waste paper ball is used as a marker for each player's standing position.
detailedSetting: Place the treadmill in a central area. Position the basket on one end of the treadmill. Mark a standing line using the waste paper ball 3-5 feet away from the basket. Participants stand behind the line to toss their pillow into the basket.
goalSetting: The aim is to successfully throw the pillow into the basket from the marked spot.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss into the basket scores 5 points. If the pillow touches the basket but doesn't go in, 2 points are awarded. Each participant gets five attempts. The highest score wins.
name: many_human5_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create a collaborative art interpretation of music while listening to sounds produced by the kalimba. The new creation will be added to the gallery of existing paintings.
detailedSetting: Place the poster on one wall as a blank canvas. Arrange the two existing paintings on either side of the poster. One participant plays tunes on the kalimba while the other observes the paintings and creates an art piece on the poster inspired by the music.
goalSetting: The goal is to create a unique artwork on the poster influenced by the improvised kalimba music.
scoringSystem: The artwork is scored based on creativity (1-5 points) and coherence with the music (1-5 points). Both participants discuss and score each part; the maximum score is 10 points. The players switch roles after the first round to have two complete scores, encouraging collaboration and musical exploration.
name: many_human5_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns tossing a waste paper ball into a set of bowls arranged at increasing distances, with the ultimate goal of landing the ball in the trash can.
detailedSetting: Arrange four bowls in a row on the floor, each spaced about a foot apart, leading towards a trash can placed about 6 feet away from the starting line. Position a chair at the starting line for participants to sit or stand behind.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into each of the bowls in sequence and then into the trash can in the fewest attempts possible.
scoringSystem: Earn 1 point for each successful landing in a bowl, and 3 points for landing in the trash can. Deduct 1 point for each missed attempt. The player with the highest score after three rounds wins.
name: many_human6_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create a short story and accompanying sketch inspired by a roll of the dice, all under the constraint of time, while incorporating music for added creativity.
detailedSetting: Players sit comfortably on the sofa or chairs with the notebook and pen ready. Roll the dice to determine the number of sentences each story should have. Set the clock for a 15-minute creative session, during which the Kalimba is played softly to inspire creativity.
goalSetting: Write and illustrate a short story based on the randomly rolled dice number, making it engaging and creative within the time limit.
scoringSystem: Stories are scored on a scale of 1-5 for creativity, 1-5 for illustration originality, and 1-5 for completion within the time limit. The participant with the highest cumulative score wins.
name: many_human6_1.0

taskDescription: A fun scavenger hunt where clues are hidden throughout the room, leading to a final treasure hidden under the lamp with a creative twist.
detailedSetting: Place books on three chairs strategically throughout the room leading to different desks. Attach the poster with a clue to the back of one chair, and hide a final treasure (such as a piece of paper with a reward/drawing) under the lamp. The player starts at a designated starting point.
goalSetting: Follow the sequential clues hidden in the books and poster to find the final treasure hidden under the lamp as quickly as possible.
scoringSystem: Complete the hunt and find the treasure in less than 10 minutes to earn 10 points. Each additional minute reduces your score by 1 point. The quicker the treasure is found, the higher the score.
name: many_human6_1.0

taskDescription: Participants use clothes hangers to create improvised rings and take turns tossing them over the potted plant.
detailedSetting: Bend the clothes hangers into circular shapes to form rings. Place the potted plant in the center of the room as the target. Participants stand at an agreed distance from the plant and take turns tossing their rings, aiming to loop them around the plant.
goalSetting: The objective is to successfully loop the ring around the pot or a specific part of the plant.
scoringSystem: Each successful toss earns 1 point. The first participant to reach 10 points wins the game.
name: many_human7_1.0

taskDescription: Create a story with sound effects using a kalimba as a musical backdrop while reading from a book.
detailedSetting: Choose any book from the available collection and select a few pages to read. One person reads aloud while another plays the kalimba to complement the storyline with sound effects, enhancing the atmosphere.
goalSetting: The goal is to create the most captivating story experience using the book and kalimba.
scoringSystem: After the performance, the listeners rate the effectiveness of the storytelling on a scale from 1 to 10, focusing on how well the kalimba enhanced the reading. The participant with the highest average score wins.
name: many_human7_1.0

taskDescription: A modified basketball game where players take turns throwing a waste paper ball into a trash can from different distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Set up two chairs at varying distances from the trash can to serve as shooting spots. Participants take turns standing or sitting on the chairs to attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: The aim is to score as many baskets as possible in a limited number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot from the closer chair earns 1 point, and a successful shot from the farther chair earns 2 points. Each player gets 5 shots, and the player with the highest score at the end of all rounds wins.
name: many_human7_1.0

taskDescription: Players set up a mini golf course using bowls as holes and aim to get a waste paper ball into each bowl using their hands.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four bowls at varying distances from a designated starting point. The treadmill is used as a potential surface to add elevation as a "ramp," and the TV can display a timer. Players take turns rolling the waste paper ball from the start point towards a chosen bowl/hole.
goalSetting: The objective is to complete the course by rolling the ball into each bowl using the fewest attempts possible.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for each successful attempt in getting the ball into a bowl. The player with the fewest total points (attempts) after completing the course wins.
name: many_human8_1.0

taskDescription: Players compete to build the tallest stable tower using building blocks within a time limit.
detailedSetting: Set the tray on a flat surface like a desk to serve as the building area. Each player takes turns using the available blocks to build their tower. A 1-minute time limit is set per round using the clock, and building attempts are documented in the notebook.
goalSetting: Build the tallest and most stable tower within the time limit without it collapsing.
scoringSystem: Players write down the observed height of the tower using the pen and notebook. Each successful block standing counts as 1 point. If the tower collapses, points are not awarded for that round. The player with the most points after three rounds wins.
name: many_human8_1.0

taskDescription: Participants aim to toss a tennis ball onto cushions arranged as targets, using strategic placement.
detailedSetting: Place the pillows on separate chairs at varying distances. The chairs are placed around the room strategically as targets. Each player takes turns tossing the tennis ball from a designated throw line.
goalSetting: The goal is to land the tennis ball on a pillow without it bouncing off.
scoringSystem: Award 2 points if the ball lands and stays on a closer pillow, and 5 points if it lands and stays on a farther pillow. The player with the highest score after each player has had five turns wins.
name: many_human8_1.0

taskDescription: A fun and simple game of basketball played with a waste paper ball and a trash can.
detailedSetting: Place the chair at a challenging distance from the trash can. Use the waste paper ball as the basketball.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can counts as 1 point. The player has 10 attempts, with the highest score being 10.
name: many_human9_1.0

taskDescription: Create an imaginative and entertaining mystery story using headlines and snippets from a newspaper article as inspiration.
detailedSetting: Sit at one of the desks with a notebook and pen. Each participant takes turns selecting a headline or snippet from the newspaper. Use these as inspiration to build a continuous and coherent story.
goalSetting: Create a unique and compelling mystery story using all selected snippets.
scoringSystem: Both participants score the story on creativity, coherence, and entertainment value. Points from 1 to 5 are awarded in each category, with the total creating a score out of 15.
name: many_human9_1.0

taskDescription: A creative challenge where participants design a visual arrangement around the potted plant using building blocks and a tray.
detailedSetting: Place the potted plant in the center of the tray. Each participant alternates taking turns to place a building block around or on the tray, aiming to create the most aesthetically pleasing arrangement.
goalSetting: Enhance the appearance of the potted plant by creatively arranging the building blocks.
scoringSystem: Participants score each other based on creativity, stability, and visual appeal. Scores range from 1 to 10 in each category, with a total out of 30.
name: many_human9_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns tossing a tennis ball into a series of bowls placed at varying distances to score points based on difficulty.
detailedSetting: Arrange the four bowls in a line away from the participants, increasing the distance from the throwing line. Place the first bowl 3 feet away, the second bowl 5 feet, the third bowl 7 feet, and the fourth bowl 10 feet. Two chairs are used to mark the throwing line where players will sit while tossing.
goalSetting: The objective is to score as many points as possible by successfully landing the tennis ball into the bowls.
scoringSystem: Players receive 1 point for the closest bowl, 2 points for the second bowl, 3 points for the third bowl, and 5 points for the farthest bowl. Each player has three tosses per round. The highest total after a pre-agreed number of rounds wins.
name: many_human10_1.0

taskDescription: Participants test their memory by recalling and writing down snippets from each book after reading for a short period.
detailedSetting: Arrange the five books on a chair in a row beside the waste paper ball. The participant sits nearby with the notebook and pen. Each player reads one page from a book for 1 minute, then races to note down as much information as they can remember before moving to the next book.
goalSetting: To accurately recall the most details from each book and record them.
scoringSystem: Each correctly remembered fact awards the participant 1 point. Additional creativity in recalling details may receive up to 2 bonus points per book. The participant with the most points after going through all books wins.
name: many_human10_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player rolls a dice along a tray to knock over bowls arranged like bowling pins. The objective is to knock down as many bowls as possible.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to arrange four bowls at the end of the room in a triangular formation like bowling pins. Place the tray on the floor as a ramp leading towards the bowls. The waste paper ball acts as a stopper at the end of the tray. Players roll the dice along the tray, attempting to knock down the bowls.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to knock over the maximum number of bowls with a single roll of the dice.
scoringSystem: In this task, each knocked-over bowl earns the player 2 points. An additional 3 points are awarded if all bowls are knocked down in one roll. The player with the highest points after 5 rounds wins.
name: many_human11_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, players create and perform melodies using the Kalimba, writing down the musical notes and lyrics in the notebook.
detailedSetting: To start this task, sit together on the sofa with the Kalimba, notebook, and pen available. One person plays a melody on the Kalimba while the other writes the notes and adds lyrics. Each player takes turns creating a melody.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to create a catchy and original Kalimba melody with accompanying lyrics.
scoringSystem: In this task, each person rates the other’s performance from 1 to 10 based on creativity and coherence. The player with the highest total score after both have performed wins.
name: many_human11_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, players use building blocks as characters or props to create a story inspired by headlines from the newspaper. The book serves as a base for story elements.
detailedSetting: To start this task, place the building blocks and the book on a desk. The newspaper will be used to spark ideas. Players select a headline from the newspaper and create a story using the blocks as characters or props, narrating the story aloud.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to create an imaginative and engaging story using the building blocks inspired by the chosen headline.
scoringSystem: In this task, the other person rates the story from 1 to 10 based on creativity, narrative structure, and entertainment value. The participant with the highest score on a scale of 10 wins.
name: many_human11_1.0

taskDescription: Organize a mini-concert where participants create and perform a short piece using the kalimba, documenting the experience.
detailedSetting: Sit the participant and the other person comfortably on the sofa. The performer takes the kalimba while the other person can be the judge. Use the notebook and pen to jot down notes or compositions. Participants perform a piece that lasts up to 3 minutes.
goalSetting: The aim is to compose and perform a joyful short melody on the kalimba.
scoringSystem: The judge rates the performance on creativity, melody, and rhythm on a scale of 1 to 10. Maximum points possible are 30. The performer with the highest cumulative score after three rounds wins.
name: many_human12_1.0

taskDescription: Stack the blocks on the tray as high as possible using a sequence determined by a roll of the dice.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on the desk. The dice roll determines how many blocks are stacked per round. Each player takes turns rolling the dice and stacking blocks accordingly within a 1-minute time limit per turn.
goalSetting: The goal is to build the tallest and most stable tower using all the blocks available.
scoringSystem: A point is awarded for each block successfully stacked. If the tower collapses, no points are earned in that round. The player with the most points after all blocks are used wins.
name: many_human12_1.0

taskDescription: Create an exciting indoor basketball game using a waste paper ball and a trash can as the hoop.
detailedSetting: Set the trash can a few feet away from a chair acting as the free-throw line. Use the newspaper to form additional waste paper balls if needed. Participants take turns shooting from the designated spot.
goalSetting: The aim is to successfully land the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can earns 2 points. The player with the most points after five attempts wins.
name: many_human12_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns attempting to throw a waste paper ball into a trash can from a designated distance.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Position a chair at a distance of about 3 meters from the trash can. Participants take turns sitting on the chair and trying to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: The objective is to successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible within a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw counts as 1 point. Each participant has 5 attempts. The participant with the most points wins.
name: many_human13_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns playing a tune on the kalimba. The goal is to impress the judge with the longest rhythm sequence within 60 seconds.
detailedSetting: One player uses the kalimba to perform, while the other acts as the judge and uses the clock to time the performance. After 60 seconds, roles are swapped for another round.
goalSetting: Create the most impressive beat or melody within the 60-second time frame.
scoringSystem: The judge gives a score from 1 to 10 based on creativity and execution. The player with the highest score after both rounds wins.
name: many_human13_1.0

taskDescription: Individuals construct a stable tower using all available books on a tray.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on one of the desks. Each participant receives five books and is tasked to build the tallest stable tower on the tray without toppling it for at least 10 seconds.
goalSetting: Build the tallest tower possible with the five books provided.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in centimeters. The tower must remain standing for 10 seconds to qualify scoring. The tallest successful tower wins. In the event of a tie, participants may rebuild in a new round.
name: many_human13_1.0

taskDescription: Two participants take turns playing melodies on the Kalimba in a timed challenge to see who can play a recognizable or appealing tune.
detailedSetting: Both participants sit around a desk where the Kalimba is placed. The notebook and pen are used to jot down their chosen tune ideas or retain the score. Each player is given a 2-minute slot to prepare and play their melody. The other person listens and evaluates.
goalSetting: The goal is to impress the listening participant with the most appealing melody within the time frame.
scoringSystem: The listener assigns a score from 1 to 10 based on how pleasant or recognizable the melody is. The player with the highest score after both have played wins the challenge.
name: many_human14_1.0

taskDescription: Participants take turns attempting to throw a waste paper ball into a cup placed on a chair from a distance.
detailedSetting: A chair is placed in the middle of the room with a cup on its seat. Participants take turns standing at a fixed distance from the chair and try to throw the waste paper ball into the cup.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the cup more times than your opponent within a set number of attempts.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw scores 1 point. Each participant has 5 attempts. The participant with the highest score wins.
name: many_human14_1.0

taskDescription: A timed dribbling course using the basketball, maneuvering around obstacles set up in the room.
detailedSetting: Set up the lamp and pillows at different points in the room to create a mini obstacle course. The clock is used to time the participant as they dribble the basketball around the obstacles and back to the starting point.
goalSetting: Complete the dribbling course in the shortest amount of time without knocking over any obstacles.
scoringSystem: Time the participant using the clock. For each obstacle hit, add a 5-second penalty to the total time. The participant with the fastest adjusted time wins.
name: many_human14_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compose and play a simple melody on the kalimba while noting down their music sheet in a notebook.
detailedSetting: The participant sits at a desk with the kalimba on the tray in front of them. The notebook and pen are placed nearby for easy reach. The participant is to compose a melody using the kalimba and write down the music notes in the notebook.
goalSetting: Create and perform a unique melody within 10 minutes, noting it in the notebook clearly.
scoringSystem: Points are awarded based on creativity (1-5 points), complexity of the melody (1-5 points), and clarity of the notation in the notebook (1-5 points). A perfect score is 15 points.
name: many_human15_1.0

taskDescription: Two people take turns reading sections from five different books, aiming to read as many pages as possible in a set timeframe.
detailedSetting: Place two chairs facing each other in the room with a small desk in between. Stack all five books on the desk. Each person sits in a chair, selecting books to read from in turn.
goalSetting: Read the most pages out loud within the 15-minute relay session.
scoringSystem: One point per page read. The person with the most points at the end of the relay wins.
name: many_human15_1.0

taskDescription: Participants try to throw a waste paper ball into the trash can using a basketball shooting motion.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can on one side of the room. Position a chair 5 feet away from the trash can. The person sits on the chair with the waste paper ball in hand, using the basketball to simulate a shooting stance.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible in ten attempts.
scoringSystem: One point per successful shot. The maximum score is 10. Time can be recorded for tie-breakers, with the quickest to reach maximum points winning.
name: many_human15_1.0

taskDescription: Players use the building blocks to construct the tallest possible tower in a limited time.
detailedSetting: Position a desk in the center of the room as the construction site. Place all five building blocks on the desk. The player stands or sits at the desk and uses the blocks to build a tower as high as possible. Use the clock to set a 2-minute timer for each round.
goalSetting: Build the tallest tower using all five blocks before the timer runs out.
scoringSystem: Measure the height of the tower in blocks after each round. Each complete block in the height counts as 1 point. The player with the highest score after three rounds wins.
name: many_human16_1.0
