taskDescription: Players attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from a set distance.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Use the potted plant to mark a shooting line approximately 3 meters away from the trash can. Each player stands behind the line and tosses the waste paper ball to try and score a basket.
goalSetting: Score as many baskets as possible in a series of five tosses.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket is worth 2 points. The player with the most points after five tosses wins the game.
name: many_human16_1.0

taskDescription: A memory game where players remember musical notes and book titles, then match them using dice rolls.
detailedSetting: Select three books and place them on a desk. Assign a unique tune using a sequence of 3 notes on the kalimba to each book. On a notebook, write the book titles and the corresponding tunes. Roll a dice to determine the book to match (1-3), play the tune, and the player must recall and announce the correct book.
goalSetting: Correctly match the book titles with their corresponding tunes based on dice rolls.
scoringSystem: Successfully matching the book with the correct tune awards 1 point. Play until each of the three books has been matched at least twice. The player with the highest score wins.
name: many_human16_1.0

taskDescription: Two players compete in a timed chess match, using the chess clock function on a standard clock to ensure quick decision-making and increase the game's intensity.
detailedSetting: Set up the chess board on the rug for comfort. Place the clock beside the board to be visible to both players. Each player starts with a fixed amount of time on the clock, e.g., 15 minutes each. After making a move, the player must press the clock to stop their time and start the opponent's, mimicking a standard chess clock.
goalSetting: To checkmate the opponent within the allocated time, balanced by making effective moves quickly.
scoringSystem: The winner is the first to checkmate the opponent. If neither player achieves checkmate, the player with more time remaining or the most pieces (weighted system: pawns=1, minor pieces=3, rook=5, queens=9) when time runs out wins.
name: many_human17_1.0

taskDescription: A solo or two-player game where the participant must build a tower using building blocks based on dice rolls, aiming for height and stability.
detailedSetting: Place the building blocks on a desk. Roll the dice to determine how many building block pieces to add to the current stack. The dice dictates if the player places 1 or 2 blocks during their turn (1-3 means 1 block, 4-6 means 2 blocks).
goalSetting: To build the highest and most stable tower without it falling over.
scoringSystem: Each block successfully placed scores 10 points. 50 bonus points if the tower withstands a gentle nudge from the player to test its stability. The game ends when the tower falls or all blocks are used.
name: many_human17_1.0

taskDescription: A creative solo or two-player game where participants use pillows to flick a paper ball into a basket, aiming for precision and creativity.
detailedSetting: Place the basket a few meters away from the sofa. The waste paper ball starts on a pillow. The participant (or both taking turns) sits on the sofa and uses the pillow to catapult the paper ball towards the basket.
goalSetting: To successfully land the waste paper ball into the basket using only pillow flicks.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket scores 10 points. Every try receives a creativity bonus of up to 5 points, judged subjectively on style and difficulty. Highest overall score wins if playing against another.
name: many_human17_1.0

taskDescription: Two participants take turns rolling the dice to reach a target number. Each player records their scores after every roll, racing to meet or exceed the target first.
detailedSetting: Set up the notebook and pen on one of the desks to track scores. Both participants sit around the desk. The dice is rolled in the tray to keep it from rolling away.
goalSetting: The first player to reach or exceed a cumulative total of 50 points wins the game.
scoringSystem: The total of each player's rolls is recorded. The first to reach at least 50 points wins, with rounds alternating between players.
name: many_human18_1.0

taskDescription: A strategic game of chess where each player competes to checkmate the other's king following standard chess rules.
detailedSetting: Set the chessboard on a sofa-side desk. Place a chair on either side for the players. The chess pieces are arranged in the standard starting position.
goalSetting: The objective is to use strategy to put the opponent's king in checkmate before they do.
scoringSystem: The winner is the first to successfully checkmate their opponent. If the game ends in a stalemate, consider it a tie.
name: many_human18_1.0

taskDescription: Use the basketball for long-range throws into the trash can, assisted by a broom, while competing with another person tossing waste paper balls.
detailedSetting: Position the trash can at one end of the room. Stand the players at a starting line a few meters away. Each player alternates between attempting to score using the basketball and the waste paper ball, while a broom is used to retrieve or adjust the positions of missed throws to maintain game flow.
goalSetting: The goal is to score the most hits into the trash can from the designated line.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket with the basketball scores 3 points, while using the waste paper ball scores 1 point. The player with the highest score at the end of 10 rounds wins.
name: many_human18_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player creates as many stable book stacks on the desk as possible within a time limit.
detailedSetting: To start this task, place one desk in the center of the room. The goal is to use the five books to build the tallest and most stable vertical stacks on the surface of the desk. The participant records the height and stability of each stack in the notebook, using the pen for any notes or drawings.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to stack the books as high as possible without the stack falling over.
scoringSystem: In this task, each successful stack earns points based on height—1 point per book used in the stack. A bonus of 5 points is awarded for any stack that remains stable for 30 seconds. The participant's total score is the sum of points from all valid stacks.
name: many_human19_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player engages in a two-player challenge involving chess knowledge and quick reflexes.
detailedSetting: To start this task, place the chess board on the rug. One player arranges a chess puzzle on the board, and the other player must solve the puzzle while sweeping a defined area with the broom for added difficulty. Use the clock to track time.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to solve as many chess puzzles as possible within a 10-minute period while performing the broom task simultaneously.
scoringSystem: In this task, each successfully solved puzzle earns 10 points. If the player solves a puzzle in less than 3 minutes, they earn a bonus of 5 points. Total the points for a final score.
name: many_human19_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player composes a unique background tune on the kalimba while narrating a story.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the participant sits on the sofa with the kalimba. Before starting, they write a brief story outline in the notebook using the pen. Once ready, they play a continuous melody on the kalimba while narrating their story. The TV is used as a simulated "audience" to maintain focus and engagement.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to create an engaging and cohesive story accompanied by kalimba music within a 5-minute timeframe.
scoringSystem: In this task, a subjective scoring system by the set criteria: 10 points for creativity, 10 points for musical integration, and 10 points for narrative coherence. The maximum score is 30 points.
name: many_human19_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player performs a mini concert playing the kalimba, while the other person rates the performance based on creativity, rhythm, and enjoyment.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to set up a chair as a performance seat for the kalimba player. The audience, using the other chair, sits opposite the performer. The task takes place in a quiet corner of the room for the best acoustics.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is for the performer to play an engaging, 5-minute piece on the kalimba, showcasing creativity and rhythm.
scoringSystem: In this task, the audience member scores the performance on three criteria: creativity (out of 10), rhythm (out of 10), and enjoyment (out of 10). The maximum score possible is 30 points.
name: many_human20_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, the player using only one hand builds the tallest and most stable tower possible with five building blocks on the tray.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to place the tray on a desk. Start with all five building blocks next to the tray. The challenge is only to use one hand to stack the blocks on the tray within the given time.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is for the player to construct the tallest tower possible using all building blocks without it toppling within 2 minutes.
scoringSystem: In this task, measure the height of the successful standing tower in centimeters. If the tower collapses, score zero points. Stability bonus: add 5 points if the tower remains standing for an additional 30 seconds after time is called.
name: many_human20_1.0

taskDescription: In this task, participants take turns throwing a waste paper ball into a trash can from a set distance, testing accuracy and consistency.
detailedSetting: To start this task, the player needs to set up the trash can against one wall of the room. A chair is set 2 meters away from the trash can, serving as the throwing line. Each player gets five attempts using the waste paper ball shaped from the newspaper.
goalSetting: The goal of this task is to successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can from the specified distance as many times as possible in five attempts.
scoringSystem: In this task, each successful throw into the trash can scores 2 points. The player with the highest total score after all rounds wins. Ties are broken with a sudden-death throw-off.
name: many_human20_1.0

taskDescription: A fun game to test your basketball shooting skills using a waste paper ball and a trash can.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at a distance of approximately 3 meters from a chair. Sit on the chair and attempt to toss the waste paper ball into the trash can. Adjust the chair's position to increase or decrease the difficulty level.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can as many times as possible from the seated position.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can earns 1 point. You have 10 attempts, and the total score out of 10 will determine your accuracy level. A score of 8-10 is excellent, 5-7 is good, 3-4 is fair, and 0-2 needs improvement.
name: many_human21_1.0

taskDescription: This challenge involves composing and playing a short tune on the Kalimba and noting it down.
detailedSetting: Sit at a desk with the Kalimba, notebook, and pen in front of you. Spend 5 minutes creating a short tune. Once you have your tune, write down the sequence of notes in the notebook.
goalSetting: Compose a memorable and enjoyable tune on the Kalimba and successfully document it in the notebook.
scoringSystem: Rate your tune on a scale from 1-10 for creativity and enjoyment, with input from the other person in the room if available. A higher score reflects greater creativity and enjoyment.
name: many_human21_1.0

taskDescription: Engage in a series of chess matches to determine the champion of the room.
detailedSetting: Set up the chessboard on a desk and sit across from your opponent. Each player gets a turn to play one complete match. Use a clockwise or counterclockwise clock to time each player's movement if desired for added challenge.
goalSetting: Win the best out of three chess games to become the room's chess champion.
scoringSystem: Each game won awards 1 point. The first player to accumulate 2 points is declared the winner of the mini-tournament. If both players win a game and the third game is a draw, a bonus quick match determines the winner, with each player given 3 minutes for all moves.
name: many_human21_1.0

taskDescription: Participants will take turns throwing a waste paper ball into a basket using a pillow to launch it.
detailedSetting: Place one pillow on the floor next to a participant. Set the basket approximately 5 feet away on top of the rug. The other participant places the waste paper ball on the pillow and uses the ends of the pillow to launch the ball towards the basket.
goalSetting: The goal is to land the waste paper ball into the basket using the pillow. Each successful throw awards points.
scoringSystem: Each successful basket earns the participant 3 points. The participant with the highest score after 5 rounds wins.
name: many_human22_1.0

taskDescription: Participants compete to build the tallest stable tower using building blocks and cups within a limited time.
detailedSetting: Set up the tray on one of the desks. Each participant has access to 5 building blocks and 2 cups. The task is to use these items creatively to build a tall and stable structure.
goalSetting: Construct the tallest tower possible without it toppling over by the end of the time limit.
scoringSystem: Participants have 2 minutes to build their towers. Measure the height of each completed tower and award 1 point per inch of stable tower. The participant with the highest score wins.
name: many_human22_1.0

taskDescription: Create and perform an original melody using the kalimba, then write down the composition in the notebook.
detailedSetting: One participant plays the kalimba while seated at a desk, experimenting with notes and rhythms. They then write down important notes or melody sequences they want to remember in the notebook using the pen.
goalSetting: Compose a short melody and successfully transcribe it into the notebook. Pay attention to rhythm and note sequences.
scoringSystem: The composition will be played once completed. Another participant or judge will rate the melody's creativity and clarity on a scale from 1 to 10. The higher the score, the better the performance.
name: many_human22_1.0

taskDescription: A two-person reading relay race where participants read aloud alternately from different books placed around the room.
detailedSetting: Position five books around the room, each next to a chair where participants will sit while reading. The two participants will start at opposite corners of the room. When the first person finishes reading a page from a book, they signal the other person to read from another book, seated at the next nearest chair.
goalSetting: The goal is to finish reading all five pages from the five books first.
scoringSystem: The first person to read all five book pages aloud correctly wins the relay and scores 5 points. If both participants finish at the same time, clarity and expressiveness of reading determine the winner, rated on a 1-5 scale by personal judgment.
name: many_human23_1.0

taskDescription: Players stack building blocks on a tray balanced on a pillow and try to achieve the highest stack without toppling it.
detailedSetting: Place two pillows on the floor to form a base, then place a tray on top of the pillows. One player will attempt to stack all five building blocks on the tray without causing it to fall over.
goalSetting: Successfully balance all blocks without the tray or blocks falling.
scoringSystem: Each block successfully placed adds 1 point. Maximum achievable points per round are 5. The session can include multiple rounds, and the highest total score determines the winner.
name: many_human23_1.0

taskDescription: Roll the dice to determine how far from the trash can you will attempt to throw a basketball or paper ball.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. The player rolls the dice to determine the distance (2, 4, 6 feet, etc., based on a 1-feet equivalent per point on the dice). Attempt to throw either the basketball or paper ball into the trash can from the designated distance.
goalSetting: Successfully score into the trash can from the predetermined distance.
scoringSystem: Successfully scoring a shot equals the points rolled on the dice (e.g., a successful 4-feet throw equals 4 points). The total score is calculated over five rounds. The maximum score after five rounds determines the winner.
name: many_human23_1.0

taskDescription: Test your aim and coordination by trying to toss the basketball into the tray from a set distance.
detailedSetting: Place the tray on one chair across the room, ensuring it is stable. Set another chair at a designated throw line that is about 6 feet away from the tray. Sit on this chair to throw the basketball, taking turns if playing with another person.
goalSetting: Successfully toss the basketball into the tray as many times as possible within 5 attempts.
scoringSystem: Award 1 point for each successful shot where the basketball lands and stays in the tray. The player with the most points after all attempts wins.
name: many_human24_1.0

taskDescription: A precision game where you and a partner take turns building the tallest tower of blocks on a tray situated on the sofa without toppling over.
detailedSetting: Sit comfortably on the sofa and place the tray securely on the seat between you and the other participant. Use the building blocks to construct the highest tower possible on the tray.
goalSetting: Build the tallest and most stable tower using all the blocks without it falling over within your turn of 2 minutes.
scoringSystem: Each successfully added block to the tower adds 2 points. If the tower collapses, you score only points for the blocks before it fell. The participant with the highest score at the end of the game wins.
name: many_human24_1.0

taskDescription: Engage in a mini-bowling game using household items, aiming to knock over the bowls set on a rug with a tennis ball.
detailedSetting: Arrange the 4 bowls in a diamond formation at one end of the rug. Use two pillows to create a lane leading up to the bowls. Stand at the opposite end of the rug to roll the tennis ball.
goalSetting: Use the tennis ball to knock over as many bowls as possible in two attempts per turn.
scoringSystem: 1 point is awarded for each bowl knocked over. After three rounds, tally the scores. The player with the most points at the end of all rounds wins the game.
name: many_human24_1.0

taskDescription: Use the waste paper ball to score points by tossing it into the trash can, using the newspaper as a distracting barrier.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at one end of the room. Unfold the newspaper and hold it in front of the trash can, allowing it to act as a visual disturbance. Stand a specific distance away (about 3 meters if possible) and attempt to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Successfully throw the waste paper ball into the trash can through the newspaper barrier.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw is worth 3 points. Use five attempts; the maximum score is 15 points.
name: many_human25_1.0

taskDescription: Roll the dice to determine the number of different notes to use in creating a short melody, then compose and perform it using the kalimba.
detailedSetting: Sit with the kalimba, notebook, and pen at a desk. Roll the dice to determine the number of notes (up to 6, corresponding to numbers 1 through 6). Using the notebook and pen, write down and compose a short melody using the specified number of notes on the kalimba, and then perform it.
goalSetting: Create and perform a coherent melody using the number of notes dictated by the dice roll.
scoringSystem: Each melody is judged on creativity (1-5 points), coherence (1-5 points), and performance quality (1-5 points). The maximum score is 15 points.
name: many_human25_1.0

taskDescription: Balance various items on a stack of chairs to create a stable tower without toppling it.
detailedSetting: Stack the chairs in an interlocking manner to form a stable base. Carefully place the pillows on the top chair, then try to balance the tray by setting the cups on it without falling. Adjust items for balance and height.
goalSetting: Successfully balance the items without any of them falling over.
scoringSystem: Successfully stacked tower without any falls earns 10 points. Lost 2 points for each item that falls. A perfect tower remains at 10 points maximum.
name: many_human25_1.0

taskDescription: Test your aim by tossing a paper ball into a trash can from various distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can at a starting distance of 1 meter from where you will stand. The participant stands on a stable surface and attempts to throw the waste paper ball into the trash can. After each successful toss, the participant moves back one step, increasing the distance for the next throw.
goalSetting: The goal is to successfully toss the paper ball into the trash can from the greatest distance possible.
scoringSystem: Points are awarded based on successful toss distances: 1 point for tosses at 1-meter increments. The person with the most points after five attempts wins.
name: many_human26_1.0

taskDescription: Play a short serenade on the kalimba and get scored by the other person on creativity and melody.
detailedSetting: The participant uses the kalimba to create a short 2-minute melody. The other person listens attentively. The kalimba player can sit on a chair or the sofa for comfort.
goalSetting: The goal is to entertain and impress the listener with a creative and harmonious melody.
scoringSystem: The listener scores the performance on a scale of 1-10, considering creativity and melody smoothness. Total points determine feedback level: 1-3: Needs Improvement, 4-6: Satisfactory, 7-9: Good, 10: Excellent.
name: many_human26_1.0

taskDescription: Challenge yourself to cover the maximum distance possible on the treadmill within a set time.
detailedSetting: Set up the treadmill and clock nearby to make it easy to monitor the time. The participant sets the treadmill to a comfortable jogging pace and starts running when the clock starts, aiming to cover the maximum distance in 10 minutes.
goalSetting: The goal is to cover as much distance as possible on the treadmill in 10 minutes.
scoringSystem: Distance covered is recorded, and the score is given as the total kilometers run. The goal is to exceed previous attempts or predetermined benchmarks for personal improvement.
name: many_human26_1.0

taskDescription: Engage in a strategic game of chess where each player races against the clock to make their move before time runs out.
detailedSetting: Place the chess board on a desk with the clock positioned next to it. Players sit on opposite sides of the desk, and the clock is set with a 5-minute timer for each turn.
goalSetting: The objective is to checkmate the opponent within the assigned time limits for each move.
scoringSystem: Players receive 10 points for each successful move made within the time limit. The player who checkmates the opponent receives an additional 50 points. If time runs out, 5 points are deducted per exceeded minute.
name: many_human27_1.0

taskDescription: Test your dexterity by creating freestanding towers with building blocks on a tray.
detailedSetting: Position a tray on a desk and start building a tower using the provided building blocks. The challenge is to stack the blocks as high as possible without any block falling from the tower or the tray.
goalSetting: Construct the tallest tower possible using all 5 building blocks without it toppling over.
scoringSystem: Each block successfully placed on the tower earns 10 points. If the tower remains standing for 30 seconds after the last block is placed, gain an additional 20 points. A collapsed tower deducts 5 points per fallen block.
name: many_human27_1.0

taskDescription: Share the joy of storytelling by reading aloud and discussing a book with another person in a cozy setup.
detailedSetting: Place the pillows on the sofa for comfort. Both participants sit together, and one person reads aloud from the selected book. Participants engage in a brief discussion after each chapter.
goalSetting: Enjoy a shared reading experience and discuss the story to deepen understanding and connection.
scoringSystem: Each chapter read aloud earns 5 points. Bonus points (5 per session) are awarded for insightful discussions that enhance understanding of the book's themes or characters. Both participants score individually.
name: many_human27_1.0

taskDescription: The participant uses the Kalimba to play soothing melodies while seated comfortably, aiming to reach a state of relaxation and mental clarity.
detailedSetting: The participant sits on the sofa with a pillow for back support, holding the Kalimba in their hands. The participant can choose to close their eyes or focus on a calming mental image as they play.
goalSetting: The goal is to relax and experience tranquility by playing the Kalimba, using music as a meditative exercise.
scoringSystem: After a 10-minute session, the participant rates their relaxation level on a scale from 1 to 10, with 10 being extremely relaxed and 1 being not relaxed. Higher scores indicate a more successful session.
name: many_human28_1.0

taskDescription: The participant practices shooting a waste paper ball into a trash can, using chairs as obstacles to increase the challenge.
detailedSetting: The trash can is placed at one end of the room. Two chairs are strategically placed between the participant and the trash can to serve as obstacles. The participant stands at the opposite end and attempts to shoot the waste paper ball into the trash can.
goalSetting: The goal is to score as many successful shots into the trash can as possible in five rounds.
scoringSystem: Each successful shot into the trash can is worth 2 points. The participant has five attempts, and the total score is tallied to determine the participant's performance.
name: many_human28_1.0

taskDescription: Participants use books and building blocks to construct a structure on the rug, focusing on creativity and stability.
detailedSetting: Participants sit on the rug, using the three books and five building blocks to create a free-standing structure. The structure must stand without assistance for at least one minute.
goalSetting: The goal is to build a creatively designed and stable structure using the available items.
scoringSystem: The structure is rated based on stability (0-5 points), creativity (0-5 points), and aesthetics (0-5 points). The maximum possible score is 15, with higher scores indicating an impressive architectural design.
name: many_human28_1.0

taskDescription: Players take turns trying to throw the basketball into the trash can from a distance.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can on one side of the room. Mark a line on the floor with an object such as the newspaper—a few meters away from the trash can. Players must stand behind the line and aim to throw the basketball into the trash can.
goalSetting: Score points by successfully getting the basketball into the trash can.
scoringSystem: Each successful throw into the trash can gives the player 1 point. Best of five throws determines the winner.
name: many_human29_1.0

taskDescription: A player composes a short melody using the Kalimba within a specific time.
detailedSetting: The player sits comfortably on a chair with the Kalimba and uses the notebook and pen to jot down notes or lyrics. The participant has 10 minutes to create a short song or melody.
goalSetting: Compose and play a unique melody within the allotted time.
scoringSystem: Both players, if present, rate the melody on a scale of 1 to 10 based on creativity and originality. The score is an average of the ratings.
name: many_human29_1.0

taskDescription: Use the building blocks to construct a structure or design on the tray, inspired by one or more books.
detailedSetting: Lay the tray on the desk. Arrange books around the tray for inspiration. Use the 5 building blocks to create a structure on the tray within 15 minutes, drawing inspiration from the books' themes or covers.
goalSetting: Create an imaginative structure using all available blocks.
scoringSystem: After time is up, evaluate the construction on creativity and resemblance to the book theme on a scale from 1 to 10. Additional points for using all blocks effectively. Average the scores to determine the winner.
name: many_human29_1.0

taskDescription: Participants create a balanced structure using the available books and pillows and try to maintain it without collapsing.
detailedSetting: Place the pillows flat on the floor as the base. Stack the 5 books one on top of the other on the pillows to create a tower. Participants can adjust the placement of the books to achieve stability.
goalSetting: The goal is to achieve the most stable book tower on the pillows, for the longest duration without toppling.
scoringSystem: Each second the structure remains standing counts as 1 point. The player with the highest time score wins.
name: many_human30_1.0

taskDescription: Participants aim to throw the tennis ball and waste paper ball into the trash can from specified distances.
detailedSetting: Place the trash can in the middle of the room. Use the waste paper ball for practice shots, and aim to land the tennis ball in the trash can from different distances marked with items (e.g., books or pillows) at increasing increments from the can.
goalSetting: To throw either the tennis ball or the waste paper ball accurately into the trash can from varying distances.
scoringSystem: 1 point for every successful throw of the waste paper ball, 3 points for the tennis ball. Bonus of 5 points for consecutive successful throws from the farthest distance.
name: many_human30_1.0

taskDescription: Two players engage in a timed chess match, where they must complete their turn within a limited time.
detailedSetting: Set up the chess board with the pieces in their starting positions. Use the clock to time each player's turns, setting a maximum of 1 minute per move.
goalSetting: To checkmate the opponent while adhering to the time constraint.
scoringSystem: Each successful move within the time limit receives 1 point. Checkmating the opponent adds a bonus of 10 points. The player with the most points when the game ends is declared the winner. If no checkmate occurs, the player with the higher score wins.
name: many_human30_1.0
